One thing's for sure: the ring must not stop turning under any circumstances. Be very careful, the state of the entire Krosmoz may well depend on the piece of jewellery wrapped around your finger.

name: Nomarow's Getas
description: Nomarow is the unbeatable champion of skullcrushing. When he chucks on these getas, you'll want to hope you don't come across him.

name: Copper Nickus Ring
description: Copper Nickus was a heretic polymath who dared to suggest that the World of Twelve wasn't at the centre of the Krosmoz. No traces of his body were ever found, and this ring is his only surviving relic. Wear it with care.

name: Kan-O-Mat Amulet
description: The reverse of this amulet can be opened up to reveal a secret compartment. It looks like you've got washing powder for your Kan-O-Mat Cloak hidden in yours.

name: Antumband
description: This ring will give you the amazing power to control your own shadow: it will follow you and exactingly mimic you! This sales pitch probably won't convince many.

name: Broucey Bark
description: Used by Brouce Boulgoure himself when he was looking for a Rescue Board.

name: iKwest Amulet
description: This next-generation amulet will let you look at your quests from a new angle. You'll love exploring far-off lands and helping the inhabitants. And what's more, it glows in the dark!

name: Benj Boots
description: These shoes are ancient relics imbued with deathly powers. It's probably worth noting it's not been established who the powers affect: the wearer or his target?

name: Fuji Snowfoux Headgear
description: With this headgear on, you can be sure to attract all the Maho Snowfoux during mating season. It's up to you to decide whether that's a good thing or not.

name: Ogivol's Belt
description: The arthritic punishment chosen by Xelor means that every passing day sees Ogivol Scalarcin's bones move a little bit further apart. This belt was pretty handy as it held all his bones in place when he was trying to dance the Kamarena.

name: Upcykld
description: Designed to protect the skull, this hat was used as a shield by an adventurer who was hard-headed enough that he didn't need extra protection.

name: Round Kimbo Sandals
description: Only Kimbos, with their weird feet, feel comfortable in these sandals. However, they're not the only ones who can benefit from their powers. But be careful not to wear them the wrong way!

name: Professor Xa's Amulet
description: Don't be fooled by this amulet's ordinary appearance, as it is actually the key to the secret store of Professor Xa's favourite cereal, Cerebios.

name: Sylargh's Strap
description: This isn't really Sylargh's belt, it would be much too big for him. His is actually a rather simple affair, crafted from a single strap and a gearwheel, the Imp's tools of the trade. I bet you paid a fortune for this knockoff, didn't you?

name: Sawya Sash
description: This belt isn't hiding much. It's a perfectly normal belt in all respects. It does a decent job of keeping your pants up, and it's even fairly stylish. Sometimes, that's all you need.

name: Spitshiners
description: Licking these boots will drastically increase your saliva production, giving you more than enough spit to shine your shoes, clean countless children's faces, and do a lot whatever else you might normally use spit for.

name: Sleet Ring
description: "Notes on Dragons: teeth (huge), claws (sharp), breath (burning), greed (phenomenal). Some Dragons can predict the weather. But a dragon is more cumbersome than a frog". Where did Count Harebourg get all this information from?

name: Somnambulist's Nightcap
description: Sleepy, lazy, nonchalant, bone idle - all adjectives that can be applied to the wearer of this hat. Mind you, it will certainly lull people into a false sense of security. Your enemies will lower their guard, monsters will ignore you and attack your friends instead, people will treat you like a layabout, you won't be able to find any work, your partner will leave you, everyone will forget about you. And it seemed like such a good idea to wear it at the time :(

name: Nevark's Belt
description: They say that whoever wears this belt becomes capable of hitting a Moskito in flight from three kilokametres away. It is, however, unadvisable to walk through a shooting range with this accessory around your waist.

name: Antyklime Ax's Boots
description: These boots tend to leave black marks on the carpets and tiles, which will frustrate your house staff no end. Unless they're Goblins, of course.

name: The King of Bonta's Pants
description: Some narrow-minded historians claim that Bonta has never had a monarch. Here is the irrefutable proof that they're wrong. In-depth studies of the fabric seem to confirm that the royal pants were worn on the head as well as on the buttock, which made them very useful for diplomatic meetings gone wrong.

name: Smelted Belt
description: When it was first made, this belt didn't look Vulkanian enough for anyone's taste. Without further ado, it was smelted, soaked in tourist blood three times in a row, covered in soot and riddled with holes to make it look "worn-in". Oh, the whims of fashion.

name: Barbring
description: While not very useful for many tasks, it's incredibly handy for a select few. For example, in combat, it makes your punches that much more effective. Outside of battle, you'll have all the usefulness of a fork without needing to actually carry one. Where would we be without such gadgets?

name: Nitekap
description:
"This helmet will make your sense of smell 10 times as powerful!"
Notice: The markings on this helmet are for decoration. This helmet does not incorporate eye holes.
Consumer warning: This helmet renders the wearer blind. Increased olfactory capacity has been proven to be fatal under certain circumstances. Avoid Bworks and public restrooms.

name: Count Razof's Belt
description: Among all Count Razof's trophies, the Boar whose remains embellish this belt hold a special place in his heart: it was his first victim. It was a very aggressive Boar that was threatening farmers near Bonta.

name: Celestial Bearbarian Belt
description: There are a few Frigostian hunters who claim to have seen the Celestial Bearbarian actually slip this belt up over his paunch, but they're the same hunters who claim to have seen a YeCh'Ti on Frigost.

name: Celestial Bearbarian Headdress
description: These leaves are bigger than any found so far in the area around Mount Scauldron, which is why the headdress is so rare.

name: Hel Munster's Amulet
description: The precious jewel in this amulet contains a Quadramental Breeze digest and that is exactly what is wrong with it. To be able to fully benefit from its magical powers, you'll need to free the Breeze, but only a blonde, beautiful, intelligent woman with a good chest and sense of direction can do it. Otherwise, get used to its basic powers.

name: Usia Sandals
description: Usia Sandals conjure up thoughts of happy summer holidays, with the sun beating down on an endless sandy beach and the sea as warm as bathwater. It's a shame that in Amakna, everywhere like that is overrun with bloodthirsty monsters, or, even worse, with tourists.

name: Hail Cape
description: "This cape is supposed to protect the wearer from the dreams and illusions of the ethereal dimension. Does it really work? We would need to be able to come and go through the dimensions to get to the bottom of it. Apart from Magus Ax on his good days (or the days when he's had a drink or two), not many people have ever boasted about doing so." - A quote from Count Harebourg.

name: Seven Years Bad Luck
description: This shield is made of a very fragile mirror. It won't protect you against much of anything at all, but if your opponent breaks it, you can be sure they'll suffer seven years bad luck. Or at least, that's what you can tell yourself after your humiliating defeat.

name: Anium Ligature
description: This belt, which radiates fluorescent green light, will cause any flowers around you to wilt, will make your summons look original, and will kill your enemies (very) slowly. Guaranteed for 4.47 billion years.

name: Al Pinist's Boots
description: These boots have one serious design flaw: they may be perfect for climbing the highest peaks of Frigost, but they're nothing more than heavily-soled socks, and your toes may well fall off if you attempt to climb Mount Scauldron wearing them. They're still great for inflicting very painful low blows on your opponents.

name: Professor Xa's Cloak
description: This cloak may not be very elaborate, but it was enchanted by the great Magus Ax to always billow heroically, even when there's no wind. This means it's perfect for show-offs, although Professor Xa really chose it because he knew it wouldn't get stuck in his wheels.

name: Kralomansion
description: This scary amulet was hidden away in a remote mansion for ages. When it was alive, it used to dream of travelling around the World and all the places it would see. In the end, the only place it got to go around is your neck, the poor thing!

name: Fuji Snowfoux Boots
description: Snowfoux leather is known to be extremely resistant, but its unbearable odour tends to put off even the most seasoned shoemakers. Using Fuji Snowfoux leather helps a bit with this problem, but watch out, as there may be other side effects...

name: Broucey Belt
description: This belt was made so that Brouce Boulgoure could properly sway his hips whilst singing his favourite chorus: "Tsamina mina eh eh, Wabbit Wabbit eh eh, tsamina mina zangelewa, anawa aa, this time for Amakna".

name: Danathor's Amulet
description: On the base of this amulet is an abrasive rock that will epilate the entire abdomen of its wearer. The merchant that sold it to you must have forgotten to warn you not to sleep with it on.

name: Lethaline's Belt
description: Lethaline Sigisbul is an Astrubian mercenary with no scruples. She sells her services to whoever is offering the best price. The size of your pouch shows that you're out of the running, my friend.

name: Nevark's Amulet
description: The tooth that adorns this amulet was ripped from the mouth of a legendary monster. Was it a dragon? A YeCh'Ti? A mother-in-law? Only Nevark knows and he'll take it with him to the grave.

name: Quartzovski Crystal
description: The metaphysical properties of this expensive crystal allow it to light up in the presence of arsenic. You'll be able to use it as a halogen lamp the next time your alliance has a banquet!

name: Awmigawd Band
description: This ring takes its strange name from the exclamation of surprise it draws from young adventurers who see it for the first time, an exclamation among others such as "zomghax", "do want" and "kill self vs wall". The inhabitants of the World of Twelve move in mysterious ways.

name: Lethaline's Cloak
description: This cloak makes its wearer invisible, as soon as he hides in a dark cupboard. For extra stealth, move around with said dark cupboard.

name: Hel Munster's Cape
description: When Hel Munster asked his master how he could fight against the cold, he responded that the answer was in the pages of his spell book. So he pulled out the pages one by one and sewed them together to make this original cape.

name: Kolosso Helmet
description: Have you heard the expression "a face like a slapped arse"? No? Take a look in the mirror.

name: Professor Xa's Boots
description: The shoemaker who made these boots was the kind of guy who always had some kind of tasteless practical joke up his sleeve. Professor Xa fired him on the spot and swore never to wear the shoes.

name: Four-Leaf
description: Four's a good number. A lot of things come in fours: seasons, doors, tops, lokos, squares… Most say the elements do too, but some rumours say there's a fifth one.

name: Amulethal
description: Since the Chassulliers aren't really sensitive, they slip this ring on just before dealing the final blow to their prey.

name: Fuji Snowfoux Cloak
description: Given the unhealthy amount of fur growing on Fuji Snowfoux's back, the small fraction needed for this cloak isn't going to make much difference to her body mass.

name: Antyklime Ax's Amulet
description: According to the legend, this amulet can erase all the mistakes you might have made as an adventurer. In your case, you'll probably need a few of them.

name: Ogivol's Helmet
description: Ogivol Scalarcin's generally aggressive temper led him to steal everything he came across and he was eventually condemned to six months' imprisonment for contempt of authority. Young Astrubians, however, see him as a modern hero, a revolutionary and a free thinker who stands up for the right to indefinite borrowing of other people's property.

name: Count Razof's Slippers
description: The Hunters who arrived on Mishell Island weren't expecting such a show. Some even overdosed on all the colours and had to leave early. As for Count Razof, he got so accustomed to all the lively colours that he even went as far as incorporating them into his own wardrobe.

name: Sleet Amulet
description: A votive amulet dedicated to the worship of a forgotten goddess. It has "Protect your brothers and sisters" engraved around its edge. Well, that's goddesses for you, I guess. Always pampering spoilt brats. And what if we haven't got a brother or a sister? What are we supposed to do then, huh?

name: Fuji Snowfoux Ring
description: Before she gave birth to the Snowfoux, Fuji Snowfoux used to wear this ring as a belt. Nowadays, it fits her podgy fingers perfectly. It'll fit yours too.

name: Otomai's Boots
description: These boots, which used to belong to Otomai, the renowned alchemist, have sponge soles useful for absorbing and cleaning up liquids spilt on laboratory floors. They're a little heavy, but take it in your stride and it will save you paying a cleaner each month. Return on investment guaranteed within 248 years.

name: Shelld
description: This shield can resist any attack except, apparently, whatever weapon was used to kill the poor creature that thought it was protected by this shell.

name: Stringsecticide
description: As its name suggests, this string assassinates any flies that get too close to your sweet spots. Just one piece of advice - never, ever pull it off a loved one with your teeth.

name: Collide-O-Scopes
description: This pince-nez guarantees that you'll bump into a lot more people than you used to. Too bad you feel absolutely no need to be sociable any more, what with the beautiful, shimmering, fragmented view of the world you're discovering.

name: Allister's Boots
description: Allister used to hide his secret forceps in these boots. Rumour has it he used them to offer a helping hand when any of his Gobballs ever had trapped wind. He kept it for many years, and word on the street is that when he became King he used it on himself after the great feasts held in the Castle of Amakna!

name: Professor Xa's Ring
description: It's said that Professor Xa, who's well known for being a skinflint, created this ring using a bolt that fell off his chair.

name: Inky Veil
description: This strange cape seems to be made of black ink, but oddly enough, it behaves just like fabric - it doesn't run. As for stains, well, that's another matter. Your backside will never be clean again.

name: Proplr Shield
description: You can use this shield's propeller to mess up your enemy's hair and get in an attack of opportunity while they're fixing it.

name: Locksmith Shield
description: This shield is a good pick to keep you from becoming a skeleton.

name: Hail Boots
description: "The wearer of these boots held a grudge against a Dragon. Don't be like him, and make sure you give Dragons the ancestral respect they deserve. And remember that Dragons are big. Very big. And they have no sense of humour."- A quote from Count Harebourg

name: Kolosso Ring
description: Piautre was born on an old collective farm on Frigost, near the Frozen Lake. He created this ring thinking he'd managed to reinvent the finger-mounted lawn strimmer. He only cut his hand 3 times.

name: Deadly Night Cape
description: One more glass for the road? Ah, well, roads are long and nights are short, so this cape is usually used to keep the barflies warm as they finish their endless rounds of night caps. It'll kill them in the end, you know.

name: Batouta Helmet
description: This beautiful helmet holds its fair share of secrets. For many years before it died, it was the Bworker's only companion. While it was still alive, he told it many stories about used protectives. It was having to listen to these atrocities that led to the helmet's death.

name: Head Band
description: This cold, slimy ring never stops sucking on your finger from the minute you slip it on. If you can see past its flaws, however, its great powers are yours to wield.

name: Amunita
description: This jewel is so powerful that it'd kill a Moskito from 30 paces, if only its smell didn't prevent anything from getting that close!

name: Borealis's Boots
description: Enamoured by her project of creating a hotel completely surrounded by ice, Aurora's boots were specially designed to keep her delicate feet from the cold. As far as not slipping is concerned, there's still work to be done.

name: Sleet Helmet
description: "In case of disturbance in the astral veil, pull this over your head pretty quickly". A safety note engraved by Count Harebourg himself! You don't know what an astral veil is, but having slipped this out-of-the-ordinary hat onto your not-quite-as-out-of-the-ordinary head, you're ready to race off on an adventure, or into a wall!

name: Colette's Ring
description: A young Cra named Colette lost her head in Eltneg Wood. The poor girl stepped in the way of Brouce Boulgoure's hatchet, which he threw thinking she was a giant fern. Lucky she didn't live – she would have died had she found out she looked like a giant fern.

name: Danathor's Belt
description: Danathor was chosen by Jiva to be Steward of Bonta. He was such a bent and manipulating fellow, however, that the populace thought that he'd have been much better suited to Brakmar.

name: Kolosso Belt
description: This fur-covered belt keeps your thighs warm, which should melt your love handles a little faster.

name: Bewitched Band
description: This extremely powerful ring will allow you to manipulate the person who wears it like a puppet. Now's the perfect time for you to save your marriage.

name: Borealis's Headgear
description: Thanks to her aristocratic upbringing, Aurora was horrified when she saw the hat the head tailor had made for her - he was dismissed immediately. Since Frigost froze over, though, it seems that he's got his job back.

name: Ogivol's Cloak
description: It's hard to tell whether the bones that make up Ogivol Scalarcin's Cloak are those of victims or just spare parts for the arthritic Sram.

name: Fungal Ring
description: If your enemies are allergic to mushrooms, let them nibble your fingers.

name: Odourless Boots
description: The shoemaker who designed these boots was very innovative. He covered them with many small holes so that unpleasant odours could escape rather than gather in the boots themselves. As a result, you stink to high heaven, but your boots don't smell in the slightest.

name: Sinuous Amulet
description:
Two copies of this root-containing amulet were created by an eminent Frigostian biologist, and were supposed to help the inhabitants of the Snowbound Village rid themselves of the vegetal creatures from the Petrified Forest.
The biologist disappeared without leaving any kind of instructions as to how to use them, and his son, who went off to find him, never found a single trace. The Frigostian islanders tried to recreate the effects of the two amulets and what you have in your hands is only a rough copy of the original.

name: Chee Cape
description: The story goes that the Bworker sewed this cape from Rushu's butt skin. The story would be entirely believable if the Bworker actually knew how to sew.

name: Eroclite Amulet
description: The jeweller who created this amulet was a little mad, and put it together without any respect for the basic rules of Frigostian jewellery, using individual components each more different than the last. By some unknown miracle, he was quite successful.

name: Cawwot Wound
description: This giant Cawwot slice can absorb numerous magic attacks, but won't hold up for long against nibbling Wabbits.

name: Borealis's Belt
description: Aurora addresses a huge importance to watching her figure, and measures the length of the cords hanging from her belt every morning. So far, nobody has dared to tell her that leather stretches with time...

name: Ougaabelt
description:
The tag on this belt says 'Sorry, but if you're looking for a way to get Ougaa's power, this belt is not for you.'
Well that's just great, isn't it.

name: Memori Amulet
description: When a certain Captain Chafer met the Bworker for the first time, he took the liberty of saying 'Wow, is that your backside or is it your face?' Nobody has seen the good Captain, or his famous moulded underwear, since. This amulet was created in his memory.

name: Pierced Boots
description: A long, long time ago, Danous Kwaide wanted to be clever and beat the Bworker in a baiting contest: "Your boots are covered with earrings because you're too stupid to realise that you're not supposed to put boots in your ears", he teased. The Bworker replied by crushing Danous' skull with his axe. Do you blame him? Do you even understand what Danous was going on about? No, neither do I.

name: Mischief Hat
description: Formerly worn by disreputable Frigostian men, this hat has now become an indispensable fashion item. On the label you can read: "This hat will attract all manner of wild creatures that want your body rather than your gold." It is not clear whether these are female Frigostians from Frigost Village or the creatures that inhabit the forests.

name: Borealis's Band
description: Despite the fact that this is composed of a very rare mineral, only found in certain volcanic Fangs of Glass mines, and that it supposedly required several years of polishing, Waldos FieldChester Potcobble still never had the guts to offer it to Aurora Borealis.

name: KOs’ Belt
description: The Warrior of KOs wore this belt to show everyone he was the KO Champion. Now that it belongs to you, it’s your turn to show off!

name: Turbine Belt
description: Whether you're standing in a breeze, or wading through a strong current, you'll generate an enormous amount of energy wearing this belt. What you do with it is up to you.

name: Mush Ombrero
description: Take a Dora, cover it in Gobball Slobber and Iop sweat, let it stew for a couple of weeks and you'll get an idea of the intoxicating effects of the Mush Ombrero. Try to stay away from heavy machinery while you wear it. In fact, stay away from anything that's heavy.

name: Korriander Amulet
description:
This amulet was very fashionable on Frigost.
Several centuries ago.

name: Necrotick Cape
description: Necroticks recognize their allies primarily by their smell, and this cape is soaked with it. The only problem is that the odour it gives off is a direct result of the powerful poisons coming from it. Use it at your own risk.

name: Bherbal Bherb Belt
description: When the Bherb has got butterflies, he wears his Bherbal belt and healthily eliminates them.

name: Rough Lee Robe
description: This very rough creation has no shape as such, no aesthetic appeal at all, and looks like it would fall to pieces at the slightest touch. It is, however, extremely powerful. I bet you didn't see that coming.

name: Dremoan Cape
description: With this cape equipped, you can proudly show that you defeated the biggest menace in the petrified forest. But be careful not to keep it on your back too long – nobody really knows what Dremoan is made of, and it could be dangerous.

name: Ragoat
description: If there wasn't so much mould on this rag, it would make a great tablecloth. Not to worry, you can always dry the dishes with it when your guests aren't watching.

name: Biibl Belt
description: This belt is used in the feast of the Dofus eggs which celebrates the gift of the six eggs, as recorded in the Biibl, an ancient text written by a Bontarian Joiner. Most people just paint ordinary eggs to look like Dofus and give them to one another, but some go a bit further, wearing this painful belt for the forty days and nights which precede the feast.

name: KOs’ Amulet
description: According to legend, this amulet is supposed to protect its wearer from all sorts of possible death scenarios. But considering what you did to its last owner, it’s probably just a false rumour.

name: Ougaamulet
description: This rough copy of the great Ougaa should be worn around the neck, with a hungry stare and a well-kept beard to boot.

name: Spore Boots
description: Contrary to popular misconception, the holes in these shoes are not there to let your feet breathe, but to let the spawn of your foot fungus escape and infect the feet of other footloose adventurers.

name: Ice Dofus
description: Legend says that this magnificent Dofus came out of the frozen hole of the Water dragon Aguabrial. Legend does not say if he had a cold that day, though it's highly likely.

name: Crocodyl Dandy's Hat
description: When he puts on this hat, Crocodyl Dandy thinks he's at the forefront of fashion. Fashion must be pretty dull if that's the case. However, it'd be best if you didn't let him know how ridiculous he looks, after all, he is particularly touchy.

name: Tash Ring
description: Are you too young to get into the good clubs? Are you nervous around girls? Well, stick this ring on your finger, and hold it in front of your upper lip. It'll add a few years to your age and do wonders for your self-confidence. Just don't go out in strong winds, or it'll blow away, like your quickly evaporating self-esteem.

name: Dremoan Boots
description: These boots will do nothing to help your athlete's foot.

name: Sparkling Silver Dofus
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Vulbis Dofus
description: The Vulbis Dofus is the subject of terrifying rumours. It's said that the dragon who created the ruby-coloured egg is more pitiless than death itself, devouring her victims in an attempt to satisfy her insatiable appetite. Tall tale or truth? Only the most valiant and foul-tasting heroes know for sure.
stats: Damage inflicted is increased by 10% for 1 turn if no damage-inflicting attack has been suffered since the last game turn.
Lock is increased by 20 for 1 turn if a damage-dealing attack has been suffered since the last game turn.

name: KOs’ Boots
description: Crushing, squeezing, breaking, stamping, grinding… Those are just some of the things these boots are made for, besides walking.

name: Abyssal Dofus
description: According to official sources, this unusual-looking Dofus is a creation of the Foggernauts of Sufokia: it can therefore be concluded that it is not a real dragon egg. Well, that's what the authorities would like us to believe… Anyway, who really knows what's hiding in the abysses?
stats: At the start of each turn, if there are no enemies in close combat, gives 1 MP. Otherwise, gives 1 AP.

name: Ivory Dofus
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Brambler
description: Every rose has its thorns. And this does too.

name: Lavasmith Dofus
description: Despite its somewhat unusual appearance, this Dofus is a genuine dragon egg; it would be a shame to hock it for a few nails. It will keep warm you during the long winter nights, and let you to organise barbecues in the summer. In any case, avoid going too close to haystacks or bundles of kindling with it; otherwise, you could be mistaken for a dangerous arsonist.
stats: Adds 150 shield points if the bearer is moved by pushing, attraction, place switching, teleportation, an Eliotrope portal, or being carried by a Pandawa.
Only enemies can trigger this effect.

name: Ebony Dofus
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Cloudy Dofus
description: Created by Khelebragon's love for the priestess Methea, this Dofus is full of nostalgia. Don't gaze at it too long, or you might feel like crying… which might damage your reputation as a stone-cold adventurer.
stats: On odd turns, increases damage by 20%. On even turns, decreases damage by 10%.

name: Death Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Slice of Undergrowth
description: Take an Elm, strip the bark off, soak it for a few months in a muddy puddle, cover it with fungal infections, stick it under your bed for a week while you sleep on the floor, basting it regularly with Blop fat. All you need to know to make an Elm belt that stinks. Are you happy now?

name: Pot-Bellied Bracelet
description: The three points of this bracelet represent the three major weaknesses of the Bworker: Thirst for vengeance, thirst for victory and, well, thirst for liquids.

name: Korriander Cape
description: If you've seen the commercial for this cape, you'll remember the catchy tagline: "Not often copied but frequently equalled, this cape is particularly noteworthy for its double stitched seams that make it more solid than the capes that do not copy it but equal it". Hmmm. Suddenly, you smell the subtle odour of scam.

name: Ougaat
description: This hat is a piece of the head of Ougaa, a very important deity worshipped by the Porcos. Padded with fabric, feathers and wool, anyone can wear this headgear, provided that they can stand the smell and the weight of it.

name: Potsan Pants
description: These pants form the ceremonial dress of the prophets of P.A.N.T.S. They are the only ones who can wear them without risking being mistaken for a farmer, a travelling tinker or a milkman. That sort of thing.

name: Necrotick Amulet
description: Only to be used in case of an emergency. This jewel contains a powerful poison capable of ruining your life, or saving it, depending on the situation.

name: Guten Tak's Amulet
description: The story goes that one day a Frigostian tried to tame a baby Snowfoux by putting this amulet around his neck. That would probably have worked, if only the Snowfoux he had his heart set on hadn't been one of Guten Tak's offspring.

name: Necrotick Boots
description: Outlawed outside of Srambad thanks to a lobby of Sadida, these boots have a tendency to wilt any vegetable matter under your foot. Quite an effective way to get rid of weeds, despite some tiny side effects.

name: Fungas Belt
description: The best way to solve crotch fungus is to lure it elsewhere. As there's no longer room between your toes to accommodate any more fungi, you can use this belt, a truly impressive residence for any fungus worthy of the name.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Belt
description: Having snatched enough bandages from Tengu Snowfoux to make this belt, you need a couple of plasters yourself.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Cloak
description: Tengu Snowfoux doesn't have three tails, and neither do any of its Snowfoux cousins, so why did you ask your tailor to sew three onto this cloak? You must have a crippling inferiority complex.

name: Preposter Wrap
description: Wear this cape around your shoulders and then conspire against King Allister, which will allow you, amongst other things, to eat Brawn Salad more regularly, or even land yourself a parasol. But you must then get out of his sight!

name: XLII Boots
description: These boots will let you kick your enemies' butts 42 times faster than before.

name: Korriander Ring
description: This stench coming off this ring makes you think someone has been wearing it on their toes.

name: Dremoan Helmet
description: All the experts insist that Dremoan is in fact edible, but no one has really had the courage to try: its colour is about as appetising as your great-aunt's special Gobball tripe. Not very.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Hat
description: The vast majority of the female population of the World of Twelve will think you look like an incredibly cute cuddly toy when you wear this hat. What? You're more interested in terrorising them with the remains of a monster as ferocious as Tengu Snowfoux, are you? That's a shame.

name: Guten Tak's Ring
description: The jeweller who produced this ring had just enough time to start carving Tengu Snowfoux's head into a piece of wood before he was mercilessly trampled by his subject.

name: Fire Dial
description: This shield will protect you from meteorites and fire-breathers, as well as giving your opponents plenty of time… Time to make their last wishes that is!

name: Soryo Snowfoux Loincloth
description: For a long time now, Frigostian hunters have pondered the significance of the motif scribbled on this loincloth. After long deliberation, they have concluded that it must be a warning concerning the odour it must hide.

name: Bim Bonnet
description: This hat only suits blondes.

name: Nose Ring
description: This ring is covered in little bits of nose rubble from the Bworker's shnoz. The dirty creature uses the sharp points to achieve that perfect pick.

name: Pope Ory Hat
description: Pope Ory was a Frigostian renowned for hiding anything and everything in his hat, but above all, anything. His hat had much in common with a female adventurer's handbag: they're the only containers whose contents exceed their capacity, defying all known laws of modern Frigostian physics.

name: Siks-T Slippers
description: Don't get me wrong, I hate demons as much as the next fella, but there's something comforting about cuddling up with a pair of slippers lined with their armpit hair.

name: Guten Tak's Wedding Ring
description: They say that this was the wedding ring that Guten Tak offered his beloved Kami Snowfoux when they first met. Apparently, when she refused, his fur went white with rage.

name: Amulet Cetera
description: Cetera was a terribly powerful warrior, but was unable to finish what he started. He mutilated his opponents by the dozen without ever knowingly killing a single one. He died the day they all decided to gang up on him in revenge. You'll think twice next time you're about to spare someone's life now, won't you?

name: Beltrus
description: Its appearance makes it more effective for fending off suitors than a chastity belt.

name: Sharshoes
description: Nicknamed the jaws of the sands, these boots are worn only by the boldest nomads and Iops.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Boots
description: Made from Snowfoux pelt, these slippers are comfortable enough for you to squeeze your toes inside. Only three of them, mind you.

name: Siks-T Hairpiece
description: This topper comes from the deepest, most demonic realm and is imbued with time-old magic. When you put it on, you will look like a backing vocalist from a boyband. You can't have it all!

name: Ta Boots
description: These boots are the perfect thing to put on if you want to go for a walk in the woods without crushing any dead leaves. You'll need to be careful, however, as their vegetal origins inevitably drive them to crush anything remotely related to manure.

name: Punchinello's Mask
description: Everyone will think you look ridiculous when they see you wearing this hat, but they won't say a word. Now you know what they're thinking though, although they won't know that you know what they're thinking. The most important thing is that you know that they don't know that you know what they're thinking.

name: Little Red Waddling Cape
description: This cape used to belong to a famous Capon, a long-feathered bird that loved to dance in front of the Bonta Zaap where all the gullible poultry and immature chicken hang out.

name: Capleworm
description: This cape is still alive and ready to bite anyone who dares caress it, which makes it very popular among celebrities who hate mingling with the crowds.

name: XLII Ring
description: Now when someone asks you the meaning of life, the universe and everything, giving them the finger whilst wearing this ring should suffice.

name: Siks-T Belt
description: This belt will either boost your masculinity, or make you look impossibly ridiculous. Luck of the draw.

name: Hatlouse
description: Once this hat is on your head, its fangs sink into your flesh to prevent it from flying off at the slightest gust of wind. You don't care that it's sucking up your cerebral matter, since it was of no use to you anyway.

name: Pink Quacoif
description: If you like speaking in a nasal voice, quacking your butt off, and walking with an anitidae stuck to your tail, this Quacoif is made for you. What's more, it's pink, which makes it absolutely indispensable!

name: XLII Belt
description: This belt has the pointiest demon horns you've ever seen. Woe betide the tipsy adventurer who decides to greet you with a friendly hip bump.

name: Air Dial
description: This shield will protect you from the winds of your opponents, and will give them plenty of time… Time to make their last wishes that is!

name: Inertial Boots
description: When you're running, these boots will help you to keep a constant speed without any extra effort on your part, as long as no one tries to stop you. Unfortunately, they're so heavy you're unable to put one foot in front of the other. You'll make an excellent punching ball. Very stable.

name: Wurmring
description: Because this ring is permeated with the personality of the Wurmlord, it pushes its owner to wear it in other places than on a finger.

name: Fanglace
description: The merchant who sold you this necklace assured you it was harmless. Yet, you have the unpleasant sensation that it's about to stick its fangs into your neck at any moment.

name: Postapocalypte Hat
description: The tailor who made this hat was convinced that the future of Frigost would be very dark. Like all naysaying doom-mongers and their half-baked predictions, he was wrong. The future of Frigost was just cold.

name: Ring of the Prophets
description: According to the P.A.N.T.S. prophets, the combined power of five of these rings would be enough to summon the Unknown Lord of Lava wearing just his pants. Yet another of that Ecaflip Lebar's flights of fancy...

name: Mopy King Sovereign Hood
description: This hood serves as a royal headdress, and shares the same virtues as the Mopy King Sovereign Cape. Its micro-vents allow sweat to drain away more easily, so you'll always have a cool head. Unfortunately, it shares the same defects as the cape: its foul stench is so strong, you could cut it with a knife.

name: Obsidemon Boots
description: These boots won't give you a very graceful gait. But since you've never had a graceful gait anyway, no one's going to notice.

name: Anne Cestral's Z-Ring
description: The jeweller who crafted this ring, which has been passed down from generation to generation of Cestrals, was certainly no great talent. The "Z" which adorns the seal appears back-to-front when you seal an envelope with it. Actually, you're not even sure it is a "Z". It might be an "N". Will you ever find out? Probably not.

name: Sulik
description: The sister of a wild Xelor who was kidnapped by unscrupulous slave drivers used to wear this thing for her nightly shows, the nature of which I will not repeat here.

name: Notewell Ring
description: This typically Frigostian creation was made by an artisan whose blood never ran cold, not even in his hands.

name: Obsidemon Helmet
description: You have to admit, this helmet doesn't make you look very clever. The problem is that without it, you look even less so.

name: Sandals Bino
description: You'll soon be able to match these sandals to the colour of your hair or the flag you're carrying at your next battle against a Perceptor.

name: Earth Dial
description: This shield will protect you from stone-throwing, mud-slinging, and will give your opponents plenty of time… Time to make their last wishes that is!

name: Tynril Hat
description: You'll always have an out-of-bed look if you wear this hat, even if you've spent hours brushing your hair. The hairs on a Tynril's bark curl when the weather is humid, which makes it the surest weather forecaster in the World. This hat fears fire, however, so be extremely careful and keep it away from flames if you don't want to become a human torch.

name: Grendibelt
description: Legend has it that the very first owner of this belt used to spin round and round every time he put it on.

name: Obsidemon Amulet
description: In olden days, Frigostian jewellers used to offer some very good advice when they had heavy pieces of jewellery on sale: place a heavy piece of jewellery around your sweetheart's neck, and it will stop her going too far away.

name: Ush's Collar
description: There are few materials as resistant as the fabric used to make this collar, which will protect you from any sword blows that might be aimed at your neck…

name: Obsidemon Cloak
description: A little rigid, a little heavy and from a completely different era, this cloak reminds you of a former colleague you used to break rocks with down in the mine.

name: Ush Boots
description: These boots are as comfortable as slippers when they're on your feet, and as hard as rock when worn to protect certain more sensitive bits.

name: Ellie's Deluxe Mental Amulet
description: You excel in your mastery of the four primordial elemental energies and you want everyone to know. Be careful though, as this amulet might play tricks on you.
stats: Title: Grand Master of the Elements

name: Belt of the Prophets
description: This belt will provide essential support to any self-respecting P.A.N.T.S. prophet.

name: Weremoggy Cape
description: With its tiger-striped motif, the Weremoggy Cape will let you scramble your opponent's vision so completely they'll be effectively blind.

name: Kat Cap
description: This cursed hat used to belong to Katar, but he lost his mind. Mad as a hatter, he ended up beheaded. Take heed!

name: Celestial Swashbuckler Cloak
description: Legend has it that whoever wears the ‘Circle of Lightning’ contained in this cloak will be able to control lightning. It might be nothing more than a legend, but it’s worth a shot!

name: Celestial Swashbuckler Belt
description: The rope of this belt is made with an extremely rare material that absorbs lightning bolts and retains their energy. It’s just the thing to protect you on stormy days when you can’t find anywhere to take shelter.

name: Pants Fordamemory
description: If you look directly at these pants, moving your head from right to left for several days, you might eventually manage to fall asleep.

name: Kanazure Ring
description: This is a real head, shrunken to a twentieth of its original size (by a secret ancestral technique, naturally) to fit onto a finger. An anonymous researcher managed to carry out the same process on Pikoko Rumps, but not even modern art students wanted to wear them. That's what happens when you're ahead of your time.

name: Royal Bloprown
description: For several years this Bloprown was worn by Kuri herself, until the fickle gods of fashion mocked her for her taste in crappy hats and she stuffed it to the back of her wardrobe to gather dust with her Feca-style Wig, Youllbea Mantle, and fluff-covered Consolation Candies.

name: Weremoggy Ring
description: This ring has the strange characteristic of making its wearer's phrases start with the phrase "Zounds!". However, it doesn't seem to work on you. Maybe it's just an old legend…

name: The Maidartes
description: These boots belonged to the unforgettable Maidarte, a misunderstood genius who specialised in infinite loops and recursion. Nobody really understood what he was explaining nor why he or continually repeated the same stories. Just as the surf crashes against the rocky shoreline, so have his diatribes become a part of the landscape, forever colliding with the obstacle of common sense.

name: Obsidemon Ring
description: In olden days, Frigostian jewellers used to offer some very good advice when they had lighter pieces of jewellery on sale: don't give your sweetheart jewellery which is too heavy for her hands, or she could have trouble cleaning the top of your shelves.

name: Cape Tivate
description: This cape attracts attention and provides a diversion. If you are ordered to wear it on a battlefield, you'll be able to more accurately estimate your life expectancy.

name: Orfan Headgear
description: This headgear will make you look like some kind of terrible Iop-beast that'll scare the bejesus out of the Astrubians and maybe even some Amaknians. Of course, you'll need to try a lot harder than that to scare Nevark.

name: Ochre Dofus
description: Laid by Terrakourial the Earth Dragon, this Dofus contains considerable powers and shouldn’t be given to just anyone.
stats: Gives 1 AP if no damage-inflicting attack has been suffered since the last game turn.

name: Water Dial
description: This shield will protect you from rain and slobber, and will also give your opponents plenty of time… Time to make their last wishes that is!

name: Turquoise Dofus
description: The Turquoise Dofus was created by Aguabrial, the Water Dragon. Isn't it incredible what a Dragon can do with some water?
stats: For each Critical Hit inflicted, the final damage is increased by 1% for 3 turns. Can be stacked 10 times.

name: Kanazure Cloak
description: Kanazure Ray the tailor invented this cape after his attempts to market his adult Haloperi Doll replica failed miserably. The sales numbers were well behind even the XXXboxes sold in the seedy quarters of Bonta.

name: Weremoggy Belt
description: You thought you'd be able to blend in with the Weremoggies by wearing their symbol around your waist, but this cat's head is actually used to mark their next target. Too bad for you.

name: Minotot Sandals
description: These incredible sandals will enable you to bathe in the most dangerous waters without hurting your feet. Be careful however, as they're said to scratch the bottom of bathtubs.

name: Boy's Own Chain
description: A bard called Konan Bleating wore this chain when he was younger. All his fans wore the same chain. If you decide to do the same, don't be surprised if even the monsters in Incarnam mock your taste in music.

name: Metamunch Kin's Helmet
description: After you met him for the very first time, all frail and low-level, Metamunch Kin made a whispered promise to the Key Master: "If this one here completes a tour of the World, I'll eat my hat." It took some time, and getting it back into its original shape was some hefty work, but it was completely worth it.

name: Still Sandals
description: Pandawas have always been attracted by alcoholic beverages. As time went by, they discovered how best to conserve and flavour them. These sandals were made especially for alcoholic Pandawas. They're ballasted at the sole so that you can keep your feet firmly on the ground, most of the time. Good for fighting, terrible for running away.

name: Jester Hat
description: If you shake your two little bells, you might be able to play music.

name: Zothulet
description: This amulet might be nothing more than a few pieces of wood bound with a strip of torn fabric, but the Zoths are absolutely convinced it has terrible powers. The doddery old fools!

name: Sarbak Voodoo Mask
description: Many moons ago, the Kanniballs were travelling actors respected for their comedies and tragedies, as represented by two masks - one laughing, the other cruel. When their chief lost the happy mask, the Kanniballs descended into savagery.

name: Orfan Belt
description: The number of red marks on an Orfan's belt is a sign of how good at hunting its owner is. Every time he devours his prey, alive and kicking, he has to loosen his belt by one mark so he doesn't get bloated. You can use it in much the same way to count how many beers you've had down the tavern.

name: Minotot Necklace
description: This necklace protects the Minotot's cervical vertebrae from lethal Wabbit punches.

name: Thierry Voodoo Mask
description: This Voodoo mask serves primarily to hide and protect the faces of those who, like Thierry, like slingshots, but often miss their target.

name: Archer Voodoo Mask
description: Kanniball archers can't concentrate and aim right unless they are very angry. So, in order to be sure to see red at all times, they painted their masks this colour.

name: Grozilla Belt
description: Grozilla and Grasmera's reported debauchery with Dragostesses has always been a hot topic of discussion, scandalising girl adventurers and awing their male companions. This belt and its enormous… buckles have become one way for the afore-mentioned boys to claim they live by the same rules. Obviously, they're lying.

name: Tam Voodoo Mask
description: Preferring music to hunting, Kanniball Tams use a mask with white hair instead of black to distinguish themselves from other members of their tribe, which gives them style beyond compare.

name: Jav Voodoo Mask
description: When Jav Kanniballs feel a little blue, they dye their hair this colour. Is it due to frustrated love or something else? Hard to know for sure, but it would be great if they could just wear the mask and stop telling everyone how sad they were.

name: Mopy King Sovereign Seal
description: This seal indicates that its owner is the undisputed sovereign of Otomai Island's Bottomless Peat Bog, although it's difficult to imagine a more pastoral kingdom...

name: Kanazure Belt
description: The legends say that Eltux, the Meridia of the Colour Blue, painted all the Kanazures in homage to Blou, the Meridia of Humidity. Nobody really knows what exactly he was hoping to achieve, or whether he succeeded, but at least now we know why the Kanazures are always feeling so blue.

name: Buck Anear's Belt
description: This belt can also be worn as a loincloth. Without it, Buck Anear wouldn't have been able to hide his most precious, envied and coveted jewel. Sailors jealous of his enormous treasure nicknamed him, for reasons known only to themselves, the "crooked visionary" or the "ravaging buccaneer". When he was hung for the thirteenth time, he cried out to the crowd, "My treasure for someone who understands!"

name: Minotot Headgear
description: This headgear has been passed down from generation to generation through the Minotot family. This partially explains why it smells like rotting dandruff.

name: Orfan Amulet
description: Visitors to the region are always asking where the Orfans' second eye went - all except those who have one of these amulets. They know the answer, but won't breathe a word to anyone.

name: Minotot Cloak
description: This is the perfect cloak to go out or practise your seduction skills at the Captain Chafer's masked ball.

name: Yuara Pirate Mask
description: It's difficult to say if the Yuara Pirate deliberately chose this mask or was the victim of a very violent maritime accident with a sea shell. It's also difficult to say who is the worst-off - the shell or the pirate.

name: Black Hornet Mask
description: The members of the Black Hornet gang used to wear masks just like this one. These sinister individuals were accused of all the worst deeds known to humanity: kidnapping, bridge destroying, fake treasure mongering and ill-timed humming in people's ears. To this day, nobody has got to the bottom of these ne'er-do-wells' motives.

name: Cantile's Amulet
description: Following several catastrophes caused by needles that were a little too sharp, Mayor Cantile made a habit of decorating Frigost's most skilful artisans with this amulet instead.

name: Zoth Master Hat
description: The main advantage of the Zoth Master Hat is that it restricts your field of view far more than any other helmet. Thanks to this peculiarity, the wearer can use the famous fighting technique known as "The Weasel". In short, this method consists of striking anywhere using all your strength. As it's completely unpredictable, you're guaranteed to defeat your opponent (or at least surprise them enough to finish them off with a well-placed kick).

name: Cantile's Boots
description: These boots make so much noise when you walk in them that people say Lou Bricante, better known as "Loulou", filled them with lead so she could follow Mayor Cantile wherever she went.

name: Grozilla Boots
description: The very fact that Grozilla has boots named after him might seem ironic considering the idleness he has famously developed since settling down in Vulkania with Grasmera. That said, who wouldn't be idle on a heavenly island with charming company and all the exotic meals one could wish for?

name: Buck Anear's Hook
description: Buck Anear loved hugs and manly handshakes – and sometimes both at once. Unfortunately for those he loved, he regularly forgot that he was armed with a huge, rusty hook. By dint of scratching, stinging, pinching, cutting and poking out the eyes of his family, he was called many things: "Joshua Lackhand", "Hooky Hooky Hookface", and often just simply "Hook Off".

name: Harpy Pirate Mask
description: Occasionally called a "limpet head", the Harpy Pirate doesn't like seafood jokes, and he likes jokes involving seafood and his mother even less.

name: Inn Shield
description: The Innkeeper at the Feubuk Brewery in Bonta was bored to death one day, when he suddenly got the idea of equipping his bouncers with neon advertising shields.

name: Talisman Dalyfbotes
description: The maintenance and upkeep of this life-saving talisman is funded by the generous participants of Blop Eater appeals.

name: Powa Drhell Belt
description: This belt looks like it came straight from the Shustuft Crust. Who knows how far the Powa Drhell had to dig to find it?

name: Air Pikoko Helmet
description: If you spin around at the speed of sound while wearing this helmet, you'll take off. As for landing, well, you'll have to sort it out.

name: Buck Anear's Hat
description: Buck Anear wore this hat on the Hesperus to show he was the boss. It didn't stop his loyal crew members nicknaming him "The Prat in the Hat", "Hattie Jacques", "Sonia Head" or, worst of all, "Octopus Tule".

name: Grozilla Headgear
description: Jamming this headgear on, you look forward to showing everyone that you've defeated the terrible Grozilla. In practise, all you can really do with it is terrify children and/or get a job as the mascot of your favourite Gobbowl team.

name: Zatoishwan's Beard
description: Ideal for disguising yourself as an old hermit, this beard will make you look like you’ve spent your whole life meditating in order to understand and master the mysteries of Pandawushu.

name: Cantile's Ring
description: This ring is certainly highly official, but the chances are that your loved one would prefer something more sparkly.

name: Cantile's Cloak
description: This cloak, sewn with gold thread by an expert craftsman, will bring you the official credibility you are so severely lacking.

name: Zatoishwan's Belt
description: Adjusted for a large waist, this solid belt will help you get around more easily and reduce your efforts if you're carrying a few extra pounds. Conversely, you could always use it to tie up your most hefty enemies.

name: Black Hornet Belt
description: It's thanks to belts like these that the Black Hornets were able to buzz off as soon as the militia arrived. Nobody was quick enough to net them! Without a good belt around his waist, a bandit runs a high risk of his trousers falling down, causing him to lose his dignity, his freedom of movement, and his freedom full stop.

name: Tanukouï San Collar
description: Tanukouï Sans wear this collar from early childhood. Given what these monsters are capable of, it's no wonder this jewellery is so valuable.

name: Mitch Shroom
description: This headgear will give Mitcho-class style to anyone who wears it. It does have a strong smell of undergrowth that your friends could do without.

name: Powa Drhell Amulet
description: This might not be the most tasteful accessory around, but at least your friends can't accuse you of walking around with your nose in the air any more.

name: Hippy Pants
description: These pants are best worn with long hair and come with an ash tray and plectrum. Before Frigost's big freeze, they were very popular with the angry young rebels who cut the grass for their own personal consumption. They were almost certainly Mastogob breeders looking to feed their pets.

name: Mopy King Sovereign Cape
description: Made from Mopy King Fabric, this cape is riddled with micro-holes that allow sweat to escape more easily during periods of intense exercise - during aggressive melees in steamy swamps, for example. The holes may let the humidity out, but they keep the heat in, and so you always stay dry, whatever the situation. It's just a pity the stench of mould is so hard to shift.

name: Augilol's Tippet
description: Augilol was a non-descript Sram who spent his whole, miserable life in Ogivol's shadow. When Frigost Island was rediscovered, he was one of the first passengers to make the journey, hoping to come into his own and make his fortune. We don't know what happened next. All that's left of him is this cloak.

name: Nekochief
description: This hat was designed by a tailor who adored Bow Meows and was vehemently opposed to the Systematic Termination For Undesirable Bow Meows association. He was assassinated by members of the Pingwin Protection Agency, who were vehemently opposed to the extermination of wildlife from the Frozen Lake area.

name: Ruskie Hat
description: This hat keeps your ears warm and absorbs the alcohol on your breath. What else could you ask for?

name: Grozilla Amulet
description: When you asked your jeweller to make this amulet, you thought that its decorative bezoar would cool down eventually. Unfortunately, it is still as ardent as ever: it catches fire with every breeze, and you'll boil yourself alive if you forget to take it off before getting in the bath. The other side of the victory coin, eh?

name: Drhossil Boots
description: Ahhh, finally a pair of boots that breathe! Just be careful as you walk around, as it's common for little objects to slip inside unseen. They're also known for sneezing, often and always at the worst moments, making you fall down stairs, off cliffs, into swimming pools, etc.

name: Blaber Ring
description: Ecaflips have the gift of the gab. They can talk you into almost any bet you can think of. This ring celebrates their business smarts. It can also be used as a spare dice or to scratch yourself.
stats: Increases the Claw of Ceangal spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Repercussion spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Roulette spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Misfortune spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Corollary spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Spell Strike spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Trickery spell's maximum range by 2

name: Major Friction
description: This Trophy helps you slow down your opponent's movements so you can catch them more quickly and humiliate them accordingly, by giving them a wedgie, for example.

name: Major Air Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Air attacks, but not from Air spray.

name: Major Transporter
description: This Trophy increases the maximum weight you're able to carry. It doesn't make a heavy heart any easier to bear though.

name: Major Maniac
description: This trophy increases your Strength. Unfortunately, it doesn't increase strength of mind though.

name: Major Earth Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Earth attack damage. Only Earthworms are impressed by this.

name: Major Earth Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you keep your feet on the ground. Warning: can prove painful if used in conjunction with a flying mount.

name: Major Fire Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you hold your own in the line of fire.

name: Major Shackler
description: This Trophy slows your loved one down when he or she desperately wants to leave. You laugh in the face of restraining orders!

name: Major Fire Bulwark
description: This Trophy could save your life when your sect is on fire.

name: Major Air Bulwark
description: Equip this Trophy and your worries will vanish into thin air.

name: Mandring
description: If a Perceptor's head proved too tough to grind, Mandrin tightened this ring around its neck to throttle it instead.

name: Major Intellectual
description: Team up with some Bworks to become the group's intellectual.

name: Major Stunter
description: That pitiful slip on a banana skin was just a stunt to make your friends laugh. No one believed you, but everyone had a good laugh.

name: Major Solid
description: Solid but not unbreakable. This is how your allies will describe you just before breaking your two big toes following a terrible joke.

name: Major Earth Carapace
description: This Trophy may come in useful as a dirt dish. If used upside down, logic dictates that it could also be used to dish the dirt.

name: Major Vigour
description: You took it literally when she said to 'get up and go'.

name: Rememb Ring
description: Enutrofs can use this ring to evoke the memory of their happiest times whenever they want. If one removes the miniature shovel driven into the ring, it will give off a gentle aroma. To make the memory even more potent, you'd need to add a specific smell to it, and that's not the easiest thing to do, let me tell you.
stats: Increases the Clumsiness spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Greed spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Shovel Throwing spell
Increases the maximum number of times Vivacity can be cast per target by 1
Reduces the Miserliness spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Spade Throw spell
20 Damage on the spell: Ghostly Shovel
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Ghostly Spade spell

name: Hai Ring
description: Contrary to the rumour, Sadidas do not let their hair down… This hair has just been adjusted round a wonderful ring to reinforce its benefits. Never ever cut it! Thanks to the Hai Ring, you'll always be perfect!
stats: Wild Grass is no longer linear
Reduces the Transmuted Ultra-Powerful spell's cooldown period by 1
Aggressive Bramble is no longer linear
Reduces the Natural Gift spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Inoculation spell's cooldown period by 1
15 Damage on the spell: Plaguing Bramble
Reduces the Ultra-Powerful spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Mithik Bracelet
description: It is said that this bracelet will ensure you a place in history. It is also said that it will make you the most popular of all Masqueraiders. It is even said that some numskulls believe all of this.
stats: Increases the Picada spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Stampede spell's maximum range by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Boliche spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Agular spell
Comedy no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Inferno spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Plastron spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Ginga spell's AP cost by 1

name: Major Fugitive
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to prevent you from reaching your destination. This doesn't work against those who are trying to prevent you from reaching your destiny though.

name: Major Repellant
description: This Trophy enables you to do a bit more damage to an opponent when you push them against a tree, some debris or another enemy with a goatee.

name: Major Adamantin
description: This Trophy lessens your suffering a little when your opponents push you against a tree, a person, an animal or just something really big and hard. It does not protect you from blows, not even those dealt by calloused hands.

name: Major Water Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Water attacks, but not from Water sports.

name: Major Earth Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Earth attacks, unless you happen to be in Middle-Earth.

name: Major Air Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Air attack damage in those who are full of hot air.

name: Major Scholar
description: This Trophy increases your Intelligence. I wonder why the auctioneers at the Astrub Zaap have never thought to get one?

name: Major Survivor
description: This trophy increases Vitality. Its effects against impotence have never been proven.

name: Pressure Ring
description: As its name suggests, this ring is vital for Foggernauts. It allows them to keep an eye on their air pressure and gives them a better idea of how long they've been underwater. Most importantly, it ensures that any dummies who think it's a compass get lost before they start to become really annoying.
stats: Reduces the Tide spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Spyglass spell's maximum range by 2
Dreadnaut no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Corrosion spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Periscope spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Rescue spell's AP cost by 1
Makes the First Aid spell's range modifiable
Reduces the Covering spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Major Doctor
description: This Trophy lets you play doctors and nurses with your allies, or with your enemies, if the fight's too boring for words.

name: Major Goliath
description: This Trophy will show the world that Strength runs deep in your family.

name: Major Tease
description: This Trophy will make Chance your area of expert-tease.

name: Major Neutral Wrecker
description: This Trophy allows you to keep your face utterly expressionless as you decimate the enemy.

name: Styxring
description: Five fingers good, three fingers better. That's how Styx explained his punishment for the theft of this ring.

name: Major Miracle Man
description: It helps to be cured, but not in the ham sense.

name: Major Neutral Devastator
description: There where your Dragoturkey has passed, the grass will never grow again.

name: Major Fire Devastator
description: When attacked, you'll fire back with anything: curses, taunts, bad jokes, baptisms and great balls.

name: Major Air Devastator
description: You tried different air styles but that was before your thatch turned into thin air.

name: Major Stunner
description: Headbutting an enemy to stun them seemed to be an interesting tactic. Until you realized they were wearing a helmet, but you weren't.

name: Major Escapee
description: There's no shame in fleeing when there's no chance of winning.

name: Major Fire Carapace
description: This Trophy will make an excellent ashtray if you prefer to use the Peace Pipe rather than fight.

name: Pandawa Shield
description: Perfect if you want to fit in on Pandala, or to stand out anywhere else! The biggest advantage of this shield is that it's entirely covered with hypoallergenic Pandawa hair. Now you don't need to pack your underwear and your armour in separate suitcases when you go on holiday.

name: Ring Bellious
description: Spiteful gossips claim that this ring is the least useful fashion accessory in the World. The wings attached to it are very awkward when you need to get a tissue out of your pocket. Now, as Iops have neither tissues nor pockets, they don't care. Instead, they prefer shredding their enemies' flesh with the wings during close combat. Thinking about it, you wonder why this isn't the Sacriers' ring instead.
stats: Celestial Sword no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Concentration spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Power spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Sword of Fate spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Zenith spell
Increases the Virtue spell's maximum range by 1

name: Ring Neinwonwon
description: If you see a character who's not a Sacrier wear the Ring Neinwonwon, take him directly to intensive care. Indeed, this jewel is extremely harmful. In general, people lose their cool when they face the pool of blood caused by this ring.
stats: Reduces the Transposition spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Libation spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Fluctuation spell's cooldown period by 1
Assault no longer requires a line of sight
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Aversion spell
Reduces the Blood Pact spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Thorn Crown spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Jashin Ritual spell's AP cost by 1

name: Enig Mittens
description: These mittens were worn for many years by the Rogue magician Lina, who enhanced her bombs using black magic in order to create explosives powerful enough to kill dragons. They remain imbued with her power to this day.
stats: Detonator no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Boomerang Daggers spell's AP cost by 1
Seismobomb no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Kaboom spell's cooldown period by 1
Fuze no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Cadence spell
Increases the Latent Seismobomb spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Imposture spell's maximum range by 1

name: Major Oppressor
description: This Trophy enables you to oppress your aggressors more easily. It also seems to work on digressers.

name: Major Barrier
description: This Trophy protects you from Critical Hits in critical places at critical moments. Once it's equipped, you will suffer a side effect which will really get on your friends' nerves: You won't be able to accept criticism.

name: Major Neutral Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Neutral attacks, but it won't make your enemies any more Neutral once the hostilities commence.

name: Major Neutral Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Neutral attack damage. It was invented by a famous ogre: Pete Aitchnutrool.

name: Major Healer
description: This Trophy increases Heals. It won’t make you look any more lively, though.

name: Major Player
description: This Trophy increases your Chance. It doesn't seem to have any effect when you use cheesy chat-up lines though.

name: Kwismas Nightmare Cape
description: Jack would have loved to be a vampire, but instead, he had to be a lowly skeleton his whole life. In order to be just a tiny bit cooler, he had this cape made.

name: Kwismas Nightmare Boots
description: The other Frigostians always saw Jack as something of an eccentric, which is why the only person he could find to make these boots was an Amaknian shoemaker who was part of the Order of the Kicked Ass. The boots' shape was specially chosen to suit the Order's techniques.

name: Major Brainbox
description: This Trophy will make you so brainy that you'll score a clean 3 on the Bwork Intelligence Scale, which runs from negative infinity to 1.

name: Major Gymnast
description: This Trophy has the power to miraculously balance everything. Except, perhaps, your class spells.

name: Major Jostler
description: This Trophy turns you into the clumsiest warrior anyone has ever seen. Just turning around to check the height of the sun in the sky sends four of your allies flying into bushes and walls.

name: Major Deserter
description: This Trophy will be of no use to you whilst crossing the desert.

name: Major Rabid
description: The saliva on your lips allows you to create a Snailmet trail when you bite the dust.

name: Major Luckster
description: You had a 99% chance of getting a glass half-empty, but you got a glass half-full. How lucky is that!

name: Major Delayer
description: Your technique is not to be the quickest, but to just delay everyone else so you're not the slowest. This is a tried and tested technique in all administrations of the World of Twelve.

name: Major Water Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from Crocodyl Tears.

name: Oringinal
description: Forged in Huppermage fire, this ring of power is full of mystery. Inside, there's an inscription that reads: "Fire falls… Water Blows… Wind burns…", which doesn't mean muh of anything, apparently.
stats: Reduces the Imprint spell's cooldown period by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Striking Meteor spell
Contribution no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Transfixing Gust spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Creation spell's maximum range by 2
Elemental Cycle no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Comet spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Hurricane spell's maximum range by 1

name: Bone Band
description: This ring is given to young Ouginaks so that they lick their paws instead of chewing their claws.
stats: Increases the Cerberus spell's maximum range by 2
Makes the Bark spell's range modifiable
Increases the Tetanisation spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Sniff spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Amarok spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Gnaw spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Carving Up spell

name: Honoh Ring
description: Wearing this ring is an honour. It shows that you're a faithful worshipper of the goddess Cra, the only one to reveal how to harden your muscle more quickly to be able fire more effectively.
stats: 30% Critical Hit bonus on the Explosive Arrow spell
Reduces the Plaguing Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Bat's Eye spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Bow Skill spell's cooldown period by 1
20 Damage on the spell: Fulminating Arrow
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Slaughtering Arrow spell
Reduces the Crushing Arrow spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Sentinel spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Ear Ring
description: This jewel tends to turn Pandawas into insulting devils after two or three beers… just remember the old proverb "Sticks and stones may break my bones, but a drunken bear-like creature will never hurt me."
stats: Reduces the Schnaps spell's AP cost by 1
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Pandatak spell
Reduces the Spirit Bond spell's cooldown period by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Liqueur spell
Increases the Filthipint spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Bamboo spell's maximum range by 1

name: Subma Ring
description: This ring is the only jewel that can tell the time and which is perfectly waterproof. Some believe that if you enlarge it a few hundred times, it'll make a submarine too. A submarine that can tell the time.
stats: Hand no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Teleportation spell's cooldown period by 2
Increases the Xelor's Dial spell's maximum range by 2
Makes the Accomplice spell's range modifiable
Increases the maximum number of times Spontaneous Return can be cast per turn by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Cog spell
Increases the Time Theft spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Petrification spell

name: Major Locker
description: This Trophy lets you keep the cowards close to you. So you can crush them more easily.

name: Major Escapist
description: This Trophy lets you escape when the opportune moment presents itself.

name: Major Eluder
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to limit your actions. It doesn't work against lawyers.

name: Major Fire Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Fire attacks, but not Goblets of Fire.

name: Major Water Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Water attack damage, but it won’t help you turn water into wine.

name: Kwismas Nightmare Bad Luck Charm
description: Jack was a Sram who just loved tricks and treats. For that reason, he spent almost all his time knocking at doors to ask for sweets. One day, though, he knocked on Tengu Snowfoux's door when Fuji Snowfoux was visiting… All they found of poor Jack was this amulet.

name: Major Water Wrecker
description: This Trophy is your first step towards becoming less of a drip.

name: Major Air Wrecker
description: The packaging this Trophy came in says that it works best when you have fresh air against your bare bottom. You can't wait to try it out.

name: Major Untouchable
description: This Trophy sends small, regular jolts of electricity running through your muscles, preventing them from seizing up and stopping you from falling asleep at family dinners.

name: Major Slimeball
description:
This Trophy oozes a slippery liquid that gives you the upper hand when escaping from Lock-happy opponents.
Just don't be surprised when you don't get any free hugs on Ballotwine's Day.

name: Major Stalwart
description: When the pressure gets too much, when people start throwing their weight around, and when you realise you’re a total pushover, it's time to equip this Trophy.

name: Major Forerunner
description: Having the first turn gives you the limelight to commit the first fatal error, show everyone what an idiot you are, prove that you're not a priority target, be the last man standing and come home a hero.

name: Major Water Bulwark
description: Don't throw this Trophy out with the bathwater.

name: Ringferno
description: This ring belonged to Inferno's most beautiful apprentice. She was unlucky enough to die twice, suffering third-degree burns in the fourth dimension of the fifth amendment, after accidently looking her fiery master in the eye.

name: Nova Ring
description: Bright like the sun and powerful like a supernova, this ring will augment your Eliotrope powers in a great and terrible way. You're not an Eliotrope? Then you could put it on your bedside table - it would make for a very nice nightlight too. Such is also the power of the Nova Ring.
stats: Reduces the Audacious spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Parasite spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Mutual Assistance spell's cooldown period by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Composure spell
Reduces the Virus spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Coalition can be cast per turn by 1
Lightning Fist no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Insolence spell's maximum range by 1

name: Major Curer
description: This Trophy will help you heal your allies by offering wise words: "an api a day keeps the doctor away; seven apis a week you'll no longer feel weak"

name: Major Earth Devastator
description: Monsters will bite you on the bum and you will bite the dust. Poor monsters.

name: Major Water Devastator
description: You've always strongly believed that blood is thicker than water. Which is why you never pour yourself a refreshing glass of blood.

name: Major Feller
description: Knocking down so many enemies has made you a happy feller.

name: Major Bloodthirst
description: Your friends salivate when they see you butcher but refuse to eat your delicious garlic soup. Strange.

name: Lion Ring
description: Osamodettes love this ring which gives an extra feline touch to their walk. Because they're always so close to monsters, they're starting to behave like real animals themselves. But in reality, they're as devoted and caring as lioness mothers.
stats: Increases the maximum number of times Repulsive Fang can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Whirlwind spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Canine spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Batra spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Animal Blessing spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Sixth spell's maximum range by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Woolly Sledgehammer spell
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Gobball Fleece spell

name: Memo Ring
description: Fecas use the mini shields on this ring as memo boards to write love notes and to-do lists. This jewel has been nicknamed the anti-forgetfulness shield. However, it does not protect you from stammering or slips of the tongue.
stats: Lethargy no longer requires a line of sight
Feca Shield is no longer linear
Increases the Gravitational Glyph spell's maximum range by 2
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Lifelessness spell
Increases the Inertia spell's maximum range by 1
Excursion Glyph no longer requires a line of sight
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Bubble spell
