Increases the Swelling spell's maximum range by 2

name: Chee Ring
description: The goddess Eniripsa gave this item to her worshippers as a sign of their spiritual union during the class spell initiation session. Incidentally, Eniripsas can also use it as a sponge bracelet to clean off the blood of their allies.
stats: Word of Recovery is no longer linear
Reduces the Thunderous Word spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Friendship Word spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Word of Youth spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Uniting Word can be cast per target by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Overwhelming Word spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Defensive Word spell
Reduces the Affectionate Word spell's AP cost by 1

name: Elkebi Ring
description: This jewel with a skull on it was traditionally offered to all Sram kids to reward them for their treachery and blows below the belt. The other classes seem to discredit this practise which tends to overexcite the kids and turn them into little devils.
stats: Reduces the spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Paralysing Trap spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Miry Trap can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Double spell's maximum range by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Toxic Injection spell
Reduces the Drift Trap spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Larceny spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Plotter spell's maximum range by 1

name: Major Fire Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Fire damage. According to the label, it's guaranteed to get you all fired up.

name: Major Instigator
description: This Trophy increases Initiative instead of taking it.

name: Major Acrobat
description: This trophy increases your Agility. You're finally going to be able to climb on your high horse without falling off.

name: Kwismas Nightmare Mask
description: Jack was such a devious fellow that he had the crazy idea of dressing up as himself to do his misdeeds and throw people off the scent. Using this mask, you can do the same thing! If you're a Sram, that is.

name: Major Stickler
description: This Trophy enables you to stick undesirables onto the bottom of your boots, or vice versa. Don't forget to tie your laces, now.

name: Major Vagabond
description: This Trophy accepts no responsibility for runaway brains.

name: Major Bastion
description: This Trophy protects you from really cracking hits but also prevents you from scoring them yourself. You should take the opportunity to claim that you hate wanton violence and stand with your hands on your hips, tutting disapprovingly at everyone you see.

name: Major Paralyser
description: The good thing about this Trophy is that, if you hit an ally by mistake, there's little chance they'll be able to do anything about it.

name: Major Earth Bulwark
description: This Trophy protects you from falling earth. Handy if you spend your days hollowing out underground passageways.

name: Major Neutral Bulwark
description: This Trophy stops you from taking sides in combat and prevents you from potentially hurting yourself by casting a spell.

name: Major Dynamo
description: Wind up this Trophy and you'll be going strong all night! You're never too old for the generation game.

name: Major Powerhouse
description: This Trophy is seasoned with Cania Bay sea salt, delicate herbs and rustic rust, so your enemies can enjoy a taste sensation when they smash their front teeth out on it.

name: Major Barbarian
description: This Trophy will show your enemies that you are capable of the best actions known to man, and the most evil, and that you prefer the latter. And they will weep, forsooth.

name: Willkills Ring
description: Was it a present from a client or loot from a victim? Nobody's sure where Will Killson got this ring from, and nobody really cares.

name: Major Obstructor
description: If your enemies do not pass away, at least they shall not pass.

name: Major Fortification
description: That playground bully who destroyed your sand castle traumatised you for life. Time for payback.

name: Major Evader
description: Use a good Fire attack with this Trophy and you'll be able to dodge and burn.

name: Major Motivator
description: Sometimes it's just better to be never than late.

name: Major Neutral Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from all the ditherers who can't choose sides during a fight.

name: Major Air Carapace
description: Taking refuge under this Trophy will protect you from wind, but will not prevent you from generating your own. This can lead to an uncomfortable case of trapped wind.

name: Kracker Cap
description: This unique hat used to belong to a Xelor grandmaster, known the World over for his explosive theories and his incessant meddling with time. His death was as explosive and untimely as his life... Jealous of his neighbour's hat, whose magic powers were said to be even greater than his, he rashly unleashed a Wind of Panic to remove it forever, forgetting about his own. He was blown into a million little pieces when his hat exploded like a giant firecracker.

name: Minotot Belt
description: The Minotot used this stiff belt to hold his huge potbelly in, preventing him from toppling over every time he felt a draught.

name: Drhossil Cloak
description: This Drellhair cloak is a must-have for individuals in a certain income bracket. It gives its wearer a wild, almost Kanigrula-esque look.

name: Minotot Bracelet
description: This bracelet fully protects the arm of an Eniripsa, but triples its weight.

name: Parkinn Pan's Pikokowal Belt
description: Parkinn Pan truly believed that he could fly thanks to this belt trimmed with Pikoko wings, but what he didn't know was that very few Pikokos can actually fly. That's why every time he jumped off the Tree Keeholo he routinely crashed to the forest floor below. His nickname "Cake" comes from "flat as a pancake".

name: Cape Tenfuture
description: This cape doesn't come from your Galaxy but it seems to match the colour of your Gobbly-wool fishnet stockings all the same.

name: Drown Ring
description: This ring could have prevented some of Buck Anear's maritime disappointments. Instead of having to drink from a cup, he would have been able cut open bottles of Cocalane, the famous beverage that makes everything go by in a blur.

name: Drhossil Belt
description: Because of its value in gold, this belt is very rarely actually used as a belt. And for those of you who think it'd make a good weapon: think again. It's way too heavy!

name: Frigostine's Amulet
description: With this amulet around your neck, the delicious smell of steaming hot pastries will envelop your senses and give you the illusion of strength. It is just an illusion, though.

name: Notwithstand Ring
description: The Frigostian artisan who made this ring almost died of exhaustion trying to write something interesting on its label. He preferred to "move on to something else". Which, translated into Frigostian means, "go on a pub crawl around all the taverns in Frigost Village".

name: Powa Drhell Cloak
description: This cloak makes you look terrifically terrifying! Unfortunately, the other Drhellers don't think so, and are more likely to charge you from behind than they are to run away.

name: Gorithm Sandals
description: Legend has it that these sandals are named after a great Frigostian mathematician called Hannibal Gorithm. He always wore sandals, even after the big freeze. He used to walk around in circles in the snow until he found the solution to stopping walking - which was when his toes turned blue.

name: Mount Stinkky Shield
description: Greenish and smelly, this shield remains a first choice for protection when it comes to fighting the creatures of green and smelly Mount Stinkky.

name: Soft Oak Hat
description: No matter how you wear this hat, it will always look like it's on sideways.

name: Paperb' Hat
description: This hat was used by some Xelors to hide their hereditary baldness. Enutrofs used it to hide their wives' faces. In fact, the only male syndrome it doesn't treat is prostate cancer.

name: Bronze Bwork Helmet
description: According to the legend, this impressive helmet turns anyone who wears it into a Bronze Bwork. The helmet was held responsible for a string of incidents where defenceless hobos mysteriously disappeared, leaving only the taste of licked spoon behind them.

name: Splash Sash
description: This belt will make you feel like a fish in water. And you could almost take that expression literally, given the ripe smell emanating from it.

name: Royal Pingwin Cloak
description: This cloak would have made a beautiful blanket for a bed had the tailor who crafted it not slept in a hammock.

name: Frigostine's Ring
description: When you find out that the main ingredient of Frigostine cream is Pingwin Blubber, you'll suddenly be much less inclined to lick this ring.

name: Amoolet
description: The Amoolet holds a strange substance that is only found in the guts of a Moowolf. Some say it's the monster's essence, others say it's just the semi-digested remains of a Kirball.

name: Worn Soft Oak Cape
description: More than 200 years ago, some fabric got stuck in the Soft Oak's branches. As the tree grew, it imbued the fabric with its magic. The cloth is now an integral part of this huge piece of wood and though it makes it hard to handle and highly flammable, its power can't be denied.

name: Frigostine's Boots
description: These boots allowed Frigostine to crush bread into crumbs. They also sometimes came in handy on tourists who failed to leave a tip. If there's one thing you should know about life on Frigost, it's that they don't mess about when it comes to respect.

name: Autumnal Soft Oak G-String
description: In autumn, the Soft Oak wears its G-string to protect his precious acorns. In summer time, he likes to go commando.

name: Moowolf Headgear
description: While dismembering the Moowolf, hunters discovered that it only has one big horn going right through its skull. That doesn't seem to bother Iops, who wear it proudly anyway.

name: Wanda Ring
description: If you don't place it on a finger, this ring will wander off on its own accord. It may also provide you with an excuse if you have wandering hands and can't stop shoving your fingers places you really shouldn't.

name: Frigostine's Belt
description: This belt will draw the enemy's attention to your love-handles and make them look good enough to eat. Decidedly, slimming techniques are getting more innovative by the day.

name: Fan Shield
description: When your allies run out of breath, or when you want to clear the air after an unexpected Wind of Panic, this shield can save your life. The only thing you need to do is to shake it energetically in all directions, like you'd do with a hungry baby.

name: Royal Pingwin Ring
description: A legend tells of a motley band of Frigostian cowards who tried to throw this ring into the crater of a volcano to destroy it. Fortunately for you, they failed.

name: Domakuro
description: Like a moon veiled behind dark clouds at night, the brightest light is often hidden in the blackest of inks.
stats: Starting on the 5th turn, the caster gains up to 64 damage for the rest of the fight based on the number of attacks that inflicted direct damage during each of the previous turns.

name: Firefoux Bag
description: Ideal for those spontaneous and oh-so-explosive games of lawn bowling among friends, this handmade cloth bag contains a full set of the highest quality Firefoux balls. Burn ointment not included.

name: Soft Oak Ring
description: This ring is made of Soft Oak faeces. It's wooden alright, but the smell remains the same.

name: Moowolf Cloak
description: The Moowolf's beautiful, fluffy tail is so long that it trails on the ground. Driven into a jealous rage, some adventurers pulled it off and they now wear it to increase fertility.

name: Firewelt
description: With the fireworks on this belt, you'll get the party hopping in no time!

name: Soft Oak Talisman
description: This piece of wood extracted from the very heart of the Soft Oak is extremely powerful. Indeed, it can even enrage the Soft Oak.

name: Jellyfish Wig
description: This used to be a normal jellyfish. But then Oktapodas saw it being bullied near his sanctuary, and so punished it by turning its tentacles to eels. Then he sent an adventurer named Pershing to kill it and turn it into a hat. Doesn't really seem fair, does it?

name: Indigenous Boots
description: These boots are meant to be worn by Frigostians whose parents were Frigostians whose parents were Frigostians and whose parents of their parents of their parents were Frigostians. If you're not Frigostian yourself, we wouldn't recommend you put these boots on.

name: Kanigloo Loincloth
description: There's no doubt about it. This loincloth belonged to at least one Kanigloo, maybe several. One less, now.

name: Talisman Dolin
description: Every time you scratch your neck, this amulet will make your vocal cords vibrate and you'll make the following noise: "Dzoing Dzoing". If that doesn't help you attract a mate, there's nothing more we can do for you.

name: Royal Pingwin Crown
description: The four huge, glowing balls that adorn this crown are considered by some Frigostian Pingwin experts to be a somewhat graphic representation of the Royal Pingwin's incredible fertility. Where do they get these hare-brained ideas?

name: Firefoux Ring
description: The craftsman who designed this ring clearly wanted to revolutionise how jewellery is worn. As you can see, this beautiful object doesn't fit around one finger but instead between two fingers thanks to its clever design.

name: Watring
description: Admit it, you've asked yourself how mermaids keep from getting lost in the ocean depths. Well here you have your answer. This ring is equipped with the latest Foggernaut technology, including a G.P.S. (Geolocation in the Depths of Sufokia) system and a camera for taking underwater selfies.

name: Soft Oak Flip-Flops
description: On Sundays, the Soft Oak takes a long nap and when he wakes up he likes to have an obedient Trunknid bring him his flip-flops. Fortunately, he doesn't have any feet so they're still brand new.

name: Wooden Treeckler Boots
description: These boots are so heavy that they should actually be categorised as weapons. Indeed, they make the slightest kick lethal.

name: Feudala Shield
description: Looking to fend off a frenzied attack? This shield from the village of Feudala should do the trick.

name: Elya Wood's Talisman
description: This Talisman was created with stardust and precious stones, encased in Ancestral Treechnid Amber. The mixture can be quite explosive, so it is not recommended you try to make it yourself. Leave it to a jeweller you don't like.

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Necklace
description: To dissuade greedy thieves, this necklace is secured around the neck of the heir to the Lord of the Rats at his birth. The only way to remove it is to take off his head... This doesn't seem to dissuade the thieves.

name: Light Treeckler Mask
description: This mask won't help you avoid or heal hangovers, but at least it gives you some chance of hiding the effects.

name: Zoth Warrior Helmet
description: This helmet has the same advantages as other Zoth hats - it'll protect you from the sun no matter how hot it is, from blows dealt on the head, and it prevents the wearer from being aware of the danger by restricting his visual field. Anyway, this is the perfect warrior headgear.

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Boots
description: The very first Lord of the Rats died when he stepped in a pool of molten lava. To pay tribute to him, his lords wear these boots. By the way, they are not in the least bit fireproof.

name: Kaliptus Headband
description: This headband will make Iops more handsome than ever!

name: Mastigator's Amulet
description: Wanted throughout Amakna, Mastigator keeps this amulet to remind him of what might happen if he ever decides to come out of exile.

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Hat
description: This hat has nothing to do with a Dora, a Brave's Dark Dora, a Dora Bora or a Doro L. Blak. Absolutely nothing! So don't bother spreading rumours about its designer being slack or uninspired! It's just a very nice looking hat.

name: Strich Hat
description: This hat has the incredible advantage of making you invisible when you stick your head in the sand.

name: Beltuc
description: Wearing this belt isn't easy – nor is removing it.

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Belt
description: The patterns on this belt will have people thinking you're on fire. The optical illusion is so powerful that you shouldn't be surprised when complete strangers throw water all over you. Amazingly enough, this corresponds exactly to the ceremonial ritual.

name: Zoth Sergeant Mask
description: This sturdy wooden mask will have you fearlessly facing all kinds of dangers, which isn't surprising given that it completely blocks your view.

name: Panthyrozy's Mask
description: Panthyrozy used to hide her face behind this mask, and not only when she was up to mischief! Her beauty was so great, it would have driven even the hardest of men mad…

name: Captain Scarlight's Glove
description: These gloves give whoever wears them a rather imposing air: don't be surprised if people suddenly start avoiding you, but don't enjoy it too much either.

name: Mastigator's Helmet
description: With this helmet on your head, you'll be the terror of the swamps. And there's more! The steam coming off your head whenever you think really hard will come out its nostrils, giving it an even more menacing look.

name: El Piko Amulet
description: This lucky cactus lives off the water in your body.

name: Nagate's Tear
description: Accused of stealing children to drown and devour them, the Lady of the Water really just wants to adopt them. So, she turns them into Kwapa so they don't drown.

name: Firefoux Spitfire
description: This Firefoux cannon is fantastic for launching fireworks far and high. Sadly, replacing the fireworks with tiny humans has been forbidden ever since the incident with a… Oh, never mind.

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Ring
description: This ring was designed at a time when the Lord of the Rats only had one finger left after mutilating all the others. The unfortunate lords that followed had all of theirs.

name: Capstuc
description: One might be tempted to knock you on the head, given the shape of this helmet… that's where the thorns come in handy.

name: Stretch Charmstrong
description: With this amulet around your neck, you look exactly like a Stretch (that's lost all its feathers and become deformed).

name: Moowolf Boots
description: Ubiquitous boots that are still driven by the voracious appetite of the Moowolf. If your feet smell of Clakoss, these boots will probably bite them.

name: Cape Ricious
description: Naive Frigostian tailors believe this cape to be an improved version of the famous Cape Rice. There's an inscription on its label: "This cape takes its name from its ability to become transparent around the posterior should the latter be somewhat on the large side". You've just realised that everyone can see your buttocks.

name: Belt Sterous
description: When an Ecaflip is bored, he usually takes his cards from his belt and starts a game of solitaire. In fight, he can also use the cards as projectiles. He draws a card faster than his shadow and once victory is his, there's always time for a little game!
stats: Rough Tongue no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Feline Spirit spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the All or Nothing spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Reflex spell's maximum range by 2
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Lapping Up spell
Reduces the Bravado spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Peril spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Pawpads spell's maximum range by 2

name: Targ Belt
description: This belt enables you to keep up baggy clothes (so as not to scare away sensitive souls) and it also offers a target to apprentice Cras. Indeed, they're taught to shoot right in the centre but never below the belt.
stats: Slow Down Arrow is no longer linear
Reduces the Poisoned Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Destructive Arrow spell
Reduces the Powerful Shooting spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Striking Arrow can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Curative Arrow can be cast per target by 1
Increases the Barricade Shot spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Tactical Beacon spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Girdle Belt
description: Ever provident, Fecas keep their survival supplies in a small bag. These supplies are principally bread made of Crackrock stones, which is why it lasts for so long. The Girdle Belt firmly secures the bag around their waist, because there are still way too many accidents linked to this bag falling, either due to negligence or plain stupidity.
stats: Increases the Typhoon spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Truce spell's AP cost by 1
Repulsion Glyph no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Backlash spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Gust spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the maximum number of times Backup can be cast per turn by 1
Barrier no longer requires a line of sight
10% Critical Hit bonus on the Tetany spell

name: Buoy's Belt
description: This diving belt is worth its weight in gold, but you still can't help feeling slightly disgusted imagining the dude who invented it. I mean, the portholes are lovely and all, but what kind of freak has eyes down there?
stats: Increases the Evolution spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Vapour spell's maximum range by 2
Makes the Ambush spell's range modifiable
Froth no longer requires a line of sight
Transition no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Valve spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Sonar can be cast per turn by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Nautilus spell

name: Strich Ring
description: This ring is a constant reminder that some awkward questions simply can't be answered.

name: Cyclone Belt
description: If you spin around on the spot very quickly while wearing this belt, something surprising may well happen to you. Although, since no-one who's ever done it is still around to talk about it, nobody knows what this surprise actually is. Give it a try though, you'll see for yourself!
stats: 30% Critical Hit bonus on the Therapy spell
Increases the Snub spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Ridicule spell's maximum range by 2
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Sinecure spell
Sarcasm no longer requires a line of sight
Persiflage no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Stretching spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Contraction spell's maximum range by 2

name: Plimclik
description: This strange name refers to an equally strange object made from previous amulets... goodness knows how. We know just as little about the circumstances in which it was found.

name: Bloody Belt
description: This beautiful belt adds to the prestige of the Iops' appearance. Some say that the central cross can become a detachable weapon when their swords aren't within reach. Obviously this is a legend. Only Srams are deceitful enough to have such things.
stats: Reduces the Iop's Wrath spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Chopper spell's maximum range by 3
Reduces the Blow spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Friction spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Fit of Rage spell
Increases the Fracture spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Violence spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Fight Back spell's maximum range by 3

name: Stretch Mac
description: Designed for bad weather, this cloak of Stretch feathers swells up to absorb rainwater... and gets so heavy that you can barely walk in it. You should probably just use it as a towel.

name: Captain Scarlight's Boots
description: Get ready for some incredible slides: since they have very little friction, these boots guarantee spectacular effects. That's actually how Captain Scarlight always seems to get out of sticky situations.

name: The Elebelt
description: Created to catalyse the energy of the Quadramental Breeze, this belt is the first piece of the traditional Huppermage tunic to be created. The style and colours were largely inspired by Bonta's, where its creator, The legendary Huppermage Ouatsonne, is from.
stats: Telluric Wave is no longer linear
Increases the Stalagmite spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Polarity spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Elemental Shield spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Cataract spell
Increases the Runic Repulsion spell's maximum range by 2
Sun Lance no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Flood spell's maximum range by 1

name: El Piko Ring
description: It's better to have small fingers for this ring to be comfortable, even if abrupt gestures aren't advised.

name: Sadida Shield
description: Sadidas originally used this shield as a stool when they needed to rest. If you fold the feet in, it will protect you from a wide range of attacks. Nothing will protect you from the cruel laughter of your opponents, however.

name: Turpitude Band
description: With a belt such as this one, it's hard not to imagine what's below it. And equally hard not to think of what's below other people's belts.

name: Dark Hurl Necklace
description: If you drop the pearls on this necklace, you'll be certain to hurl in frustration.

name: Sleepless Belt
description: The incessant ticking sound of the clock system of this belt prevents Xelors from sleeping when fights last forever. It is strongly advised that you take this belt off before going to bed.
stats: 25% Critical Hit bonus on the Xelor's Sandglass spell
Reduces the Counter spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Flight can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Drying Up spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Premonition spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Temporal Oop Shield spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Temporal Distortion can be cast per turn by 1

name: Sticky Strap
description: This belt helps Pandawas stand up straight (or almost) when they're drunk which they are, most of the time. In these moments, they tend to feel like they're stuck to the ground though gravity has no link whatsoever to this sensation. Gravity is way too busy knocking out scientists with Apis.
stats: 25% Critical Hit bonus on the Melancholy spell
Increases the Stain spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Karcham can be cast per target by 1
Increases the Brewing spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the maximum number of times Chamrak can be cast per target by 1
Increases the Drunkenness spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Inebriation spell's maximum range by 2

name: Frighog Helmet
description: It's no secret that Frighogs like to make a pig of themselves. Now you can justify doing the same thing.

name: Glisserin Belt
description: Useful for storing bombs, try not to dance around too much when wearing this belt, or you really will have a blast.
stats: Reduces the Extraction spell's AP cost by 1
Powder no longer requires a line of sight
Carbine no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Obliteration spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Walking Bomb spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Machine Gun spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Remission spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Sticky Bomb can be cast per turn by 1

name: Retchual Rope
description: To ascertain whether a Masqueraider was worthy of wearing its first mask, an ancient custom required that two young hopefuls be tied up and plunged head first into a barrel of bwork beer. The first one to escape earned his mask and wore the ropes around his waist as a souvenir of this rite of passage. Even if the tradition has died out, Masqueraiders still produce these belts in its memory.
stats: 30% Critical Hit bonus on the Tortoruga spell
Increases the Retention spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Ardour spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Armadur spell's maximum range by 2
Makes the Neurosis spell's range modifiable
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Estrelia spell
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Brincaderia spell

name: Snackpack Sack
description: This little bag will bring back fond memories of childhood (either yours or someone else's): your mum's homemade snacks, skipping down the path to school ready to take a bite out of life, and getting your precious snacks stolen by bigger kids… Ah, those were the days.

name: Clinkin Belt
description: This belt owes its name to the unusual noise it makes. The bones decorating the belt bang together, preventing Srams, even those who are invisible, from sneaking up on their enemies unannounced. Surprise someone wearing a Clinkin Belt? You've got a snowball in the Obsidemon's Hypogeum's chance!
stats: Increases the Fear spell's maximum range by 1
Lethal Trap is no longer linear
Increases the Con spell's maximum range by 2
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Cruelty spell
Reduces the Misconstrual spell's AP cost by 1
10% Critical Hit bonus on the Perfidy spell
Increases the spell's maximum range by 2
Makes the Waylaying spell's range modifiable

name: Blub Belt
description: Though it won't stop the sobbing, this belt will hold lots of medical supplies. This is especially important for Eniripsas... when they have a sore throat, they can't cast their spells properly. And when they're voiceless ... well, they're as useful as a bear skin jacket in a heat wave.
stats: Stimulating Word no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Blaring Word spell's maximum range by 2
Puzzling Word no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Revitalising Word spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Self-Sacrificing Word can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Galvanising Word spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Furious Word spell's maximum range by 2
15 Damage on the spell: Resounding Word

name: Strap Pado
description: Warriors of an ancient tribe renowned for their love for blood, the Pados may have been the first worshippers of the goddess Sacrier. Despite its harmless appearance, this belt is a real sophisticated instrument of torture.
stats: 20% Critical Hit bonus on the Nervousness spell
Clobbering no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Retribution spell
Increases the Condensation spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Torture spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Blood Bath spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Influx spell
Reduces the Bloodthirsty Madness spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Diezzle Belt
description: Osamodas are known to be quite touchy, and can fly off the handle at the slightest thing. The numerous buckles and horns on this belt are there to help them rein in this anger, as touching them and counting out loud is supposed to be quite calming.
stats: Increases the Third spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Call to Order spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the High-Energy Shot spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Fifth spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Relay spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Replacement spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Plucking spell's maximum range by 2
Duster no longer requires a line of sight

name: Pandasiman Training Shield
description: This shield seems way too heavy for training purposes. Your body becomes a lot heavier and your movements sluggish. No one said Pandawushuka training would be a walk in the park.
conditions: Quest 'Yonkwa: Path of the Sabre' complete

name: Lord of the Rats' Ceremonial Cape
description: This colourful cape turns you into an ideal target. Only quick and nimble adventurers can wear it for more than a few minutes.

name: Belt Atio
description: The reason the designers of this fashion accessory put the doll head next to the crotch is still unknown.
stats: Reduces the Insolent Bramble spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Inflatable spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Bush Fire spell's AP cost by 1
Tree no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Paralysing Bramble spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Transmuted Inflatable spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Voodoo Curse spell's AP cost by 1
Leafy Tree no longer requires a line of sight

name: Belt Urgid
description: This belt is a very handy fashion accessory used by male Enutrofs. The map sewn onto it hides the little accidents they have when they get lost looking for the toilets.
stats: Reduces the Bribery spell's AP cost by 1
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Slaughtering Shovel spell
Increases the Living Shovel spell's maximum range by 4
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Shovel Kiss spell
Reduces the Decadence spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Carnivore Spade spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Living Spade spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Spade Kiss spell's maximum range by 2

name: Royal Mastogob Belt
description: This belt was formerly used as a chastity belt, which is quite surprising when you consider how fond Royal Mastogobs are of putting their dungeon keys in a bowl and having a big party.

name: Belting Belt
description: Used as a whip, this belt can make you scream with pleasure – whether you're the whipper or the whippee.
stats: Protective Pelt no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Carrion spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Marrow Bone spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Panic spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Ferocity spell's AP cost by 1
Makes the Radius spell's range modifiable
Reduces the Vertebra spell's AP cost by 1

name: Dreggon Helmet
description: A little angel like you could easily pass for a merciless warrior with such a terrifying and disproportionate helmet on. If that doesn't work, it'll make a great cloak rack.

name: Doro L. Blak
description: This cap used to belong to a little Xelorette who got a kick out of disrupting the passage of time. Legend has it that she once stole several days off the inhabitants of Amakna. She had to hand out quite a few candies to make up for that little trick.

name: Moowish Belt
description: Bowisse the shoemaker made this belt. He gave it to Brouce Boulgoure when the legendary lumberjack managed to uproot the Soft Oak... You don't even deserve to hear about such heroism, child!

name: Cutting Ring
description: The ideal accessory for any robbery! Make quick work of any window with this ring, which is as sharp as diamond.

name: Capetuc
description: This cape can by equipped in two ways: one being recommended for anyone who isn't a Sacrier.

name: Zoth Girl Hat
description: The Zoth Girl's hat makes her see double. Strange. This is the reason she lisps.

name: Royal Mastogob Amulet
description: The first thing your opponent noticed before stealing this necklace was how sparkly it was. Funnily enough, that was also the last thing you noticed as your head went tumbling to the floor.

name: Strich Belt
description: With this around your hips, you can bet that your belt area will get a lot of attention. Just don't be surprised if people start avoiding you in the street.

name: Cloakscreen
description: This cape will do a marvellous job of protecting you from the most violent of winds, but it won't stop you from being ignored by everyone you try to talk to.

name: Dreggon Boots
description: These boots are perfect for killing Gobballs while playing Gobbowl or making your enemies suffer some more during spanking sessions.

name: Zoth Disciple Hat
description: From a distance, this hat looks like a lampshade with two holes for the eyes. It looks the same up close actually.

name: Kwapuddle Cap
description: This headgear has many uses. These include as a head-covering, of course, but also as a bucket, chamber pot, or spittoon.

name: Titfertat Hat
description: If you've ever meanly swiped this hat from someone, know that someday someone will make you eat this titfertat hat.

name: Captain Scarlight's Belt
description: This belt probably fit Captain Scarlight alright, but it has a tendency, just like Captain Scarlight, to grab you uncomfortably between the legs.

name: El Piko Sombrero
description: Who's never dreamed wearing this type of sombrero, at least for a few seconds?

name: Whipping String
description: It may look harmless but the end of this belt can be used as a fearsome whip against all who stand in your path.

name: Royal Tofu Crown
description: This crown is almost impossible to hold... No surprise, it belongs to the Royal Tofu! Doesn't seem to suit your small head, though. I think it just might be out of your league. LOSER!!!

name: Chocrunch Helmet
description: Whoever designed this item wasn't very clever: if you don't want to be stumbling around in the dark (chocolate), you need to eat one side of the helmet.

name: Dreggon Ring
description: This ring, directly cut in the shape of a giant Dreggon scale, will protect a small part of your phalanx. Maybe the most important part…

name: Koalak Chest Bag
description: This chest, worn like a bag, is an incredibly practical invention. Unfortunately, it seems that it attracts young Koalaks and other undesirables. Only adventurers with strong shoulders should consider using it without being dogged with bad luck.

name: Ellie's Mental Amulet
description: Proudly sporting this amulet around your neck will demonstrate your mastery of all four primordial elemental energies. It will not make you any wealthier, however.

name: Stretch Oohs
description: These boots make the same sounds as Stretches do during mating season. Don't be surprised if you attract quite a following every time you wear them out of the house!

name: Cromagmunk Helmet
description: You know that name they call you in the guild? No? Oh well, wearing this helmet, you'll soon find out.

name: Mastic Ring
description: This ring is unbearable for two reasons: it stinks of wet Mastogob, and it's covered in hairs which tickle you constantly between the fingers. Probably not the best present for your beloved.

name: Moowolf Ring
description: Beware! This ring will make your finger stink, although the foul smell may cover a worse odour. Actually, that might be the best thing that could happen to your finger, your hands, and the people around you, to be honest.

name: Dreggon Belt
description: The most perverted minds in Amakna used to say that this belt could be used as a prosthesis. Fortunately the rumour was exposed as a lie - it's just a plain old Dreggon Belt.

name: Light Treeckler Belt
description: Carved from a Light Treeckler, this belt won't afford you great protection, but at least it is soft enough to let you move around freely.

name: Chocrunch Boots
description: Made by two brothers, Ay-Ess and Em-Ar, these boots make the delicious sound of cracking chocolate with every step you take.

name: Mastigator's Cape
description: Mastigator never was all that clean, and this cape shows it: it looks as if he may have used it as a napkin or tissue. Or both. Probably both.

name: Kwarapace
description: Despite the rumours, jumping on the back of a Kwapa won't ensure victory.

name: Nutcrackers
description: Very useful for shelling small nuts, these gloves are also – and above all – formidable weapons against opponents of the male persuasion.

name: Nettlez
description: Worn by the most important people in the World, this cloak is famous for its legendary softness which means you don't have to put on underwear in the warm season. An elegant way to expose yourself…

name: Imp Shield
description: If your dearest dream is to become a real imp, this is the shield you need. Passed down from generation to generation, it will let you rob all the young Astrubian adventurers you like without getting hurt.

name: Aykido Medal
description: This medal used to belong to a famous Pandawa master at an old martial arts school who taught his disciples the principles of defence using their opponents' strength. His school finally closed down because his opponents were no longer strong enough.

name: Dreggon Cape
description: According to the legend, this scale-covered cape will protect you from lightning, beans and femmes fatales, whatever they are.

name: Royal Mastogob Hat
description: This hat's horns sit directly against the temples of the brave adventurer who dares to wear it. As a result, they resonate at the same frequency as the brain's alpha waves, allowing the wearer to communicate with distant Gullipops without needing to open their mouth or ears, which comes in very handy when trying to infiltrate a tribe of the googly-eyed creatures.

name: Xenature
description: Contrary to appearances, Xena was not a warrior, but a shoemaker. Her generous figure and her unlimited passion for housework strongly suggested a brilliant career in the inns of Amakna. But it wasn't to be.

name: Moowolf Belt
description: This coloured belt has a wonderful purple tuft on the front and if you wear it back to front you can pretend to be a Wabbit.

name: Xelomorph Cloak
description: This semi-transparent cloak adapts to suit its wearer's look and makes them look even more imposing.

name: Ditchy Belt
description: The shoemaker loved strolling in the fields, looking for improbable love. Instead of finding her soul mate, she died falling into a huge ditch full of filth, close to the Pig Zone. Her body was found seventy years later, when they finally emptied the ditch. Her brother apparently said: "We all have to go sometime", before falling into the ditch himself.

name: Fraktal Hat
description: "Nananananananana FRAKTAL!" Yep. You're practically a superhero now.

name: Dreggon Amulet
description: Made of Dreggon scales, this amulet will efficiently protect your Adam's Api or your tonsils. It will make all the difference on a battlefield.

name: Mastic Cloak
description: When correctly trailed in the snow, this cloak will leave horn marks fit to frighten off the weakest monsters, although the same can't be said for enraged Royal Mastogobs, who will see through the tracks in a flash and inevitably set off after you.

name: Xelomorph Boots
description: There's nothing scarier than a Xelomorph staring at you with its big, shining eyes… So just imagine how frightened your enemies will be when they see you in these boots!

name: Spring Leaf
description: It was this amulet, which was especially designed for older Enutrofs, that allowed Setag to get rid of all the other miners in the Grimoth mine. Quite heavy-handed, but very effective, it must be said.

name: Harry Boots
description: Harry was an old wise man who spent his days fishing on the docks of Sufokia. His great moustache made him look like Danous Kwaide, famous actor of a theatre company that used to play at the Amakna Tavern. All this was only a prelude to incredible beer and meat ball orgies.

name: Snailmet
description: You'll look like a Snailmet if you wear this hat. Of course it will protect your head from blows, but does that make up for the slobber all over your head?

name: Wewe-Wabbit Belt
description: Even if you haven't noticed that the Cawwot adorning this belt is a tawdry shade of purple, other people will. Prepare a terrifying story about how you triumphed over two-headed Wabbits, living Cawwots and Wabbit-bat hybrids, or say goodbye to your street cred.

name: Himune
description: This strange hat will protect you from sun beams, especially when its dark. Be careful though, every thirty years it comes to life and tries to suffocate its owner... It doesn't say when the last time... I wouldn't worry about it.

name: Fraktal Belt
description: This belt has several amazing properties, including the ability to reproduce infinite quantities of its own logo. Not bad for hypnotising your enemies.

name: Janus Wabbit Ring
description: The third eye on this ring is the result of a genetic modification made to the Janus Wabbits. Be aware that you may suffer side effects when wearing it... If you feel an extra eye, nose or arm starting to grow, please take the ring off as soon as possible before the situation gets worse.

name: Dark Animal Boots
description: These boots aren't just dark, they're Dark with a capital D. So don't be surprised if a vampire falls in love with you when you wear them. I don't know if you've had a hard life up to now, but I would say it would be the worst thing that's ever happened to you. The worst, seriously. Worse than, well, I don't know. Really bad. Like, awful.

name: Sandal Titude
description: Titude, a modest Enutrof shoemaker, was even smaller than a Xelor. Legend says he created these sandals to be able to kiss his lady-love, a legless Eniripsa, on the lips.

name: Mastic Band
description: This ring is made of finest gold extracted from Royal Mastogob horns. It's sure to touch the heart of anyone who fully appreciates the efforts necessary for its fabrication.

name: Wewe-Wabbit Boots
description: One of the most popular Wabbit games out there is Whewe's Wabbit. The rules are simple: one participant dons a pair of Wewe-Wabbit Boots and hides in a dense crowd. The others then look high and low for the one with the boots. When they find him, they 'wip him to shweds'. Have fun!

name: Caracape Minotoris
description: This cape, which looks royal, offers incredible protection. It made the reputation of a renowned female tailor who died victim of her success, squashed in the crowd.

name: Shield in Briefs
description: This strange-looking shield is covered with used underpants that once belonged to a Chafer – certainly the best way show your opponents that you intend to beat the pants off of them.

name: Dora Bora
description: This magnificent hat was created on Dora Bora Island, south of Moon Island. Perfectly adapted to fight, it's also much appreciated as a fruit basket, for traumatised Rokokonuts for instance.

name: Inferno's Boots
description: Inferno used to wear these boots to trample all over his apprentices and the basic rules of good manners.

name: Fraktal Ring
description: Although this ring is extremely fragile, it will make you hugely powerful. Just make sure you don't sit on it by accident.

name: Crowish Belt
description: This belt is a patchwork of Lord Crow's body parts. Once equipped with it, you'll have a wonderful sensation of power. LeChouque even agreed to add his buckle as a show of support.

name: Will Killson's Boots
description: Like all great warriors, Will Killson always had something up his sleeve. In his case, it was actually a spare pair boots. Unconventional, but practical.

name: Styx's Boots
description: Styx underwent a bizarre initiation ceremony involving him being ducked underwater in a river. These boots saved his life: if they had slipped off when Fetis grabbed hold of them to yank him out, he would have been swept downstream and lost forever.

name: Mandrin's Boots
description: These boots allow their wearer to play in seven leagues at once. Mandrin was never that into Gobbowl, so he just wore them to kick Perceptors' rumps and do the gardening in.

name: Wewe-Wabbit Cloak
description: Snuggling up in this warm cape will make nightfall feel as cosy as returning home to a bowl of stew and a seat by the fire. Unless you wear it on the night of the full moon, of course.

name: Elya Wood's Wedding Ring
description: This small wedding ring will fit an Eniripsa's little fingers perfectly. For Iops, however, it's almost unusable. Their fingers are too fat and they can't get it into their heads that it's not a bracelet.

name: Janus Wabbit Boots
description: Janus Wabbits have three legs. You've got a spiffing new pair of boots from the two outer legs, but you can't help wondering whether the third foot matches your left foot or your right...

name: Royal Mastogob Boots
description: If you run through the snow wearing these boots, you'll leave Royal Mastogob-sized footprints behind. The only thing missing will be the print of a Royal Mastogob-sized tail.

name: Renewed Amulet
description: The renowned and hilarious Yamato, a craftsman unjustly despised because of his ridiculous bow, was the first to dare to imbue an amulet with magic… until then it was believed to be impossible.

name: Colousses Boots
description: When you walk with these boots, each step causes an annoying little metallic sound, as if they were made of steel.

name: Solomonk
description: The Solomonk hat was worn by the Chief of a Pandawa tribe. Experts in laxative potions, low-ranking Pandawas were often obliged to test the potions for the alchemists. When banished to the jungle for these trials, this hat doubled as a chamber pot, reducing their load considerably.

name: Xelomorph Ring
description: This ring will show the world that the thing it needs to fear the most is you (well, kind of).

name: Nee Cap
description: This hat was made a long time ago by apprentice tailors who wanted to protect themselves from the violent fits of rage of Mirko, their boss. This fine business man was often forced to kick his apprentices in the head when they didn't work fast enough. From what I've heard, that was far too good for the lazy bast.

name: Aman Date Belt
description: Aman, a renowned female shoemaker had a lover who often stood her up. As love is blind, she still gave him this magnificent belt as a symbol of their secret love.

name: Colousses Scalp
description: This scalp is created from hairs from Colousses's skull, and it's particularly hideous, but at least you'll have some hair handy in case of any sudden baldness.

name: Clay-headed Giant's Helmet
description: On the box of this helmet, it said: 'This imposing clay helmet will turn you into a giant with a head of clay'. Upon further inspection, you realise the helmet is not made of clay, but of lead. Every year, many adventurers die, trapped under this helmet like nipples under a Chinese fire cup.

name: Siren Thong
description: These thong sandals were formerly used by female Pandits to seduce lost adventurers and lure them into traps.

name: Janus Wabbit Amulet
description: Hardly anyone dares wear this amulet. It may be soft, but being near the Janus Wabbit's tail is... well, let's just say it's uncomfortable for anyone who's not used to the smell. If you're used to hanging around at Gwimace's, you should be fine.

name: Wheritz Hat
description: This basin-shaped hat was used by the firemen of Amakna when there were fires on cereal fields. Nowadays it is mainly used by brewers and pub waitresses who are treated like walking barrels.

name: Terrdala Shield
description: Looking to fend off a frenzied attack? This shield from the village of Terrdala should do the trick.

name: Snailmet Ring
description: Carved in a Snailmet carapace, this ring can resist anything and anyone.

name: Colousses Belt
description: Like a champion's belt, Colousses's Belt shows the world which of you two won out in your battle against this immense creature.

name: Ecaflee Ring
description: Only an exceptional jeweller could have conceived such a marvel, made with unparalleled attention to detail.

name: Ecaflee Collar
description: Worn on a necklace, this Bytbul will bring you luck in the most disastrous situations.

name: Ancestral Treechelmet
description: The mushrooms pushing up on this helmet spread a nice exhilarating smell that makes you want to take roots. They are also quite tasty but might definitely bury you.

name: Abdominable Belt
description: This wooden belt is just right for holding in large stomachs and protecting tummy buttons from Critical Hits.

name: Ancestral Ring
description: If you've had a little too much to drink, you might see the Moskito embedded in this ring wink at you. But don't tell your friends, the little beast will deny everything.

name: Mothat
description: This hat is a tribute to the distant cousins of the Moskitos: the Moths. A lot bigger and a lot kinder than the Moskitos, the Moths took such good care of their livestock that they soon became extinct from self-inflicted famine. From this tragic story, we have the common insult 'Moth' as in, 'Poor bloody Moth', which describes a fellow who discovers his spouse is devastatingly gluttonous.

name: Minotoror Boots
description: You won't go winning the legendary race of Amakna Bay with these terrible boots of Minotoror Hair and leather. You might manage to break the competitors' toes on the starting line, though.

name: Ancestral Treecape
description: In summer, the Ancestral Treechnid likes to sunbathe but as its wood is accustomed to dark forests, it doesn't stand it very well. This cape is made of his bark peelings.

name: Ecaflee Cape
description: Give the Melouse a hiding and make yourself a Melcape!

name: Capistil
description: If you've always dreamed of having lots of children, don this cape and dance through the fields. When you return in the spring, your babies will have sprouted.

name: Minotoror Necklace
description: This necklace protected the Minotoror from getting fleas, ticks and even lice. You can be the judge of whether you need it or not.

name: Ancestral Treebelt
description: This belt is supposed to inspire you with ancestral virility. Whether this was ever true or not, the effect has now surely gone without a trace.

name: Krutch
description: This hat, strangely named, belonged to a poor Ecaflip who became mute after a traumatic event. An artist through and through, he was compelled to follow a Brewer training. When he turned 14, he drowned in a barrel of beer and tears. Fortunately, beer was not wasted as the priest who was in charge of the funeral fell into an alcoholic coma for many years before he could take his office right where he had stopped it.

name: Powerful Dazzling Cloak
description: Woven from Zoth fabrics, this cape has extraordinary powers of unknown origin.

name: Violet Arrow Helmet
description: Wearing this hat will earn you a few amused glances and maybe a few snickers too. Maybe that's why Violet Arrow is an archer. So that he can fight from afar – in other words, out of sight.

name: Crimson Dofus
description: Ignemikahl the Fire Dragon created the Crimson Dofus. I would tell you that it stinks of sulphur… but it stinks of so many other things too.
stats: For each distance attack suffered, the final damage inflicted is increased by 1% for 1 turns.

name: Bimd'Oule Hat
description: It was an old, unlucky, bitter Enutrof who first discovered this terrible hat, hidden at the bottom of a crevasse in the Bimd'Oule Caverns. Later, the Enutrof exiled himself far away from the lands of Amakna to escape boredom and discover new horizons. Legend tells that he comes back to his native land once a century to make fun of his old friends... but we all know he's just a bit nostalgic.

name: Ancestral Shin Guards
description: With these wooden Shin Guards on, your legs will be fully protected. You cannot wear boots at the same time.

name: Dotrich
description: Dragon's egg or Strich egg? Maybe it's half and half... After all, if there's a Dragon Pig, there could be a Dragon Strich somewhere out there. Heh... Hehehe... PSHAWHAWHAW! Okay, no, that would just be too ridiculous. …Or would it?

name: Ancestral Torc
description: Worn around your neck with a low-cut top, this torc will accentuate your beard beautifully. If you don't have one... well... you only have yourself to blame.

name: Asse Shield
description: This magnificent shield contains a few drops from the Asse Sea. Not only does it bring good luck, but it can also be used as a flask.

name: Bulbuckler
description: Thanks to this shield, win your battles without buckling under the weight of flowers!

name: Dragostess Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll be able to dress up and seduce any naive Astrubian you find... Just offer him a hot date for 100 kamas, and Bob's your uncle, his wallet's empty.

name: Violet Arrow Cape
description: It's said that Violet Arrow likes this color because he was raised by Goblins. Which might explain the countless arrows planted around their camp.

name: Minotoror Belt
description: This supple belt can be used to whip unruly kids' bottoms. Its buckle might even mark their skin but this would only teach them their lesson once and for all.

name: Dragandrop Headgear
description: This little headgear lets Dragandrops throw themselves at their enemies without running the risk of getting lumps on their foreheads. It's long been in use on major construction sites in Amakna, as well. This headgear became all the rage again after Moowolves from Kruup Mountain invaded Astrub. What's the point of this story? There is no point, but who cares?

name: Dragon Pig Ring
description: This ring of leather and ivory makes it easier for you to stimulate your partner.

name: Palishat
description: This wedding hat has long gone out of fashion, since its lace is no longer considered stylish. If it were recycled into knickers, it might still get a reaction out of a weary Chafer.

name: Plantamulet
description: Swallow this amulet and it'll release a small seed in your stomach. If you open your mouth regularly on sunny days and drink enough water, maybe a shrub will grow inside you.

name: Minotoror Cloak
description: Take a Minotoror. Firmly tie him up. Take a giant plane and peel off his back in a oner. There! You've got your Minotoror Cloak!

name: Saurosheller Amulet
description: This amulet is the trophy which proves that you decimated hordes of Sauroshells who had barely had the time to grow up. Now your mission is to conceal this mass infanticide from their parents, Grozilla and Grasmera, who are no longer weak and pubescent at all.

name: Snowy Grale Boots
description: These boots, which are fitted with wooden rackets, will be underfoot wherever you go. They are resistant to digestive juices and caustic humour.

name: Punkibelt
description: Al Howin wore this cursed belt religiously until the day it came to life and started attacking all the the other belts it came across, whether they were attached to waists or not. As you can imagine, the whole thing was rather embarrassing for Al Howin and gave him quite a reputation.

name: Hairy Arachelmet
description: Don't fancy equipping the Arachelmet? Then you're not going to like the Hairy Arachelmet! It's lined with Arachnee web, sewn together with threads of the stuff and perfumed with pheromones in such a way that an amorous Arachnee will always be following you. It might be better offering it to an Arachneephobe; they'll either overcome their fear, or die from terror. Either way, it's for their own good.

name: Baahboh Insignia
description: By wearing this insignia, you'll become a Keeper of the Peace. Dressed in your nice blue uniform, you'll be a Baahboh, a civil servant. Honest citizens will accord you the greatest respect, and delinquents will tremble at the mere mention of your name – at least, in theory. In the real world, it'll be almost exactly the opposite.

name: Cuttings
description: Never stand around idly with these boots on your feet or you just might take root.

name: Gaddie's Hat
description: Gaddie, a strange creature from an imaginary World, always stood out for its incredible cunning, its total aversion to plants and its ability to fast for days on end in times of war. A creature that's complex to understand was obviously impossible to control. It was abandoned in the depths of the bottomless Kruup mine where its only friend was an old, Gobbly devouring Liche.

name: Black Rat Cape
description: This cape can be made with any sort of animal hair provided that it's very dirty. They are plaited together and then cemented with various secretions. The smell is unfortunately not optional.

name: Hurtful Locker Helmet
description: It's never felt this good to have horns! China shops, here you come!

name: Graytess Cape
description: You just can't stay inside this cape; it'll throw you out whether you want to go or not.

name: White Rat Hat
description: The White Rat of Bonta looks like a real White Rat of Bonta when he wears this hat. Without it, he looks like a real White Rat of Bonta without a hat.

name: Heart Quarter
description: A renowned adventurer and collector spent his whole life looking for all four quarters of this shield. Some say that when the shield is complete, it has the exact opposite effect of that of breaking a mirror.

name: Ouassulet
description: This jewel sometimes tries to steal some of your food when you're eating, so don't let it hang down too low.

name: Ouassingual Hood
description: It may be less efficient than the Sovereign Hood, but it still allows for a good draining of the sweat. Maybe too good, actually. As a result, whether you wear it or not, it won't make any difference.

name: Precious Cloak
description: Wearing this cloak will give you an irrepressible urge to blurt out everything that passes through your head. Who cares, when the whole world will see you've got a tongue to put even Sean Jimmons to shame!

name: Deceitful Wedding Ring
description: Take some Ambusher leaves, pile them up, let them macerate in stale alcohol, pierce them, drink the left-over alcohol, stick the leaves around a piece of bark, fix some pieces of Tikoko leaves with a slimy material, and here is a magnificent Deceitful Wedding Ring. It smells really bad and it will be quite handy for you to justify the smell of your fingers overall if you have a tendency to put them everywhere. Especially where you shouldn't.

name: Ambusherboots
description: Once you've tried these boots on, you won't be able to part with them. Not because they are exceptional, but because they are exceptionally sticky. A feature they often share with female Ambushers.

name: Punkihat
description: It's a shame the lights aren't on upstairs - you'd make a pretty little lantern!

name: Cally Bangle
description: Dramak just won't stop telling you what a fantastic idea it was to make multiple copies of this bracelet. And as shattering magic objects is your favourite hobby, you're inclined to agree.

name: Saurosheller Belt
description: The Saurosheller Belt is traditionally presented to Vulkanian teenagers and becomes impossible to remove when they become adults. That way, they have to stay in shape if they don't want it cutting into their flesh. As for you, perhaps you can squeeze it around one thigh, or, more realistically, a calf.

name: Dragon Pig Cloak
description: This cloak will not turn you into a Piglet but at least you'll be able dress up for one night and seduce a beautiful sow.

name: Black Rat Necklace
description: The rat who used to own this necklace thought he would become the chief of his clan. He was devoured by a rabid Lenald.

name: Gorgoyle Boots
description: Wearing these boots, you can make the ground tremble by tapping your foot, which is sure to titillate all the Lousy Pigs in your vicinity. A cheap but dangerous way of finding a partner.

name: Deceitful Belt
description: Outstanding handicraft made of remains of Ambushers and litter picked up along the Moon beaches, in the middle of the foul foam, this belt, when worn alone, will give you a really surprising look. Enough to disconcert your enemies or surprise your beloved, you'll be able to take advantage of this special moment when, for once, you'll have the upper hand.

name: Moon Cloak
description: This cloak is made from Kokoko Leaves and Citronanas, which explains its exotic colours and undeniable charm. Unfortunately, it emits a less charming odour that attracts every kind of wild animal imaginable, who take you for a giant, delicious banana.

name: Deceitful Amulet
description: This amulet is made of a mixture of Ambusher leaves and litter from Moon island. It looks more like a garland than a real amulet, but it will help you seduce the wildlife of the island, which almost exclusively consists of abominable creatures. No Ambusher will resist you, they all will fly into your arms to give you a hickey. Only the most unlucky in love will appreciate this piece.

name: Dark Miner Hat
description: This magnificent hat will help you see everything as bright as daylight, especially during the daytime. It can also be useful to dazzle the beasts haunting the mines or to make Iops believe you're... well anything you tell them.

name: Boowoldlum Headgear
description: Don't take its nonchalant style and empty gaze at face value: the Boowoldlum makes them all crack up, whether it's a Boowonoké or your ribs.

name: Black Rat Mask
description: Brouce Boulgoure used this mask to discreetly infiltrate a Grossewer rats' den and cut down an elm by the roots. On the way out, he squashed every single rat in the den with his wooden clogs.

name: White Rat Necklace
description: Plumbers wear this necklace when descending into the intestine-like sewers of our cities. If you wear it as a belt, it will protect your allies from your sewer-like intestines.

name: Mehlodra Mask
description: Before being used as a mask, this was an old chamber pot that passed through the hands of many owners. Due to a misunderstanding, Dramak put it on his head and, too proud to admit his mistake, has refused to this day to take it off.

name: Moon Amulet
description: The Kanniballs fashioned this item with an image of Moon, who they consider the God-Monkey of the island. According to legend, it was a strike of the monkey hammer that gave it the shape of a crescent moon. At least, that’s what the employees at Charlie's Agents tell travellers who come to spend their holidays on the island when they’re trying to extort a few kamas for the amulet.

name: White Rat Cape
description: This cape is the unmistakable banner of the Bonta white sewer rat network. It is the reward the rat gets after a long and difficult series of examinations and is proudly worn until he pants his final ratty breath… which usually isn't a long time.

name: White Rat Belt
description: Though his Black Brakmarian cousin may not agree, the white rat likes to be as discreet as possible.... he padded the metallic links of this belt with tar so it doesn't make any noise... unless the person wearing it trips and falls... which happens a lot given it weighs about a ton.

name: Troubadoration
description: So you want to play the swaggart and have everybody's eyes on your mediocre self? This hat's for you. It'll replace all your bragging and cowardice with actual virtues, and all for a modest price.

name: Hurtful Locker Boots
description: Although they're supposed to symbolise virility, these boots are most often on the feet of people who need to compensate for something. Curious...

name: Black Rat Boots
description: Be careful when you put on these boots, as there might still be a foot or two of the previous owner inside them.

name: White Rat Gauntlet
description: This Gauntlet used to belong to Julia Dilch, master cook at the Bonta palace. After a while, she never took it off - a Gobball that refused to have its throat cut, a tough fillet of lamb, even the odd head of lettuce, all fell victim to her vicious blows.

name: Saurosheller Cloak
description: The Saurosheller Cloak is a guilty pleasure for Vulkania's craftsmen, who get a kick out of seeing an adventurer run in one: the hard, heavy cape smacks against his calves, wears down his shoulder blades and often knocks him entirely off balance.

name: Kabuto
description: Formerly worn by the authorities of the greatest cities, this helmet is now used to intimidate rebels and those who are a bit too curious about the rulers of the universe.

name: Punkicape
description: Al Howin stuck the Pumpkwin seeds onto the back of this cape himself. He wanted to plant Pumpkwins all over the World in order to spread his curse. Whilst you're waiting for that to happen, why don't you have a nibble – they're most nutritious!

name: Black Rat Belt
description: Unlike his white Bontarian cousin, the Black rat is discreet and wears a simple fabric belt. But he also likes to take a lot of weapons with him and it all makes a terrible clinking noise at each of his steps.

name: Etorik Belt
description: The fact that a certain Levito wore this belt caused no small uproar amongst Dramak's servants, and it took Dramak a monumental effort to convince them he was their one true chief.

name: Precious Belt
description: The creator of this belt got fed up of losing the key to it and enchanted the lock so it would open up to any key at all. Just thought you should know before you went out into the big bad world hoping to keep your trousers up.

name: Ambusherot
description: As the story goes, the dead Ambushers are very comfortable once they have taken the time to rot under the sun. Indeed, they become much more flexible and softer with time. Many adventurers would like to say the same about their beloved.

name: Ambusheadgear
description: This headgear isn't giving you the smartest look, is it? But you do still look less stupid with it on. So just keep it!

name: Bwork Chief Bracelet
description: Even your good friends will think you've married a great Bwork Chief if you sport this little thing on your wrist. It's enough to get you a few free drinks at the local inn... Don't be fooled though, they'll be pity drinks.

name: Boot-a-Hoop
description: With these boots on, the Iops are always the first to get to the battlefield and start livening the place up. It's common knowledge that this class love to amuse the crowd with their warrior exploits. But they're never taken seriously because of their intelligence, which is inversely proportional to their strength.
stats: Increases the Sword of Iop spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Sword of Judgement spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Precipitation spell's cooldown period by 1
Massacre no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Pygmachia spell
Condemnation no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Agitation spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Gathering spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Crusuede Shoes
description: These shoes enable their wearer to dance all night long, despite blisters and corns! They dance to the rhythm of the night and make a little "beep beep" sound when they're next to religious artefacts. You'll be bright as a button the next day too, ready for a bit of slaughter.
stats: 10 Damage on the spell: Coin Throwing
Reduces the Living Chest spell's AP cost by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Unsummoning spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Hard Cash spell
Increases the Regenerating Chest spell's maximum range by 3
Increases the Loafylactic spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Correction spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Shovelbrained spell's maximum range by 1

name: Doc Post-Martems
description: Rogues are so sneaky that they hide their Machiavellian plans and mission orders in their boots. I mean, who's reckless enough to brave the deadly stench just to check inside a dead Rogue's boots?
stats: Reduces the Kickback spell's AP cost by 1
Grenado no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Blunderbuss spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Ruse spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Latent Grenado spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Arquebus spell
Increases the Musket spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Shrapnel spell's maximum range by 1

name: Oppressor
description: This Trophy enables you to oppress your aggressors more easily. It also seems to work on digressers.

name: Adamantin
description: This Trophy lessens your suffering a little when your opponents push you against a tree, a person, an animal or just something really big and hard. It does not protect you from blows, not even those dealt by calloused hands.

name: Water Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Water attacks, but not from Water sports.

name: Transporter
description: This Trophy increases the maximum weight you're able to carry. It doesn't make a heavy heart any easier to bear though.

name: Acrobat
description: This trophy increases your Agility. You're finally going to be able to climb on your high horse without falling off.

name: Scholar
description: This Trophy increases your Intelligence. I wonder why the auctioneers at the Astrub Zaap have never thought to get one?

name: Survivor
description: This trophy increases Vitality. Its effects against impotence have never been proven.

name: Krosmastrap
description: The buckle of this belt has a little slot in the top for you to keep your GG points. Your local shoemaker attached that piece upside down because he knew you were going to make a habit of losing.

name: Krosmaboots
description: It doesn't matter if you can't give your enemies a kicking in Krosmaster tournaments; with these boots on, you can take it out on monsters in fights instead!

name: Goliath
description: This Trophy will show the world that Strength runs deep in your family.

name: Brainbox
description: This Trophy will make you so brainy that you'll score a clean 3 on the Bwork Intelligence Scale, which runs from negative infinity to 1.

name: Tease
description: This Trophy will make Chance your area of expert-tease.

name: Neutral Wrecker
description: This Trophy allows you to keep your face utterly expressionless as you decimate the enemy.

name: Water Wrecker
description: This Trophy is your first step towards becoming less of a drip.

name: Air Wrecker
description: The packaging this Trophy came in says that it works best when you have fresh air against your bare bottom. You can't wait to try it out.

name: Untouchable
description: This Trophy sends small, regular jolts of electricity running through your muscles, preventing them from seizing up and stopping you from falling asleep at family dinners.

name: Jostler
description: This Trophy turns you into the clumsiest warrior anyone has ever seen. Just turning around to check the height of the sun in the sky sends four of your allies flying into bushes and walls.

name: Neutral Bulwark
description: This Trophy stops you from taking sides in combat and prevents you from potentially hurting yourself by casting a spell.

name: Voyager
description: This Trophy will help you leave the nest and take your first steps as a real person. Next up: learn how to cook something other than pasta. Doesn't anyone around here have a replicator?

name: Deserter
description: This Trophy will be of no use to you whilst crossing the desert.

name: Rabid
description: The saliva on your lips allows you to create a Snailmet trail when you bite the dust.

name: Fortification
description: That playground bully who destroyed your sand castle traumatised you for life. Time for payback.

name: Fire Devastator
description: When attacked, you'll fire back with anything: curses, taunts, bad jokes, baptisms and great balls.

name: Delayer
description: Your technique is not to be the quickest, but to just delay everyone else so you're not the slowest. This is a tried and tested technique in all administrations of the World of Twelve.

name: Escapee
description: There's no shame in fleeing when there's no chance of winning.

name: Feller
description: Knocking down so many enemies has made you a happy feller.

name: Neutral Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from all the ditherers who can't choose sides during a fight.

name: Fire Carapace
description: This Trophy will make an excellent ashtray if you prefer to use the Peace Pipe rather than fight.

name: Air Carapace
description: Taking refuge under this Trophy will protect you from wind, but will not prevent you from generating your own. This can lead to an uncomfortable case of trapped wind.

name: Bootarkies
description: Ouginaks form a big pack, until conflicts eat away at it from the inside. The pack ends up breaking apart into several independent tribes that never stop mad dogging each other.
stats: Reduces the Tibia spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Tracking spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the R-Canine spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Humerus spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Hunt spell's maximum range by 2
Beaten no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the maximum number of times Snuggletooth can be cast per turn by 1

name: Emerald Dofus
description: Greener than a sick Tofu, the Emerald Dofus was created by Aerafal the Air Dragon. To create such a green thing, he was certainly feeling airsick. That bodes well for its powers, doesn't it?
stats: At the end of the turn, gives 100% of the owner's level in shield points for each adjacent enemy.

name: Bwork Chief Amulet
description: Although basic-looking, this flinty amulet is endowed with a very powerful magic that can turn a Bwork into a princess... or the opposite, nobody knows.

name: Notts O'Clever Clogs
description: Have you ever won a fight by darting nimbly here and there in clogs disguised as shoes? Wooden't you like to give it a go?
stats: 20% Critical Hit bonus on the Shove Off spell
Increases the Intrepid Mask spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Capering spell's maximum range by 1
Apathy no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Pivot spell's maximum range by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Ponteira spell
Increases the Bocciara spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Tireless Mask spell's maximum range by 1

name: Locker
description: This Trophy lets you keep the cowards close to you. So you can crush them more easily.

name: Friction
description: This Trophy helps you slow down your opponent's movements so you can catch them more quickly and humiliate them accordingly, by giving them a wedgie, for example.

name: Fugitive
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to prevent you from reaching your destination. This doesn't work against those who are trying to prevent you from reaching your destiny though.

name: Air Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Air attack damage in those who are full of hot air.

name: Water Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Water attack damage, but it won’t help you turn water into wine.

name: Earth Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Earth attack damage. Only Earthworms are impressed by this.

name: Maniac
description: This trophy increases your Strength. Unfortunately, it doesn't increase strength of mind though.

name: Dolmanax
description: This Dofus changes colour with the seasons. The warm gold it displays in the summer gives way to a glacial chill as winter sets in. They say it was laid by a dragon who fell in love with a pedlar who stopped by its cave to flog an out-of-date calendar.

name: Fire Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you hold your own in the line of fire.

name: Stalwart
description: When the pressure gets too much, when people start throwing their weight around, and when you realise you’re a total pushover, it's time to equip this Trophy.

name: Barbarian
description: This Trophy will show your enemies that you are capable of the best actions known to man, and the most evil, and that you prefer the latter. And they will weep, forsooth.

name: Ding Dong Belt
description: It's said that this silken belt was worn by the famous Master Nabur, the martial arts specialist. Apparently he enchanted it to alert him when danger was approaching... Unfortunately, this magic seems to have worn off, which is too bad for you, as you could do with being saved by the bell from time to time.

name: Transit Boots
description: With these boots, you can move from A to B using the power of your own two feet. Isn't that amazing? It's so amazing that you can never reveal the secret to anyone. No, seriously! We swear!
stats: Makes the Shock spell's range modifiable
Reduces the Stupor spell's cooldown period by 1
