Increases the Odyssey spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the maximum number of times Convulsion can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Distortion spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Exodus spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Offence spell's AP cost by 1

name: Neutral Devastator
description: There where your Dragoturkey has passed, the grass will never grow again.

name: Water Devastator
description: You've always strongly believed that blood is thicker than water. Which is why you never pour yourself a refreshing glass of blood.

name: Evader
description: Use a good Fire attack with this Trophy and you'll be able to dodge and burn.

name: Solid
description: Solid but not unbreakable. This is how your allies will describe you just before breaking your two big toes following a terrible joke.

name: Water Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from Crocodyl Tears.

name: Shaker
description: This Trophy emits little electric shocks to keep you active. You can use it on your abs, in your underwear or in an aquarium, if you like to watch fish float.

name: Billalo
description: Bill wanted a halo. He screamed so loud and threw such a tantrum that he finally got it. A real little devil.

name: Antibooties
description: These boots will protect you by identifying and neutralising ground-borne toxins. Well, you can never be too suspicious of microbes and other germs, can you? Some pedantic observers enjoy pointing out that they look more like slippers than boots, but that's what Eniripsas call them. I wonder if it's because they're so tiny that they see everything from a different viewpoint.
stats: Reduces the Lifting Word spell's cooldown period by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Alternative Word spell
Increases the Word of Silence spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Rallying Word spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Sacrificial Word spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Striking Word spell's maximum range by 2
Turbulent Word no longer requires a line of sight
15 Damage on the spell: Mischievous Word

name: Wawka Boots
description: Crocodyl Dandy lost many a good opportunity and many a wife through his undying urge to wander round the outback. His fame grew fast and he was even offered a sponsorship deal by the famed shoemakers of Aerdala, but when he saw what they had on offer, he threw them back and shouted "That's not a pair of boots... THIS is a pair of boots."
stats: Increases the Crackler Punch spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Favouritism spell's cooldown period by 1
Sparkmeleon no longer requires a line of sight
Aquatic Wave no longer requires a line of sight
Dragonic no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Scalding Poison spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the First spell's maximum range by 1

name: Relief Boots
description: When Fecas are embarrassed and wish to change the subject, they always mention their Relief Boots. They talk about the way you can pace up and down all sorts of landscapes with them on. When their allies are in trouble on the battlefield, these comfy boots help them recover and ward off the threat.
stats: Increases the Shiver spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Bastion spell's cooldown period by 1
Cloudy Attack is no longer linear
Reduces the Paralysing Glyph spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Tension spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Stormy Attack spell
Roaming Glyph no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Manoeuvre spell's maximum range by 2

name: Eluder
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to limit your actions. It doesn't work against lawyers.

name: Air Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Air attacks, but not from Air spray.

name: Neutral Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Neutral attacks, but it won't make your enemies any more Neutral once the hostilities commence.

name: Fire Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Fire damage. According to the label, it's guaranteed to get you all fired up.

name: Neutral Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Neutral attack damage. It was invented by a famous ogre: Pete Aitchnutrool.

name: Instigator
description: This Trophy increases Initiative instead of taking it.

name: Player
description: This Trophy increases your Chance. It doesn't seem to have any effect when you use cheesy chat-up lines though.

name: Gymnast
description: This Trophy has the power to miraculously balance everything. Except, perhaps, your class spells.

name: Slimeball
description:
This Trophy oozes a slippery liquid that gives you the upper hand when escaping from Lock-happy opponents.
Just don't be surprised when you don't get any free hugs on Ballotwine's Day.

name: Earth Bulwark
description: This Trophy protects you from falling earth. Handy if you spend your days hollowing out underground passageways.

name: Fire Bulwark
description: This Trophy could save your life when your sect is on fire.

name: Air Bulwark
description: Equip this Trophy and your worries will vanish into thin air.

name: Dynamo
description: Wind up this Trophy and you'll be going strong all night! You're never too old for the generation game.

name: Watchers Dofus
description: This Dofus was fashioned on the basis of someone's hazy recollection of what an authentic dragon egg looked like. Touching it causes long-lost memories to come flooding back - it's almost like tasting a Becky Stein cake for the first time in years. You revisit your arrival in Incarnam and the first time you ever slaughtered a Gobbly... Ah, great times!
stats: At the start of the turn, heals 7% of health points of aligned allies.

name: Miracle Man
description: It helps to be cured, but not in the ham sense.

name: Luckster
description: You had a 99% chance of getting a glass half-empty, but you got a glass half-full. How lucky is that!

name: Vigour
description: You took it literally when she said to 'get up and go'.

name: Initial Boots
description: With these boots on your feet, you'll always be first at everything, from going off on an adventure to fleeing from a fight.
stats: 25% Critical Hit bonus on the Flamethrower spell
Increases the Deflagration spell's maximum range by 1
Icy Shards is no longer linear
Runic Treatment no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Celestial Wave spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Ember spell
Reduces the Quadramental Current spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Elemental Guardian spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Bwork Chief Briefs
description: These purple leather briefs are all you need. You can wear them on their own and still look distinguished, provided that they fit you. You're better off keeping still in them, though - even the slightest movement will have you sounding like an old door creaking shut.

name: Dragon Pig Necklace
description: This necklace comes with a small loop so the owner of the Dragon Pig can attach a leash to it. It also does wonders for Dragon Pig lice.

name: Sleephairs
description: It is said that Sadidas never feel lonely, since they can summon lots of dolls to keep them company. Thanks to these shoes, you too can say goodbye to loneliness! Not only will you be able to talk to them, but they'll be great for hiding aces when you're playing poker. Once you're wearing them, you'll feel really good, even if you are a little ashamed to actually go out with them on.
stats: Reduces the Wheel of Fortune spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Summoning Claw spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Playful Claw spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Perception spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Pussycat spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Roar spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Misadventure spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Summoning Stroke spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Boots Hox
description: Imbued with a revolutionary firming agent, these boots will perfect the curvature of your legs and fight the good fight against your death-like Sram complexion. This cream has spectacular effects on Sramettes but seems to be absolutely useless on Srams. Could it be a hormonal problem?
stats: Increases the Lethal Attack spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Insidious Trap spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Mistake spell
Increases the Malevolent Trap spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Epidemic spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Raiding spell
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Cut-Throat spell
15 Damage on the spell: Tricky Blow

name: Shal'Hal Boots
description: These boots were created by a Xelor artist to help him paint more quickly. And they work! However, they also tend to distort the vision, meaning the artist was incapable of drawing anything but curvy females.
stats: 25% Critical Hit bonus on the Frostbite spell
Increases the Xelor's Punch spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Mummification spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Temporal Paradox spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Time Rift spell's AP cost by 1
Makes the Gear spell's range modifiable
Embalming no longer requires a line of sight

name: Geta Bernacle
description: In some countries, it seems that Geta Bernacle are thrown at the feet of enemies to propose a duel, which is a little like hitting your opponent with a pair of gloves. The advantage of using Geta Bernacle is that they add the stench factor to the actual blow. Pandawas never were famous for their foot hygiene.
stats: Vulnerability no longer requires a line of sight
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Hangover spell
Increases the Propulsion spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Zatoishwan's Wrath spell's AP cost by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Debauchery spell
Increases the Brandy spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Fermentation spell's AP cost by 1

name: Boots Kwish
description: These boots create a disgusting suction noise with each step, which will remind you of a rutting Trool's love chant if you've ever heard it. A painful memory that you could easily live without.

name: Escapist
description: This Trophy lets you escape when the opportune moment presents itself.

name: Earth Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Earth attacks, unless you happen to be in Middle-Earth.

name: Healer
description: This Trophy increases Heals. It won’t make you look any more lively, though.

name: Roboots
description: These heavy diving boots are the fruit of pure Foggernaut technology. They are fitted with a super-duper microchip that allows them to walk themselves, reducing the fatigue that might normally encumber you. You might want to have your scuba suit on hand all the same - the boots are programmed to head towards the sea!
stats: Increases the Grapnel spell's maximum range by 2
Tacturret no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Trident spell's maximum range by 2
Hypertension no longer requires a line of sight
Bathyscaphe no longer requires a line of sight
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Seizing spell
Reduces the Short-Circuit spell's AP cost by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Torpedo spell

name: Earth Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you keep your feet on the ground. Warning: can prove painful if used in conjunction with a flying mount.

name: Shackler
description: This Trophy slows your loved one down when he or she desperately wants to leave. You laugh in the face of restraining orders!

name: Paralyser
description: The good thing about this Trophy is that, if you hit an ally by mistake, there's little chance they'll be able to do anything about it.

name: Water Bulwark
description: Don't throw this Trophy out with the bathwater.

name: Jackanapes
description: A lifetime of mischief and monkey business has finally paid off. You carved Blop Goldof lyrics into the bench behind the church in Amakna. You spent your evenings throwing people weaker than you into the harbour at Madrestam. You orchestrated that magnificent event whereby all the bins in Astrub were filled with Fairyworks and innocent creatures and then set alight. This Trophy was made for you.

name: Magmatic Diving Bell
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Hurtful Locker Belt
description: The message is clear enough: whatever lies behind this belt is very dearly guarded indeed.

name: Intellectual
description: Team up with some Bworks to become the group's intellectual.

name: Stunner
description: Headbutting an enemy to stun them seemed to be an interesting tactic. Until you realized they were wearing a helmet, but you weren't.

name: Motivator
description: Sometimes it's just better to be never than late.

name: Earth Carapace
description: This Trophy may come in useful as a dirt dish. If used upside down, logic dictates that it could also be used to dish the dirt.

name: Nomad
description: You like to call yourself a nomad. Which is really just a nicer way of describing a coward.

name: Bloodthirst
description: Your friends salivate when they see you butcher but refuse to eat your delicious garlic soup. Strange.

name: Bwork Chief Boots
description: These boots just look like ordinary Bwork boots. And yet, they are Bwork Chief boots. Hard-wearing, powerful, and smelly, they will be the deciding factor in any evenly-matched battle.

name: Bwork Chief Cloak
description: Wear this cloak to look like a battle-weary Bwork warrior. It's perfect for stealing lunch money off the elderly in the village. All the same, if you're in search of a soul mate, you might want to change your approach... unless you wear it with nothing else on... Hey, that's it... that way, you can keep on scaring the elderly of the village too! Kill two birds with one stone.

name: Bwork Chief Helmet
description: If you really want to look like a weakling, this helmet is made for you. In your case, it mightn't make too much difference all the same.

name: Kaliptus Dofus
description: No one knows exactly which dragon created this Dofus, but the rumours suggest it ingested an incredible quantity of Kaliptus leaves before laying the egg and then dying of acute aerophagia.

name: Boots Hanik
description: Thanks to their recognition system, these boots prevent Sadidas from crushing rare plants. However they won't prevent you from stepping in various sort of excrements if you don't watch where you're going.
stats: Increases the maximum number of times Manifold Bramble can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Transmuted Block spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Poisoned Wind spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Dolly Sacrifice spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Force of Nature spell
Reduces the The Block spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Vegetal Altruism spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Bane spell's maximum range by 2

name: Nailed Thongs
description: Unlike the other classes, Sacriers love to live with a thorn in their foot and do not wish to have it taken out. The pain they feel reminds them that they're alive and give them the raging energy they need to slaughter their enemies. Besides, the drops of blood they leave behind mean they always find their way back home.
stats: Reduces the Penitence spell's cooldown period by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Ravages spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Projection spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Hostility spell
Reduces the Flying Sword spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Swift Sword spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Sacrifice spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the maximum number of times Light Speed can be cast per turn by 1

name: Veggie Boots
description: The numerous straps around these shoes can be used as spare bow strings. Young Craettes also use them to cook vegetables. The smell of feet doesn't seem to bother them.
stats: Reduces the Punitive Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Magic Arrow spell
Reduces the Retreat Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Tormenting Arrow spell
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Arrow of Judgement spell
Increases the maximum number of times Concentration Arrow can be cast per target by 1
Increases the Erosive Arrow spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Tyrannical Arrow spell's AP cost by 1

name: Repellant
description: This Trophy enables you to do a bit more damage to an opponent when you push them against a tree, some debris or another enemy with a goatee.

name: Barrier
description: This Trophy protects you from Critical Hits in critical places at critical moments. Once it's equipped, you will suffer a side effect which will really get on your friends' nerves: You won't be able to accept criticism.

name: Fire Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Fire attacks, but not Goblets of Fire.

name: Stickler
description: This Trophy enables you to stick undesirables onto the bottom of your boots, or vice versa. Don't forget to tie your laces, now.

name: Vagabond
description: This Trophy accepts no responsibility for runaway brains.

name: Doctor
description: This Trophy lets you play doctors and nurses with your allies, or with your enemies, if the fight's too boring for words.

name: Bastion
description: This Trophy protects you from really cracking hits but also prevents you from scoring them yourself. You should take the opportunity to claim that you hate wanton violence and stand with your hands on your hips, tutting disapprovingly at everyone you see.

name: Forerunner
description: Having the first turn gives you the limelight to commit the first fatal error, show everyone what an idiot you are, prove that you're not a priority target, be the last man standing and come home a hero.

name: Powerhouse
description: This Trophy is seasoned with Cania Bay sea salt, delicate herbs and rustic rust, so your enemies can enjoy a taste sensation when they smash their front teeth out on it.

name: Obstructor
description: If your enemies do not pass away, at least they shall not pass.

name: Curer
description: This Trophy will help you heal your allies by offering wise words: "an api a day keeps the doctor away; seven apis a week you'll no longer feel weak"

name: Stunter
description: That pitiful slip on a banana skin was just a stunt to make your friends laugh. No one believed you, but everyone had a good laugh.

name: Earth Devastator
description: Monsters will bite you on the bum and you will bite the dust. Poor monsters.

name: Air Devastator
description: You tried different air styles but that was before your thatch turned into thin air.

name: Dragokart Cup
description: This shield is a replica of the trophy given to the winners of the famous Dragoturkey race. It's not as prestigious as the original, of course, but if it stops you from getting sliced in two by an anonymous madman, who are you to complain?

name: Boowoldlum Cloak
description: Regardless of how other people look at you, regardless of their prejudices, you can make the choice of wearing this Boowoldlum fur as a sign of rebelliousness: being ridiculed only makes you stronger. Possibly.

name: Minotoror Ring
description: Unlike what some adventurers may think, this ring was never worn by the Minotoror who was unable to fit such a delicate thing around his hoofs.

name: White Rat Boots
description: With these boots, your balance will be perfect… they're very popular with drunk drivers, they practically walk along the yellow line for you. Saying the alphabet backwards... that's another story.

name: Gorgoyle Cape
description: Wrapped around your waist and passed between your legs, this cape will really emphasise your extra padding.

name: Feudala Hat
description: From a distance, you'll look like a Pandawushuka from Feudala Village wearing this hat. Up close, you'll look like an idiot.

name: Precious Boots
description: These boots will act just like treasure chests, protecting your doughy calves in all circumstances.

name: Black Rat Ring
description: Turn this ring to the right if you're shaking hands with an enemy and to the left if you're shaking hands with a friend. Make sure you stay away from any situation where you may be forced to clap.

name: Master Nabur Helmet
description: Passed down from generation to generation, this misshapen helmet was even worn by Crail himself. Many adventurers think it has mysterious powers. As with many divinities and modern heroes, the magical powers of this helmet have all the potency of a shoe.

name: Gorgoyle Glove
description: Excellent for protecting your hands during a boxing match, this glove can be spun to collect the necessary fat to make potted dragon pig.

name: Boowoldlum Loincloth
description: An entire ecosystem seems to have grown around this hair, so take care of it!

name: Swyndelsash
description: The most treacherous ruffians use these straps as a means of identifying each other, which ensures they don't con their peers. Certain badmouthers have suggested they only use straps because they couldn't find anything cheaper.

name: Chouquish Belt
description: This belt has been made out of LeChouque's most powerful belongings, notably his famous boxer shorts. It's enough to plunge the entire female clientele of the Pirates Bar into mass confusion.

name: Gorgoyle Amulet
description: Push. Push harder. Still no luck? Are you sure you're trying to get the amulet around your neck...?

name: Dragon Pig Headgear
description: With this huge skull on, you'll look like a stiff-bristled Grizball, but with no hair. Your admirers will be speechless.

name: Hogmeiser's Golden Boots
description: These magnificent Hogmeiser boots are finely peppered with precious stones, protecting you against magic attacks. Brouce Boulgoure himself used them to crush the Treechnid King's head many years ago, just to liven up the opening of the Trool Fair.

name: Winter Leaf
description: This magnificent brooch pays homage to the resistance of the miners of the Grimoth Silver Mine. They spent a winter fighting a Crackler of the worst kind but in the end they were killed by a Tofu who wandered into their hideout on his way home. Boy isn't life unfair.

name: Aerdala Shield
description: Looking to fend off a frenzied attack? This shield from the village of Aerdala should do the trick.

name: Animal Boots
description: There's something beastly about these boots. Don't be shocked if a Boowolf starts humping a limb when you put them on. Does your neck count as a limb? Well, it does for a loved-up Boowolf.

name: Lil' Resin
description: This amulet of Bamboo resin will spread a nice smell all around you. It comes in handy when you're practising your Wind of Panic.

name: Pirate Captain’s Wedding Ring
description: This magical wedding ring, which was found in an ancestral treasure, has the power to change the colour of its wearer’s pee. Too bad it’s not especially useful at sea...

name: Caracape
description: If you cross paths with Nevark the Hunter while wearing this cape, he may take you for the acolyte of Arachneeman and give you a good hiding. But you're free to do what you want, after all.

name: Pirate Captain’s Hat
description: Much more chic than a plumed hat, this pirate hat will tell you where all sorts of treasure in hidden on the high seas of Amakna. Unfortunately, you’ll be the only one who can hear its voice, so everyone else will just think you’re not rowing with both oars, if you catch my drift.

name: Silky Boots
description: Supple and soft to the touch, these boots are incredibly comfortable. But be prepared to be asked to go barefoot by those who hate seeing those creepy crawlies scuttling across their floor.

name: Spynner Ring
description: Does your mother-in-law suffer from arachneephobia? Well congratulations, you've found the ideal gift for her next birthday, which will be her last, with any luck.

name: Dark Treeckler Belt
description: Carved in a Dark Treeckler, this belt isn't pliable enough to let you move around easily, but at least, it'll protects you.

name: Eight-Eye Amulet
description: Some claim that this talisman corrects eyesight problems; while others assure us that it merely multiplies them. The truth, as is often the case, depends on your point of view.

name: Pirate Captain’s Cloak
description: This cloak once belonged to LeChouque, the most famous pirate to have ever sailed the seas of Amakna if he does say so himself (and he does). They said that the pirate and his crew were doomed to live out their days as ghosts and skeletons after their ship fell victim to a mysterious curse.

name: Feudala Cloak
description: This cloak comes from Feudala. It can be used as a doormat or even as a towel if you've just come out of the water.

name: Cauldini Boots
description: These boots will allow you to find out one of Cauldini's best-kept secrets: it's not his boots that make him levitate. You can probably "boot" that information, for all it's worth.

name: Riktus Mask
description: For some people, it's not the costume that makes the man. This saying doesn't really apply to the Riktus.

name: Dragon Pig Mules
description: A good pair of mules at your side and you'll feel stronger, more powerful and deadlier than ever. They're just ordinary mules, though. It must be the vibes they give off.

name: Feudala Amulet
description: The only people allowed to wear this amulet were the inhabitants of the village of Feudala, as it was considered to be one of the most important parts of their traditional costume. Seen close up, you have to ask yourself why.

name: Rac Girdle
description: With this many legs, no one will ever think you're on your last ones.

name: Royal Rainbow Bloopts
description: Some people let the grass grow under their feet. With these boots, you'll have enough foliage for four weddings and a funeral.

name: Nephilady Hat
description: This hat was a roaring success at the last fashion show organised by the Brakmar Black Widows Association.

name: Phtalmo
description: This shield is covered with peepers to allow you to give one of those devastating multi-evil-eyes. Unstoppable.

name: Cauldini Shield
description: This shield's resemblance to Captain Amakna's ends at its appearance: optical illusions do have their limits.

name: Riktus Cloak
description: As acrobats, the Riktus know that a cloak can sometimes be a deadly disadvantage. But some people still can't do without one, so they shorten it as much as possible in order to limit the risks involved.

name: Forester's Ring
description: Wearing the Forester's Ring originally symbolised commitment to a way of life: sleeping under the stars, climbing trees, eating mushrooms, rolling around in the hay, etc. But now that some are wearing it purely for aesthetic reasons, its meaning has become somewhat devalued. However, it still represents a desire to return to naturism.

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Ring
description: Instead of cutting down on impure Blop juice, Shika Ingalsse pressed on with her harvest through her inebriated state. One day, as she was stumbling and falling through the golden fields, Shika landed on this ring. Whoever said that impure Blop juice should be taken in moderation?

name: Royal Rainbow Amublop
description: They have to put heaps of artificial colourants and flavourings into this amulet to stop it coming out white when it's crafted. A word of advice, it might look great and smell delicious, but don't try to eat it.

name: Autumn Leaf
description: This brooch was made one autumn morning in the depths of a Beech and Elm forest, near the Olag-Lacustre Island. It is considered to be a true relic by a great many lumberjacks.

name: Ugle Ring
description: This big moth-shaped ring won't make your hands pretty, but isn't that a good thing?

name: Riktus Ring
description: Riktus – how to endlessly amuse other people and yourself: that's your belief.

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Belt
description: If you tighten this belt fully, you can shut down your digestive system completely. Why you would want to do this is another question entirely.

name: Cauldini Mask
description: By wearing this mask, you'll look strangely like a rodent. Goes to show that magic can really make things prettier!

name: Grazor
description: Ideal for laying on the green grass of your garden or wiping the green mess in your nose, the Grazor is one of the few inanimate objects that can multitask.

name: Dark Treeckler Mask
description: This mask won't help you avoid or heal hangovers, but at least it gives you some chance of hiding the effects. The dark touch simply indicates that you're in a bad mood… and that you should not be annoyed and you're ready to throw a flurry of blows to anyone who does not respect that!

name: Farle's Wedding Ring
description: This wedding ring has been worn down by the scratching of barley through hundreds of harvests. It was even there to witness the union of Farle and Shika when they got married in the middle of barley field one spring!

name: Legendary Crackler Boots
description: If you like to break a few toes when you take your date out to dance, these boots are made for you!

name: Sangroku's Belt
description: Sangroku ate way too many magic beans one time. Forever more, it was a constant struggle to restrain the winds of panic that erupted from his britches without the slightest warning... Those very same winds made him famous the length and breadth of Amakna.

name: Daggero's Red Necklace
description: Daggero took this blood-coloured pearl necklace from the body of a Kitsou chief who had attacked his village in the past, Red. Let's hope no one ever asks you where you got yours from. No one's going to believe you're a Pandawushu Master if you admit you just ordered a cheap copy from your jeweller.

name: Redolph Headgear
description: This headgear is great for showing your rivals that you're looking for a real challenge. It's also useful for sending out an explicit message to any ladies in the vicinity, although you shouldn't count on that working out well for you.

name: LeChouque's Shield
description: LeChouque used this shield to protect himself from the big cannonballs his friends regularly tossed to him. Some crazy stories tell that some of those balls were even alive.

name: Redolph Saddlebag
description: This saddlebag gives easy access to bottles during combat, which makes it an obvious choice for Pandawa adventurers.

name: Redolph Hooves
description: These hooves are fitted with anti-slip soles. The shoemaker who made them assures everyone that that's to avoid their wearer from slipping on ice, but everyone knows that they're really to stop the wearer from slipping in puddles of spilt beer late at night.

name: Redolph Halter
description: Wear this halter around your neck if you're scared of wandering off and never being found again. Tried and tested by Gobball breeders.

name: Legendary Crackler Amulet
description: This amulet has quite a modest look though it contains many secrets including the one telling what secrets it contains.

name: Legendary Crackler Cloak
description: This cloak of big stone chunks will turn you into a big stone chunk.

name: Gogorified Miner Ring
description: An Enutrof legend says that a miner is "gogorified" when he can't stand daylight anymore, a result of spending so much time working down his mine. Never bring a candle close to such a miner, he could turn you into bronze.

name: Event Belt
description: This belt was made for the most popular of all the Craettes who often organised parties and wacky events to keep her countless friends and acquaintances on her side. All this between ironing and washing Captain Chafer's leather underpants.

name: Whitepaw Wabbit Bracelet
description: It's a funny thing: when Wabbits get old, they all start to look like one another and smell kind of fusty. These bracelets were invented to help distinguish the different Whitepaw Wabbits: each one periodically releases a spray of a unique odour: peach blossom, fresh pine, damp soil, last week's bedding...

name: Wa Wobot Belt
description: This belt is actually totally hollow and was designed to hold emergency Cawwots for the Wa. You feel around inside, but the ruddy swindler managed to finish all but a few mouldy end bits before you got to him. Curses!

name: Daggero's Hat
description: You've just put on the same hat that Daggero has been wearing since his early childhood. Unfortunately, you don't have the same excuse he did: no one ever told him it was already a good decade out of fashion.

name: Whitepaw Wabbit Belt
description: This belt was awarded following a great tournament in which Wabbits went head to head in red-hot, bare-pawed combat. Once the winner, a Whitepaw, had been declared and the madness had died down, the Wabbits started wondering whether the whole thing hadn't been an elaborate set-up to sell over-priced Cawwot juice to all the spectators.

name: Amufafah
description: It's the Mufafah moustaches that cause the wearer of this necklace to bellow so loudly. Why? They hang down and tickle the nipples constantly.

name: Sewer Warden Boots
description: Just listen to this... The Sewer Warden was devoured by the Sewer Keeper. He was digested for more than 100 years before he finally died. His boots were fortunately more resistant than he was and are still in good nick.

name: Ourobubble Boots
description: Essential for walking on the hot sand without damaging the arch of your foot, these boots will also prevent you from sinking into quicksand.

name: Amulet of Double Luck
description: There's an old Sufokian saying that goes: "Lucky one day, double lucky the day after." The longer you think about it, the more ridiculous it sounds.

name: Whitepaw Wabbit Helmet
description: You've heard that the pair of ears fixed on this gleaming helmet will enable you to hear just as well as a Wabbit. It seems that the original owner of this particular specimen was as deaf as a post.

name: Daggero's Loincloth
description: This loincloth bears the marks of the long years of intense training that Daggero put himself through so he could one day defeat Zatoishwan. Strangely, it's only been giving off that musty smell since you put it on.

name: Fennexeadgear
description: Using Fennex tails to make quilts… that's right.

name: Kaa Amulet
description: This strange amulet allows its wearer to relax, chill out and have a nap, right in the middle of a fight. Just like a Feca, in fact.

name: Koolich Headgear
description: This headgear once belonged to the famous Koolich, renowned for his clay feet and his legendary good mood.

name: Wa Wobot Cloak
description: This cloak weighs heavy on your shoulders. Have you unwittingly agreed to bear the Wa Wabbit's guilt, or is it all your own?

name: Boowish Belt
description: The Boowolf donated his precious organs for the making of this incredible belt. Not willingly of course, but we can still be thankful. Don't trust its strange appearance, which could unnerve the most depraved Chafer - it's very powerful.

name: Feudala Belt
description: Pandawas from Feudala always watch their figure. If you tighten this belt as much as possible, you should finally get some results with your flabby belly problem.

name: Ouassingual Cape
description: This cape may not be as powerful as the fancier Mopy King version, but it still has the same sweat evacuation system. You'll be able to face any situation wearing it, as long as you're able to fight while holding your breath, that is. The stench is truly unbearable!

name: Lullibye
description: This headgear looks like any old wig, but it is powerful indeed. It has one prior owner who had the strange and despicable habit of dressing up as other people, and conning the elderly into signing over items of tiny value. Once he convinced a gentle old man that he was his dead wife returned to life, proceeded to 'remarry' him, had six of his children (which even I can't explain) and then, ten years later, just as they were about to renew their vows on a scenic cliffside, he broke the news. It is said he ran off with three party poppers and a half-eaten ball of Stracciatella ice cream, laughing wildly... still laughing as he tripped and fell over the cliff and laughing to this day if you believe the popular but unlikely sea shanty, 'The crazy fool took my Stracciatella'.

name: Feudala Wedding Ring
description: This Wedding Ring comes from Feudala Village. Closer to a lucky charm than a magic relic, you'll still be able to make your friends believe you've found your soul mate.

name: Elya Wood's Cloak
description: Some say Captain Chafer tried to steal this cloak to replace his famous leather panties. But it didn't suit him at all - it just wasn't perverse enough.

name: Powerful Dazzling Belt
description: This dazzling belt is the result of a mad bet to restore one of the most dazzling belts ever created in Amakna: it's the Dazzling Belt. Pakape Promethe won the contest.

name: Farlebelt
description: This belt served Farle Ingalsse as a butcher's apron when slaughtering Gobballs in his makeshift abattoir. A cruel, thankless task which he nevertheless carried out with obvious and undignified pleasure.

name: Shika's Cape
description: Flowers from harvest time have been sewn to this cape made of woven magic cereals. It's driven by such a powerful magic that Shika used to use it for protection against lightning on stormy nights!

name: Cape Anama
description: This soft cape is sometimes used by the Osamodettes as a wide-brimmed hat. Male Osamodas only use it as a cape. Thanks to the drawing which decorates this piece of clothing, this character class has inherited the reputation of being frank... they can't laugh up their sleeves since the laugh has actually been sewn onto the cape!
stats: Increases the maximum number of times Whip can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Takeoff spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Crop can be cast per turn by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Gambol spell
Increases the Flaming Crow spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Protective Balm spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Fourth spell's maximum range by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Cross Scale spell

name: Cape Hernaum
description: Enutrofs have the habit of drawing a map on their cape. They live in such a mess that they can barely find the toilets and this is quite a problem, especially when nature calls urgently.
stats: Reduces the Acceleration spell's cooldown period by 1
20 Damage on the spell: Shovel of Judgement
Increases the Living Bag spell's maximum range by 3
Reduces the Spade of Judgement spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Peat Bog spell
Reduces the Living Satchel spell's cooldown period by 1

name: Royal Morello Cherry Blop Ring
description: Kroula had a plan. He was going to put this ring on his big toe, get Blops to lick his feet and collect litres of Royal Blop juice. Well, the ring didn't fit.

name: Royal Pippin Blop Ring
description: Kroula had a plan. He was going to put this ring on his big toe, get Blops to lick his feet and collect litres of Royal Blop juice. Well, the ring didn't fit.

name: Royal Morello Cherry Amublop
description: This Amublop costs a lot more to make than an ordinary Amublop, but look on the bright side… it will sell for a lot more too, especially if you offload it on an Astrubian.

name: Royal Coco Amublop
description: This Amublop costs a lot more to make than an ordinary Amublop, but look on the bright side… it will sell for a lot more too, especially if you offload it on an Astrubian.

name: Royal Indigo Amublop
description: This Amublop costs a lot more to make than an ordinary Amublop, but look on the bright side… it will sell for a lot more too, especially if you offload it on an Astrubian.

name: Royal Pippin Bloopts
description: Say the word Bloopts ten times fast while spinning round in circles. Now you know what it feels like to be a Iop.

name: Fundamental Cape
description: Traditionally worn during ceremonies and journeys, this cape is imbued with a powerful magic that gives its wearer incredible charisma, a heroic attitude, and foolproof protection against the rain and mud chips.
stats: Elemental Drain is no longer linear
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Astral Blade spell
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Glacier spell
Propagation no longer requires a line of sight
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Morph spell
Increases the maximum number of times Elemental Trap can be cast per turn by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Telluric Blade spell
Increases the Stalactite spell's maximum range by 1

name: Jusfur Wrap
description: This is the favourite cape of Ouginak exhibitionists who like to surreptitiously show their pelt off to strangers.
stats: Tally Ho no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Appeasement spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Yapper Launcher spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Mastiff spell's maximum range by 2
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Woof spell
Affection no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the maximum number of times Gangrene can be cast per turn by 1

name: Shika's Clogs
description: These clogs were created for Shika so that she wouldn't trample the seedbeds of the Snossios plains. The high-heels make it easier to run in the stubble without hurting her ankles and stop the dew getting in.

name: Cloak Orporal
description: The floating cape will give you the aura of a warrior, especially when you turn your back to your enemy. Some think it's reinforced by a metal sheet capable of staving off the slyest attacks.
stats: Increases the Jump spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Duel spell's cooldown period by 1
Intimidation no longer requires a line of sight
Strengthstorm no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Determination spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Grip spell's cooldown period by 1
Threat no longer requires a line of sight
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Tumult spell

name: Cap Cape
description: The dark colour of this cape makes it easy to match any other cloth, of any colour. Since it's a very wide cape, it can also protect your head and nose.
stats: 25% Critical Hit bonus on the Clock spell
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Temporal Dust spell
Increases the Loss of Motivation spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Synchro spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Water Clock spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Pendulum spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Temporal Suspension spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Serious Hour spell's AP cost by 1

name: Cape o'Tbelly
description: This item is used to hide the Sadidas' weight problem. Because they spend most of their time sleeping instead of practicing sports, the characters of this class tend to become rather stout. If Sadidettes actually have anti-starvation supplies flatteringly placed in the eyes of men, Sadidas usually use this cape to hide theirs.
stats: Reduces the Sylvan Power spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Earthquake spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Transmuted Madoll spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Vegetal Influence spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Shake spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Madoll spell's cooldown period by 1
Poisoned Undergrowth is no longer linear

name: Cape Wuera
description: Pandawas use this cape as protection against bad weather and as a dance accessory. They put it on the floor, in the middle of a circle of tipsy dancers. Then they start their improvised choreography during which their feet can't leave the cloth.
stats: Increases the maximum number of times Vertigo can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Stabilisation spell's cooldown period by 1
15 Damage on the spell: Explosive Flask
Reduces the Sherpa spell's AP cost by 1
Makes the Absinthe spell's range modifiable
Reduces the Distillation spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Tipple spell

name: Royal Pippin Amublop
description: This Amublop costs a lot more to make than an ordinary Amublop, but look on the bright side… it will sell for a lot more too, especially if you offload it on an Astrubian.

name: Royal Coco Bloopts
description: Say the word Bloopts ten times fast while spinning round in circles. Now you know what it feels like to be a Iop.

name: Royal Indigo Bloopts
description: Say the word Bloopts ten times fast while spinning round in circles. Now you know what it feels like to be a Iop.

name: Royal Indigo Blop Belt
description: The tiniest bluesman in the World is playing the blues for this belt on the tiniest guitar in the World. It lost its buckle. If belts could cry, this one would never stop sobbing.

name: Tanked Backpack
description: This backpack ensures your breathing tank is firmly held in place, ready for deep sea adventures. Now why did you fill it with beer again? You'll be as drunk as a fish!
stats: Increases the Torrent spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Salt Armour spell's cooldown period by 1
Lifesaver no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Harmattan spell
Reduces the Assistance spell's cooldown period by 1
Drill no longer requires a line of sight

name: Wa Wobot Crown
description: This beast of a crown only comes out on special occasions, on account of its weight. If you feel like wearing it on your head would be a pain in the neck, you can always use it as a shield.

name: Ortal Cloak
description: Just like a flying carpet, this will take you around the world. Its secret power? If you gently caress it, it will open up an "Ortal", which you can try to use for faster travel. It's not an Eliotrope Portal, but it's something.
stats: Increases the Portal spell's maximum range by 1
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Affliction spell
Reduces the Healing spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Flexible Portal spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Tribulation can be cast per turn by 1
Makes the Conjuration spell's range modifiable
Reduces the Cabal spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Curative Palm spell's maximum range by 2

name: Shika's Belt
description: This belt of leather used to protect Shika's thighs when she ran across the wheat fields to bring back to their herd lost Gobballs. Covered with pollen from magic cereals, legend says that it used to shimmer in the moonlight and ensured Farle didn't cut his wife's legs while reaping fields of cereals at night.

name: Royal Morello Cherry Bloopts
description: Say the word Bloopts ten times fast while spinning round in circles. Now you know what it feels like to be a Iop.

name: Royal Morello Cherry Blop Belt
description: The tiniest bluesman in the World is playing the blues for this belt on the tiniest guitar in the World. It lost its buckle. If belts could cry, this one would never stop sobbing.

name: Royal Pippin Blop Belt
description: The tiniest bluesman in the World is playing the blues for this belt on the tiniest guitar in the World. It lost its buckle. If belts could cry, this one would never stop sobbing.

name: Hanging Cloak
description: Vil Smisse was the first to use this cloak for subterfuge; in fact, it saved his life many times, including once when he was hanging by his toes. Since then, Rogues condemned to death have got used to following his example.
stats: Reduces the Dirty Trick spell's cooldown period by 1
Water Bomb no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Pulsar spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Last Breath spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Strategy spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Latent Water Bomb spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Magnetic Trap spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Shot Pellets spell's maximum range by 1

name: Leopena G-String
description: "But it's hot!" – at least you have that excuse.

name: Farle's Clogs
description: These clogs have been carved from various rare woods, reinforced with leather pieces of priceless value and padded with magic cereals. Light, stylish and comfortable, these clogs will resist the passage of time. Many misogynistic adventurers would like to say the same about their beloved.

name: Shika's Hat
description: Covered with a multitude of flowers, this hat made Shika look happy and bright when she left at the crack of dawn to plough the Church Hills.

name: Cape Ytal
description: This piece of clothing plays an essential part in the Sacriers' style. They use it to bandage their wounds, to clean off blood, to warm their feet during the cold seasons. We cannot say it enough - this class is terrified of frozen ground!
stats: Increases the Decimation spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Gash spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Transfusion spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Riposte spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Fury spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Carnage spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Excruciating Pain spell
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Immolation spell

name: Cape Hulco
description: Let me tell you about Hulco, a very strange Cra. He couldn't find his way to his own bathroom because everything he saw looked like a tropical beach at sunset. At least he never had to pay for a sun holiday.
stats: Increases the maximum number of times Lashing Arrow can be cast per target by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Absorptive Arrow spell
Reduces the Critical Shooting spell's cooldown period by 1
Burning Arrow no longer requires a line of sight
Withdrawal Arrow is no longer linear
Reduces the Devouring Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
Recall Beacon no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Repulsive Arrow spell's maximum range by 2

name: Royal Coco Blop Ring
description: Kroula had a plan. He was going to put this ring on his big toe, get Blops to lick his feet and collect litres of Royal Blop juice. Well, the ring didn't fit.

name: Royal Indigo Blop Ring
description: Kroula had a plan. He was going to put this ring on his big toe, get Blops to lick his feet and collect litres of Royal Blop juice. Well, the ring didn't fit.

name: Royal Coco Blop Belt
description: The tiniest bluesman in the World is playing the blues for this belt on the tiniest guitar in the World. It lost its buckle. If belts could cry, this one would never stop sobbing.

name: Grofus
description: Well, there you are. You did it: took part in the greatest Dragonic birth-control exercise ever. As a result, you're going to have to eat omelette for weeks to come.

name: Ourobubble Ring
description: This ring suddenly starts to shine in extreme heat, which can warn you about dramatic incidents if ever you don't realise on your own.

name: Sidimote Shield
description: This shield will remind your opponents you grew up in the Sidimote Moors. That alone could be enough to scare them away.

name: Legendary Crackler Helmet
description: This is an improved version of the Crackler Helmet. This rock will efficiently protect you from falling rocks, but not from hair loss.

name: Cape of Spades
description: Cut from a soft and strong fabric, this cape gives the Ecaflips the impression that they're always the best, no matter what happens. When they win, they love to wear this piece of clothing and claim their reward: "And now, gimme the cash!"
stats: Reduces the Clover spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Fate of Ecaflip spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Smell spell's maximum range by 1
Lucky Star no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Redistribution spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Ecaflip's Audacity spell's maximum range by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Yowling spell

name: F-Ha(r)t
description: This cape is so light and thin that the slightest wind, wind of any sort, will blow it off… It's anything but discreet especially after a meal of veggies and fermented drinks.
stats: Reduces the Invisibility spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Tricky Trap spell's maximum range by 3
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Insidious Poison spell
Reduces the Repelling Trap spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Mist spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Sickrat Trap can be cast per turn by 1
Toxines no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Mass Grave spell's maximum range by 2

name: Cape Sulitis
description: Place the cape lightly on your shoulders to prevent stiff joints, stiff upper lips and other stiffness-related problems.
stats: Paralysing Word no longer requires a line of sight
Preventing Word is no longer linear
Increases the Forbidden Word spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Whirling Word spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Life-Giving Word can be cast per turn by 1
15 Damage on the spell: Whirlwind Word
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Taboo Word spell
Increases the Helping Word spell's maximum range by 2

name: Cape Adossia
description: This cape's warm and comforting colours take its wearer on an imaginary journey to sunny lands, full of canyons carved by the elements, and cave paintings hidden amongst wind-blasted rocks and weathered cliffs. This is extremely useful way of forgetting the cold, grey, rainy weather.
stats: Reduces the Teleglyph spell's cooldown period by 1
15 Damage on the spell: Perception Glyph
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Fulminating Glyph spell
Increases the Blindness spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Fortification spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Rampart spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Aegis spell's maximum range by 3
Increases the Burning Glyph spell's maximum range by 1

name: Bangin' Cloak
description: Masqueraiders like to fight to music and this cloak is perfect for keeping time. They also use it to drum lessons into naughty children's heads.
stats: Increases the Psychopath Mask spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Distance spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Decoy spell's maximum range by 1
30% Critical Hit bonus on the Trance spell
Increases the Hysterical Mask spell's maximum range by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Catalepsy spell
Reduces the Masquerade spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Atabak spell's maximum range by 1

name: Dokoko
description: The Kanniballs claim that the Moon's Tree is actually a sleeping dragon. The immortal being came down from the moon and took the form of a great Kokokonut tree to shade a princess from the blistering sun. Then he dozed off... So does that mean the Dokoko, fruit of the Moon's Tree, is a genuine Dofus? The jury’s still out on that one.
stats: Every 3 turns starting on turn 4, returns 10% of their maximum health points.

name: Legendary Crackler Belt
description: The Legendary Crackler wears this belt around one of his toes. You wear it around your waist... at least for a few seconds before it clunks down around your ankles!

name: Farle's Magic Bracelet
description: Shika covered this bracelet of precious stones with a hempen cloth to avoid drawing the Crobaks' attention while Farle sowed his barley.

name: King Jellix's Crown
description: This crown belonged to the famous King Jellix, renowned for his unbounded romanticism and his seductive power which left its mark on many female Jellies. Some even say he is the father of all the Jellies of the region of Amakna, proof (if needed) of his stamina and legendary fecundity.

name: Desert Cape
description: If fur isn't necessarily the most highly recommended clothing for an arid environment, Fennex fur actually protects you from external heat.

name: Terrdala Amulet
description: The only people allowed to wear this amulet were the inhabitants of the village of Terrdala, as it was considered to be one of the most important parts of their traditional costume. Seen close up, you have to ask yourself why.

name: Farle's Straw Hat
description: This straw hat has been made with several plaited magic ears, and padded on the inside with various types of hair and fabrics hand sewn by Farle's wife, Shika Ingalsse. Classier than the Slob Headgear, and more stylish than the Daudgee, this hat will protect you from the heat as it did Farle through hundreds of long harvests. In this hat, you'll own those fields.

name: Nelween's Belt
description: The Nelween Smoke trapped in the buckle of this belt is still charged with magic. It'll help you accomplish minor miracles, like lighting your way at night, and stopping you from trapping your unmentionables in your fly. You know what they say - "that's got to hurt", and it does. It really, really does.

name: Ourobubble Cape
description: If you're looking for a way to camouflage yourself in the desert, this cape could prove useful.

name: Drasmuty Belt
description: Yes my child, it will be hard to resist you with this belt on. Bowisse consequently advises you to never get too close to a Dragon Pig while wearing it. They're known to be lusty devils.

name: Smoothitch O'Ball
description: This amulet is, in fact, a candy. It might have been edible if it hadn't been carefully rolled under female Bworker armpits for 36 generations as part of some bizarre ritual.

name: Octovius
description: This headgear is made of dead dried Kralove leftovers. Be careful, it can come back to life if you use it as a bathing cap.

name: Terrdala Wedding Ring
description: This Wedding Ring comes from Terrdala Village. Closer to a lucky charm than a magic relic, you'll still be able to make your friends believe you've found your soul mate.

name: Terrdala Geta
description: These wooden Geta were made by the best shoemaker in the village of Terrdala. Let your warts take a breath of fresh air and enjoy the landscape.

name: Sandals Adin
description: Adin was a young Pandawa who loved collecting lamps, but he was far from being a genius.

name: Shika's Ears
description: Shika used to help Farle at harvest time by picking up the magic grain his scythe swiped. She used it to make necklaces. Though their roots and stalks have been cut off, these magic ears keep on ripening every year around the same time.

name: Farle's Cloak
description: This cape, a fashionable patchwork of cloth and leather, has allowed Farle Ingalsse to single-handedly sow entire fields for numberless seasons on end. Once folded up and used as a pouch, its capacity seems to be almost unlimited. Nobody really knows the tailor behind this marvel. All the story tells us is that his business went tail-up when his clients began to confuse his cloaks with floor cloths. What a sad end to a fine career!

name: Terrdala Hat
description: From a distance, you'll look like a Pandawushuka from Terrdala Village wearing this hat. Up close, you'll look like an idiot.

name: Akwadala Shield
description: Looking to fend off a frenzied attack? This shield from the village of Akwadala should do the trick.

name: Hogmeiser's Boots
description: These boots belonged to Hogmeiser for many years, before he actually lost them on a stupid bet with Grizmine. The moral of this story is… never gamble with an Ecaflip.

name: Farle's Ears
description: This apparently simple amulet was made from three magic ears of Corn, covered with the dust of precious stones, and planted in the Snossios plains during the thirteenth harvest of Istrabraq. It gives incredible courage to its bearer, who with its help can reap entire plains and valleys without rest.

name: Barbrossa's Hat
description: This hat is large enough to hide Barbrossa's ridiculously hairless head and beard. But it won't cover big-headed skulls.

name: Nelween's Amulet
description:
There are those who will happily proclaim that the word "whitish" doesn't exist, and that "Whitish Fang" should actually be "White Fang". Show them this amulet, made from fangs that are neither white, nor yellow, nor grey, nor black, and see if they'll shut up for a bit.
They probably won't.

name: Nelween's Boots
description: These lovely leather boots suddenly become less appealing when you discover that the fur that lines them came from the still-smoking body of a living-dead Whitish Fang.

name: Korko Kousto
description: An improved version of the Jouik Krampe, this hat was made out of the best resources found on Moon Island, giving it a rural character. Even if you don't look like a Kanniball, you'll still give some great headbutts.

name: Shika's Magic Bracelet
description: This bracelet covered up Shika's arms. This way it protected her from sunburn and Crobak pecks… the little creatures were attracted by her stunning beauty and many claim to have gotten lucky with her.

name: Koolich Boots
description: These boots used to belong to the Koolich - even if you can't tell, you can smell! These boots are so comfortable that you'll almost forget how miserable your existence is.

name: Orino Boots
description: Wearing these boots, you'll hear the noise of the wind on the coast or the cries of a chafer Lancer lost in the inmost depths of the labyrinth. They're disturbingly similar.

name: Legendary Cracklering
description: This rock, set with precious stones, is perfect if you want to leave a permanent mark on the forehead of an enemy.

name: Scurvion Amulet
description: Some intellectuals regularly get together to classify venoms depending on how dangerous they are: ranging from "slightly deadly" to "agonisingly deadly". To do so, they work off the density of ghosts present around the various venoms' sources. According to this data, Scurvion Venom is expected to make one "mildly dead". Wearing this amulet can mean one of two things: either you have little use for it, or you will soon understand the meaning of this classification system.

name: Golden Lady's Belt
description: An old legend extracted from the famous old book titled "Everything You Need To Know About Women" says that this belt once belonged to a golden lady, a lot more interested in wealth than in power. In the non-censored version of this book, we also learn that she was keen on cracking dirty jokes. I guess she wasn't that different from most women.

name: Horn Cape
description: This magnificent cape smells like fruits of the forest. Not enough to drive a Craette mad about you, but enough to drown the stink of a sloppy Sadida.

name: Loopine's Ring
description:
Loopine once asked the monster that haunted his cave the secret to making this ring. The monster said he'd have to do him a few favours in return, and Loopine gladly agreed.
Let's just say the poor guy never wanted to see another ring in his life after the monster was finished with him, let alone make the bloody things. Blimey!

name: Nelween's Cloak
description: Having thought about it, you wonder if this cloak, which you thought was an authentic piece made from Nelween Down, isn't actually what it seems at first glance. You don't remember Nelween being blue, or brown, let alone cut into two pieces the last time you saw her. Still, it'll match the wallpaper in your bedroom, won't it?

name: Crocodyl Chief Bracelet
description: This bracelet looks strangely like a glove... it's not a glove, it's a bracelet.

name: Scurvion Cloak
description: This cloak has settled on your back, which explains its colour.

name: Crocodyl Chief Amulet
description: This amazing amulet was made from a reptilian shield, from which all gems were removed. As a result, it's a particularly heavy, but very sturdy, piece of jewellery. Your neck will be protected from vampire bites, as well as from the aggressive advances of female villagers.

name: Aerdala Belt
description: Pandawas from Aerdala always watch their figure. If you tighten this belt as much as possible, you should finally get some results with your flabby belly problem.

name: Crocodyl Chief Schoolbag
description: The first day back to school after the holidays is tough for any child, but for Iops, it's as though they die a little inside every time it happens. This bag makes the whole experience that bit easier to bear.

name: Crocodyl Chief Headgear
description: If you've always dreamt of looking like a Crocodyl - without becoming one - then this headgear's make for you. Don't even think about using this headgear to fool your friends and tell them you've actually killed a Crocodyl. They'll never believe you.

name: Crocodyl Chief Shield
description: The shape of this shield makes it easier for you to collect Crocodyl tears from your enemies after their defeat.

name: Skill of Dolls
description: Pol Dullbow himself ordered this amulet from a renowned jeweller. He wanted to play with several dolls at the same time instead of having to wait for one to die before summoning a new one, something Sadidas like to do a great deal.

name: Crocodyl Chief Sharp Slippers
description: These beautiful slippers, made of Crocodyl Chief's skin and scales, come with sharp teeth at their ends. Be careful when you play footsie under the table with your beloved, you might rip her lovely Tabi woollen stockings.

name: Koolich Bag
description: The Koolich uses this bag to keep his Kaliptus leaves fresh or to suffocate Koalaks that are a bit too enterprising.

name: Scurvion Helmet
description: Scurvions may be among the best-armed monsters, but paradoxically, this helmet gives you everything you need to defend yourself where they cannot: on your head.

name: Feudala Geta
description: These wooden Geta were made by the best shoemaker in the village of Feudala. Let your warts take a breath of fresh air and enjoy the landscape.

name: Ab'ho Ring
description: For experienced adventurers only. It might shock your family and friends to know it's composed of young, innocent creatures.

name: The Xerbo
description: Specially designed to reward skilful knights, the Xerbo must be worn without underwear and in winter only.

name: Ano Neemous Ring
description: Nobody knows who the owner of this ring is. He wanted to remain anonymous after a humiliating defeat inflicted by a summoned Arachnee. We must say in his defence that this Arachnee had been compelled by a Iop…

name: Desire O'Ball Cloak
description: This cloak is made of red beard hair... it is quite unique. Animated by extraordinarily powerful magic that renders it all but living, it adores playing practical jokes on the unfortunate bugger who puts it on. It's favourite trick? It unfindably conceals itself when it senses you need it most. If you do ever manage to discipline it, it can be very powerful in fights. As the Wabbits like to say it's a "weal good instwument of wawfawe".

name: Iop Wig
description: This poor imitation of a Iop's flamboyant hairstyle is said to have been made using a ball of wool blessed by the god Ecaflip himself. That's probably why Woolly Bow Meows have such fun playing with it.

name: Polished Ring
description: Unfortunately, this ring is only polished on the outside. You put your finger through a hole full of sharp rock fragments. It is recommended for Sacriers.

name: Crocodyl Chief Belt
description: Too stiff to be used as a whip, too flexible to cause any real bodily harm, this gem-covered belt nevertheless serves one obscure purpose... Armed with this, you'll never find your pants around your ankles again. Great or what?

name: Aerdala Cloak
description: This cloak comes from Aerdala. It can be used as a doormat or even as a floorcloth if you've just come out of water.

name: Derma Tho
description: This skin shield will fit you like a glove. Don't forget to treat its warts and furuncles from time to time to prevent them from getting worn.

name: Ouginiakal Belt
description: Here's a belt that'll please the thrill-seekers among you! It was designed to aid the easy and safe hunting of Ouginaks. Mortality rates remained the same as before, but hunters kept wearing the thing. You have to admit it's classy though, no?

name: Conno Ring
description: The woman who created this ring was convinced the end of the World was near due to plummeting food supplies. She used to spend entire days engraving messages on wooden tables with her motto 'No steak but what we bake'. Time proved her wrong.

name: Boowolf Cloak
description: This Boowolf fur makes for excellent protection against the cold... and also adventurers with a highly developed sense of smell.

name: Gobbamu
description: You wear this amulet proudly, as a symbol of your participation in this great sporting event. You need it to stay proud having been through a scrum with B.C. Trool.

name: Gobball Breeder Boots
description: These magnificent boots are perfect for kicking Gobballs in the arse when you're herding the difficult little runts. Children respond just as well to the same encouragement.

name: Aerdala Hat
description: From a distance, you'll look like a Pandawushuka from Aerdala Village wearing this hat. Up close, you'll look like an idiot.

name: Limestone Dreggheadgear
description: A Limestone Dreggon shell padded with leather and wool, this headgear will protect you from basic attacks and the lightning bolts of a drunken stumbling Bwork Magus. You'll also look like you just fell out of a Dreggon's backside.

name: Turquoise Amulet
description: Apart from its colour, this amulet has no connection whatsoever to the famous Turquoise Dofus. However, it is every bit as powerful. Sometimes you can read a book by its cover…

name: Clay Dreggheadgear
description: This padded Clay Dreggon shell makes you nearly impervious to Bwork Magus's magical lightning bolts. It won't be any help against real lightning, however…

name: Coal Dreggheadgear
description: The Coal Dreggon shell is ideal if you want to want to go unnoticed at night or avoid falling rocks. That makes it popular with two divergent sections of society: peeping Toms in Madrestam Harbour and fans of Crackler rock-throwing contests.

name: Flee-Flops
description: These Flee-Flops were used to practice various martial arts. Not quite revolutionary and artistically speaking, a failure, they were only good for running away, a bit like yourself.

name: Hairy Cloak
description:
This cloak smells very bad - it has to be said. Truth be told, it's made with a dense mixture of monster hairs, which gives off this wonderful medley of odours.
Do not confuse the Hairy Cloak with Hairy Pie, which is something else entirely.

name: Slate Dreggheadgear
description: This Slate Dreggon shell would suit you perfectly, if only you knew how to wear it. Not everyone can pull off headgear such as this, though – just take a look at the Iops. Those bumbling idiots don't even wear it the right way around!

name: Terrdala Cloak
description: This cloak comes from Terrdala Village. It can be used as a doormat or even as a towel if you've just come out of the water.

name: Paper Amulet
description: There's enough room for one of your friends to write your name on this paper amulet, which is just what breeders do so they know which Gobballs belong to them.

name: Moon Boots
description: The fur used to make this pair of boots is absolutely ideal for keeping your feet warm. These boots are also a heart-warming memory of Moon.

name: Aerdala Amulet
description: The only people allowed to wear this amulet were the inhabitants of the village of Aerdala, as it was considered to be one of the most important parts of their traditional costume. Seen close up, you have to ask yourself why.

name: Kitsou Wrap
description: This wrap is river-washable, even though it might fade after the third cycle.

name: Anaesthetising Belt
description: The liquid flowing in this belt has superior healing properties and provides instant relief for nagging back pain!

name: Moopet Cape
description: With this cape on, you'll be craving for some vinaigrette.

name: Phero-Cape
description: Driven into a strange frenzy, any Tofus that you meet will want to rub up against your leg. Are you sure it's the cape that attracts them?

name: Pinokio Ring
description: This ring was made from sawdust and something very sticky, and it's better that you leave it at that.

name: The Stars Custard Tart
description: This amulet, cast in a mixture of celestial eggs and milky stardust, must be kept refrigerated.

name: Boowolf Headgear
description: The smell coming from this Boowolf Headgear will handily mask your terrible breath.

name: Kitsou Cap
description: This Kitsou cap can only be worn by adventurers who've lost their sense of smell. Don't ask me why.

name: Boowolf Boots
description: These boots are coated with Boowolf hair. They are extremely useful for cleaning dusty wooden floors or fixing up the heads of your enemies as they lie dead on the battle field.

name: Koalak Cloak
description: This cloak will protect you from most attacks, but not from being ridiculous.

name: Flowing Cloak
description: This cloak was made out of a pennant which used to be kept on the highest tower of Amakna Castle. That's probably why it smells like fresh, sun-kissed linen waving in the Junssidor breeze…

name: Paper Pants
description: This strong and rigid undergarment is not very comfortable, but then it was made with paper mache, after all. Having the saliva of a stranger on your buttocks does not seem to bother you in the slightest, I notice.

name: Wa Wabbit's Crown
description: This magnificent Crown once belonged to the notorious Wa Wabbit.

name: Cawwot Dofus
description: If a dragon really did lay this egg, then she must have been a right sweetheart. Especially since its main purpose seems to be to attract adventurers to the Wa Wabbit's island so he can nick all their garb and gear before humiliating them. All in all, it's quite a good way to obtain the latest sets without having to leave the house.
stats: Gives 25 AP Parry if an MP penalty is suffered, or 25 MP Parry if an AP penalty is suffered.
The two effects do not stack, and last 1 turn.

name: Jelliboots
description: These boots are great in summer because they give off a smell of wild strawberries in the heat... which also masks the stench of perspiration left behind by the hairy toes of the old Sadida who wore them before you.

name: Blue Turtle Belt
description:
This small belt is ideal for protecting your most sensitive parts from critical blows.
Just check that the shoemaker has removed the owner from inside before trying it.

name: Amourlet Ernal
description: Made by Isgrate Giftoyu, this amulet symbolises passionate love. When you put it on, you can make Ballotwine's Day last forever.

name: Eiderdelt
description: This feathery belt will really emphasise your waist. Not that it needs much emphasising.

name: Eiderdoots
description: These downy boots, which give the impression you have Dragoturkey feet, would make excellent slippers. You know, the type your guests make fun of whenever you wear them round the house? You aren't really going to wear them outside, are you?

name: Wa Wabbit's Cloak
description: This cloak once belonged to the notorious Wa Wabbit. It is still imbued with his perspiration which will bring back a few memories of the amazing fight every time you put it on.

name: Koalak Amulet
description: This amulet does not look like any other amulet, simply because no other amulet looks like it.

name: Coral Ring
description: This ring was pulled off the still-warm finger of a freshly slaughtered Coralator. His mother was expecting him for dinner, until she saw he'd been transformed into a tombstone. Coralators are not as stone-hearted as people might imagine.

name: Caracap
description: Just like you, turtles have very small heads. How convenient! This cap is just the right size for both of you.

name: Caracape
description: A practical, well-made cloak. It won't make a champion out of you, but then again, I can't think of anything that would make a champion out of you.

name: Amourlette Ernal
description: Made by Isgrate Giftoyu, this amulet symbolises passionate love. When you put it on, you can make Ballotwine's Day last forever.

name: Jelleadgear
description: With this headgear on, the hotties will be queuing up to lick you. It's one of those things Captain Chafer always dreamt of in his own time.

name: Gelano
description: There's no need to bite your nails with this ring on your fingers, just lick them instead!

name: Wabbit Flip-Flops
description: These Wabbit thongs give you the "Cawwot attitude." They are recommended by experts of ritual dancing, tap-dancing or the Captain Chafer fast tango.

name: Koalak Boots
description: These boots are in fact real Koalak feet that were brutally pulled off their owners, then emptied of their content before being padded with Koalak hairs. Both terrifying and attractive, these boots will make you the terror of Astrub.

name: Just Ring
description: You don't know what the symbol engraved on this thing means, but who cares? It leaves an awesome stamp on the bruised faces of the enemies you defeat. You could always carve your initials in their flesh with the end of your sword, but that takes so much longer.

name: 1001 Claws Boots
description: These size 2 waders were made for Ecaflips with small feet. Unless you share a shoe size with Kerub, they’ll make a lovely decoration for your living room.

name: 1001 Claws Breeches
description: This marvellous piece of armour is an exact replica of the breeches worn by Kerub. It will stop any enemy weapons heading cruelly towards your intimate areas.

name: Bawbawian Shield
description: Not all Wabbits are nice little creatures. In fact, all Wabbits are vile creatures. Some get their kicks by smashing up Cawwots with this huge shield and taking baths in the juice.

name: Large Adventurer Bag
description: This is the ideal bag for keeping all your bread and potions in when you are on an exotic holiday on Moon Island.

name: Jellibelt
description: The worst thing about this item is that when you get hungry, you'll be tempted to take a bite of it.

name: Gelamu
description: This amulet betrays your love of jelly.

name: Caraboots
description: A bit heavy but really pretty, you'll be the queen of the night with these Caraboots on.

name: Yellow Turtle Belt
description:
This small belt is ideal for protecting your most sensitive parts from critical blows.
Just check that the shoemaker has removed the owner from inside before trying it.

name: Green Turtle Belt
description:
This small belt is ideal for protecting your most sensitive parts from critical blows.
Just check that the shoemaker has removed the owner from inside before trying it.

name: Red Turtle Belt
description:
This small belt is ideal for protecting your most sensitive parts from critical blows.
Just check that the shoemaker has removed the owner from inside before trying it.

name: Wabbit-tooth Amulet
description: The teeth of this amulet have eaten away more Cawwots than Brouce Boulgoure has uprooted trees, so don't be surprised if you find Tiwabbits trying to give you kisses on the neck as a result of your powerful Cawwot awoma.

name: Cawwot-Bag
description: If you carry this bag on your back, you can go on a trip without worrying about food. Even if the Cawwot is as empty as a Iop's skull, the leaves on top of it can grow again. Ideal to make herbal tea.

name: Koalak Belt
description: This Kaliptus leaf belt diffuses a delightful smell that will hide all others. Besides, this belt is perfect for hiding your chubbiness.

name: Koalak Headgear
description: This headgear is adorned with huge Koalak ears which can amplify any sound within hearing distance. Be careful, it can destroy your eardrums if your friends are fond of the Wind of Panic.

name: Curative Pendant
description: This needle-shaped pendant grants the power to heal even the most serious of injuries… If you know how to use it.

name: 1001 Claws Torque
description: Worn as a necklace by very large beings, this torque is the main piece of Kerub's armour, protecting his entire upper torso.

name: The Enutrofion
description: This ring is meant for Enutrofs only. It was enchanted by their God so that the followers would be the only ones to wear it. It allows all god-fearing Enutrofs to be even luckier than usual in treasure hunts.

name: GM Wabbit Y-fwonts
