description: These briefs of respectable size still sport the marks of their former owner (plus some really strange hairs). On the buttocks or on the head, this garment will bring you unlimited respect around Amakna.

name: Omerta Ring
description: The enchantment in this ring is very strange - once around your finger, the only person you'll be able to talk to will be the jeweller who made it.

name: Piggy Paupe's Ring
description: Piggy Paupe yelled so loudly when he sang that after a while, he became deaf. The magic infused into the ears of his ring helped him hear again. The snout addressed the damage caused by its stench.

name: Boracelet
description: The Boracelet is really a simple bracelet made of black plastic. Its creator, however, managed to turn it into a great commercial success by inventing madder and madder ways to use it. Some of them were in such dubious taste we'd rather not go into details here. And that's saying something.

name: In'Orth Hat
description: If you're lost in the dark, try pointing the star decorating this hat in all directions. When it shines like a thousand lights, you'll have found the North, and the right path at the same time.

name: Feather Amulet
description: This amulet will tickle your neck and make you cough up that frog in your throat.

name: Jellicape
description: Without any hairs or threads, this cape remains a mystery for the intellectuals of Amakna. At last count there were ten.

name: Wabbit Ears
description: These Ears won't improve your hearing but the good news is that your friends will easily spot you in a crowd...and that your enemies will have a good laugh. Keep smiling, this pair of ears will prove essential with time.

name: Poppinz Boots
description: These boots are perfect for dishing out punishment with your feet so that you don't have to get your hands dirty. The children will adore you!

name: Lightning Leaves
description: This ring starts glowing when it senses hostile plants nearby. If you're going to the Petrified Forest, you may as well take it off... But just so you know, you'll also be wide open to attacks from mutant plants.

name: Just Boots
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Borbaring
description: This ring has the following engraved on its inside edge: "For upholders of the law who doesn't afraid of anything". Bless. Did you really think you could use it?

name: Kwismas Ring
description: Whether you put this ring on your finger or on a Kwismas Tree, it's the ideal accessory to be displayed during the festive season.

name: Young Vald's Ring
description: While other Iops of his age got presents like a Tabi or a wooden Goultard for their communion, Vald got this ring. It's hardly something you can show off to your friends but it's very useful for fighting.

name: Soothing Ring
description: Feeling tense? Rub this ring against your skin and feel your muscles instantly relax. The light scent of menthol will also be a great improvement on your usual odour.

name: Piney Shoes
description: You'll be pining for these shoes once you realise how great they are.

name: Nonsenz Ring
description: The jeweller who created this masterpiece is no relative of the famous sword smith, despite appearances. According to its creator, this ring is supposed to remind you of life in the bush without having to mind the shrubbery. No one has figured out what he was going on about yet.

name: Pinokio Boots
description: This pair of boots was carved out of a tree trunk. Unless it's the opposite.

name: Vulkanian Bracelet
description: In the past, this bracelet was given to tourists visiting Vulkania to make sure that they didn't come to the island twice despite only registering once. Charlie's Agents soon stopped this when they realised that nobody ever wanted to come back to Vulkania. That is, if they ever made it off, and didn't end up in the island's ever more populous cemetery.

name: Kitsou Amulet
description: This Kitsou Amulet will draw attention to your double chin.

name: Golden Scaracape
description: More golden than a classical Scaracape and less black than a Black Scaracape, this cape is perfect to hide your outgrowths. The Scarabugly used to use it to hide its awful hump, for example. These days, this cape is mainly used to hide terrible-looking behinds. No need to point out that this cape is very popular.

name: Poppinz Ring
description: Hook this ring around the neck of any children in your charge, and then connect the ring to a rope that you've hung from a tree. Now you can enjoy yourself and the children can't escape.

name: Brown Varnished Shoes
description: These varnished shoes are the height of fashion in some of the less well-developed countries of the World of Twelve. In Amakna, however, you might be mistaken for an ill-mannered immigrant.

name: Golden Scara Helmet
description: This helmet will hide your teenage acne or your ugly face.

name: Piggy Paupe's Amulet
description: The shoe that adorns Piggy Paupe's Amulet is that of his wife and muse Yque Paupe, who bought it for him a gift. But Piggy has always thought it was more of an excuse to stop coming to his concerts than proof of love.

name: Prisoner Belt
description: The man who gave this belt such a stupid name is actively sought by the police. The years he'll spend in prison when they catch him still won't make up for such a lack of creativity.

name: Jon Lemon's Boots
description: Jon Lemon always put on these boots when he had a deposit to make in the hut at the bottom of his garden.

name: Wheelie Amulet
description: This amulet isn't anywhere near as sharp as it looks, which will be a relief to most people... Although perhaps not to the Sacriers who saw it from afar, noticed its resemblance to an instrument of torture, and bought it on the spot.

name: Sandals Koholiks
description: Those sandals are given to sick Pandawas for those special emergencies... we're talking the dreaded McSheth, which usually comes a knocking when they drink too much down at the Inn.

name: Boowolfulet
description: Behind this stupid name, you'll find an extremely powerful amulet, made with Boowolf fangs and bones which explains why it smells so bad. If it doesn't suit your neck, it will perfectly suit your breath.

name: Hichete's Amulet
description: Hichete, dishonest and sore loser as he was, always used to cheat at thumb wars: he used two hands. One to pin his opponent's thumb down and, if that didn't work, one to chop it off with his dagger.

name: Green Mankini
description: No one knows why the straps on this mankini are so long. Did it once belong to the lanky Rushu? Was it used as a catapult in the Battle of the Crimson Dawn? There's certainly something off-putting about it.

name: Diploring
description: This coloured ring will remind you of your naive and worry-free youth, when your arms were covered in multicoloured bracelets from market stalls. Fashion spares no man.

name: Borboots
description: The shoemaker who designed these boots fitted them with Borbat wings so that their wearer could fly. Well, it was difficult to hear anything above the obnoxious din, but that's what you thought the merchant was saying when you bought them from him at the Astrub Zaap.

name: Aerdala Geta
description: These wooden Geta were made by the best shoemaker in the village of Aerdala. Let your warts take a breath of fresh air and enjoy the landscape.

name: Ougicle's Belt
description: In his youth, Ougicle wore his belt as a loincloth, with no trousers. He stopped the day he realised why people were laughing at him when he turned away from them.

name: Brrrito Amulet
description: Warning! Risk of death! This amulet was manufactured using a Woolly Piggoth rump. Never ever try to use it as a gas mask.

name: Mawaboots
description: After trudging leagues and leagues through chocolate, the soles of these boots have absorbed so much that they leave footprints wherever you go. Discretion NOT guaranteed…

name: Aerdala Wedding Ring
description: This Wedding Ring comes from Aerdala Village. Closer to a lucky charm than a magic relic, you'll still be able to make your friends believe you've found your soul mate.

name: Vegicape
description: This elegant cape will make you irresistible to all the noobs out there.

name: Hooded Cloak
description: This hood-cloak hybrid is just amazing. If it were made of leather, Captain Chafer would have loved it.

name: Piggy Paupe's Belt
description: The discomfort caused by Piggy Paupe's belt tended to make him adopt a very particular gait, always swaying his pelvis forward or backward. Don't expect to garner much interest from the opposite sex, you don't look attractive, just grotesque.

name: Mirh's Ring
description: Mirh, like any good percussionist, can't help but tap away at anything that moves, even when he's asleep. He's going to have trouble finding a partner who knows how to stay alive with him around.

name: Pota Ring
description: Many other adventurers dreamt of getting their paws on this jewel long before you came along. Indeed, it's said to have many powers, such as the power to turn fierce warriors into good-for-nothing dreamers. It says in my book to never put it near fire. Doesn't say why.

name: Vulkanian Boots
description: These boots, made from the remains of dozens of Juvenile Sauroshells, are very trendy outside Vulkania. On Vulkania, they're perfect for suicide missions amongst the Venerable Sauroshells, who'll take it upon themselves to avenge their little brothers without hesitation.

name: Chesty Pendant
description: The key for this pendant doesn't open the Chesty Hat, the Chestity Belt, or even the Chesty Boots. It doesn't open any other lock that you have ever come across, for that matter. The only reason for it existing is to incite hope that one day it will serve some kind of purpose. A little bit like you.

name: Imakoboots
description: Whilst shoemaking critics (yes, they exist) consider these boots to be the crowning point of their art, you're inclined to see them as proof that art definitely doesn't exist in this day and age.

name: Waddict Ring
description: This furry ring will warm any finger you put in it.

name: Sandals Ailuya
description: Those sandals were awarded to young Pandits at the end of religious rituals. Nowadays they are mainly used for tap-dancing championships.

name: Ougicle's Ring
description: This ring helped Ougicle to stop biting his claws. To this day, it still glistens with slobber.

name: Hichete's Belt
description: Hichete might have the appearance and mocking laugh of any old Barbrossa, but he surpasses them all in terms of guile. Even this belt can't hold his trousers up when he doubles up with laughter as he pushes, traps, fools and hinders his opponents.

name: Feather Sandals
description: Lighter than conventional sandals, they have only one real drawback, they don't suit ticklish people at all.

name: Hir Boots
description: You can't see any difference between these hairy boots and your feet, but it should be obvious: the boots smell nice.

name: Davyd's Cloots
description: Unwashed and slightly dazed, but always at the height of country fashion, Davyd was the one who invented this hybrid of clogs and boots, which combines the solidity and the rustic feel of the clog with the protection and practicality offered by the boot. He never stopped campaigning for their popularity, going so far as to say they were the product of his own sweat and tears. Which probably put a great many people off wearing them.

name: Brrrito Ring
description: The inhabitants of Amakna who could be described as a few sandwiches short of a picnic believe that the Woolly Piggoth, being a prehistoric ancestor of the common Boar, is 100% extinct, and that creating jewels from its ivory is therefore perfectly ethical. That's why wearing this ring will make you look like you've never actually been to Frigost and as though you're a bit dense.

name: Bow'hee Talisman
description:
"I, I am the kheeng, you, you are the quheen, whee can be heeroes just for one daaaayyyy"
Davyd, the famous minstrel, was singing his head off on his way back from Moon Island.

name: Mirh's Belt
description: Mirh is a Pandora who has never been able to summon Pandora's Box. To compensate, he added a small box to his belt, in which he keeps various poisons which cause all sorts of maladies. Unfortunately, he never managed to make any of his enemies ingest one, so he only uses the sleeping poison when he can't get to sleep.

name: Kitsou Ring
description: This small Kitsou ring will protect you from casual troubles.

name: Lonne's Boots
description: This versatile pair of boots will guarantee full freedom of movement, which is the reason that Lonne Jenone wears them when he dances with Boowolves.

name: Gobkool Cape
description: If you're the kind of person who always thinks positive, this cape is made for you. It's so thick and comfy that it can be used as an improvised bed when you feel extremely sleepy. Its smoked Kaliptus odour even repels insects and other unwanted creatures.

name: Chesty Hat
description: With your head inside this hat, never have the contents of a chest been so disappointing.

name: Kloome
description: This huge shield saved the famous adventurer Kloome from an awful death: squashed under the weight of a Crackler who had fallen in love with him. The legend doesn't say if he survived the side effects of his subsequent romance with the stony beast.

name: Dazzling Cloak
description: This magnificent cloak increases AP, as well as Vitality and Wisdom.

name: Trembling Dodu Belt
description: The Dodu was a Sadida who loved frightening his enemies. He asked Bowisse to make him a belt that matched the colour of his hair… Like many charmers, the Dodu had a rotten heart.

name: Rat Belt
description: This belt once belonged to a Grossewer Rat. It suits it perfectly. What I'm not supposed to tell you is that the little rodent had the most horrifying case of love handle you've ever seen.

name: Kannipiwi
description: An improved version of the famous Kanniball Mask, the Kannipiwi will make you look like a real Piwi hunter to your friends.

name: Diplamulet
description: This amulet generates magical interference that changes the way your vocal cords work and forces you to sing "Di di di di di". Unfortunately, that sounds awfully like the Kidos' wedding march. It's never too late to learn how to lay an egg.

name: Golden Scaraboots
description: These hooked boots make it easy for you to climb the sheerest of cliffs or to plough your fields without a plough.

name: Prisoner Amulet
description: This small chain could pass for an amulet were it not the tip of a padlock.

name: Vulkanian Ring
description: The compass embedded in this ring will prove very useful for finding the way back to your cosy little cottage after all your friends have been slaughtered by furious Sauroshells.

name: Davyd's Belt
description: The musical note on Davyd's belt is actually a button which, once activated, launches an S.O.S. into the sky, signalling to all the space oddities that an earthling's in trouble. Somebody up there likes him.

name: Haks Or Cloak
description: This fabric cloak, coated with a thin layer of gold, is magical. It attracts attention and reflects light directly into the pupils of dishonest types who try to stab you from behind. Essential if you have Sram friends.

name: Imakoring
description: This ring also works as a magic paintbrush. Just wave your hand and magnificent lines will appear from nowhere! Obviously, waving your hands everywhere also makes you look like an absolute nutter. The choice is yours: do you want to be an artist of genius, or hang onto the few friends who aren't already embarrassed to be seen with you?

name: Jules Yanos's Cloak
description: The famous tailor, Jules Yanos, was particularly renowned for having exchanged his wife for a magic thimble. What a businessman, hmm? Just great!

name: Okaringa
description: Spiteful gossips claim that this ring is the most useful fashion accessory in the World. The wings attached to it can be quite a pain when you need to get a tissue out of your pocket. Now, Iops neither have tissues nor pockets… so, it's just fine.

name: Klume's Ring
description: Gontran Klume the smith traded a sword belonging to Dame Antium for this ring.

name: Ougicle's Amulet
description: Ougicle especially liked his gold necklace: it amplified his cries so much that the ground around him vibrated. Very handy for flushing out Kolerats.

name: Kwakwa Hat
description: As well as covering your little bird brain, this hat will give you a proud allure and might even make you forget you’re an egg head. What more can you ask for?

name: Hir Bracelet
description: When you pull this bristly bracelet on, you'll relive your last encounter with Fuji, minus the humidity. Oh and FYI you can also wear it on your wrist.

name: Bontarian Belt
description: As of last spring, this is officially the trendiest belt on the streets of Bonta. The insignia of a renowned brotherhood of shoemakers adorns the buckle.

name: Brakmarian Belt
description: It's the most fashionable belt in the sewers of Brakmar, perfect if you're looking to give the impression that you're a hard nut to crack. In your case it's just an impression, but it's useful nonetheless.

name: Ostarr Ring
description: A particularly talentless group of cosmopolitan minstrels used this type of ring to keep time at their shows after their original drummer left them. They would all put a ring on a toe, and beat in time. Needless to say, it was the percussion that always let them down.

name: Hulkrap's Boots
description: Hulkrap slipped these comfortable boots on to his ample feet once a year, but he took them off every day, which suggests they might be magic.

name: Fleaster Amulet
description: If you wear this amulet just underneath your chin, its small wings will help keep a spring in your step.

name: Koalak Ring
description: This beautiful ring is worn by the most foolhardy of all Koalaks… the ones who stole it in Astrub.

name: Hulkrap's Amulet
description: Hulkrap stole this amulet from Ted Gonztipay, an anally retentive goblin with absolutely no sense of humour whatsoever.

name: Mirh's Amulet
description: Mirh sometimes uses his amulet as a pendulum to lull him to sleep more easily. The problem is, since it's also a little drum, when he drops it as he's nodding off, it wakes him up with a deafening racket.

name: Chesty Boots
description: These boots are the safest boots in the World of Twelve. Pop them on your feet and you can be sure that nobody will steal your socks. Please note: toe-stubbing protection not included.

name: Pandalida Belt
description: This belt was made to match Pandalida's favourite weapon, the Andy War Sword, perfectly. It's the simply decorated sword that proves its worth in battle, not the belt, which is woven with pieces of gold that make so much noise your enemies always hear you coming.

name: Maria Kitty's Necklace
description: The crystal on Maria's necklace rings in harmony with her vocal chords and can create devastating shock waves. However, they will never do as much damage as her voice alone, which can effortlessly pierce your eardrums and ruin even your most beautiful fantasies.

name: Celery-Tea's Boots
description: These boots once belonged to a cook who was always in a big rush. He spent his time criss-crossing the land of Amakna looking for celery-tea.

name: Rags
description: This strange cape draws its strength from its rundown look. The dirtier it is, the more useful it is.

name: Black Scara Helmet
description: This helmet is perfect for those who see the World through opaque black glasses.

name: Haks Or Belt
description: This belt is perfect to hang your gold bars around your waist, they'll pass unnoticed.

name: Logram's Boots
description: Logram always remembers to take his thick Getas off before a fight, ever since the day when he Metamorphosed with them still on. His paws grew to ten times their normal size and, needless to say, it was very painful.

name: Kloug's Amulet
description: This amulet allows you to knead the skin on your neck without using your hands.

name: Hichete's Ring
description: Hichete's been married before. Unfortunately, it didn't last: he kept pushing his wife over the edge. Trapped, with her back against the wall, she preferred to leave. Pushing and trapping is pretty much the story of Hichete's life.

name: Slimming Belt
description: There's nothing better than this belt to offset all chocolate excesses and sculpt a dreamy Iop body.

name: Xelor Amulet
description: This ultra-powerful amulet is the fruit of the expert time-mastery of an old Xelor.

name: Eye of the Kaniger
description: The self-made Kaniger Rucky Balboua gave this eye to Melyonen to thank her for introducing his future wife, Adriana, to him. Soon after, they separated. Rucky would scream her name at the top of his voice and burst into tears without the slightest warning.

name: Kwakwa Wedding Band
description: The Kwakwa carries out a mating ritual to seduce the Kwakeres, which consists of displaying his tail feathers. He makes himself look incredibly silly when he does it, as he only has five of them. This is a perfect example of the old adage, "Make a woman laugh and she'll play with your staff."

name: Plain Crackler Amulet
description: This amulet contains a part of the Plain Crackler's story that could be summed-up in two lines if anyone knew it. Unfortunately, even the Cracklers have forgotten how it goes.

name: Klume's Belt
description: Klume had three weaknesses: Arachnees, being tickled, and tickly Arachnees.

name: Haks Or Mask
description: Equipped with this golden helmet, your head will soon be up for auction and worth its weight in gold.

name: Klume's Boots
description: These boots can also be used as anvils. Their former owner urges you not to dance while wearing them.

name: Kwakwa Ring
description: Though he has no master, the Kwakwa does have an identification ring. He uses the Kwaks’ rings to identify and find them when they get lost, so they can be brought back to the nest safely. He wears his ring so they can find him when he gets lost looking for lost Kwaks. They go round in circles so much, they’ve never left Crackler Mountain.

name: Vulkanian Hat
description: This hat will make you look like a hunter from the darkest wild, who'll make your enemies feel just like children. In any case, that's what a certain Pan Velt would tell anyone who'd listen.

name: Apprentice Summoner Boots
description: These boots have been especially made for those who prefer to watch their summons do all the hard work during fights.

name: Hulkrap's Belt
description: This belt is constructed around a magnetic metal frame which attracts the purses of those careless enough to rub up against you.

name: Kloug's Ring
description: This ring has been dipped in a multitude of different yeasts. It is said that it is capable of transforming those who wear it into mould. Some adventurers don’t see any difference after slipping it on.

name: Kawotz's Boots
description: Kawotz's Boots are light and lined with fur, which makes them very comfortable. Unfortunately, as a Wabbit, he never managed to put them on.

name: Hir Cape
description: Watch out for the Prespics, who will be all too happy to rub up against you.

name: Chestity Belt
description: Once you have equipped this belt it will become impossible to take off without the key. This explains why it's only worn by women with incredibly jealous husbands, by girls with worrying fathers and by you, for the good of humanity (you should think about throwing away that key).

name: Pink Ballet Slippers
description: These magnificent slippers are a perfect excuse to dance. They can be worn with a tutu, or with other garments if you're worried about looking ridiculous.

name: Boowolf Ring
description: Watch out! This ring will make your finger stink, although that's no bad thing, as the foul smell will mask a worse smell. This may just be the best thing that could happen to your finger, your hands in general, your family and your guildmates, in fact.

name: Golden Scarabelt
description: If you love running naked on the paradisiacal Moon Island beaches, you'll surely fall in love with this belt.

name: Kloug's Belt
description: This belt is still covered in flour, perhaps because Kloug the Dark Baker used it as an apron. Mind you, it might not be flour, it could be the powder he uses to soothe his embarrassing rash.

name: Tribal Ring
description: The supposed origin of this ring is doubtful, to say the least. Apparently it once belonged to a clan of Kanniballs of the worst type, the fern eaters. Certainly a story to frighten any young Sadida, and quite a few older Sadidas too.

name: Black Scaracape
description: If you can't afford to buy a Mastralis Croak, but you like to scare Arachnees by wearing black clothes, this is the cape for you!

name: Haks Or Ring
description: This ring is so heavy that it greatly increases the inertia of your fist when you distribute blows to your opponents. When you begin punishing peasants, it will be virtually impossible to stop you.

name: Oly Medal
description: Oly was a disciple of Iop with only one ability – cooking. It is said that Iop himself gave her this medal in order to compensate for her weaknesses in battle. Only the pure of heart can wear it.

name: Bowisse's Boots
description: These exceptional boots will grant you an extra Movement Point in combat. However, the smell of Bowisse's feet will quickly stop you in your tracks again if you accidentally bring them too close to your nose.

name: Apprenticeship Boots
description: These strange boots were first used by young disciples who were one or two socks short of a pair. Ah yes, popular with the Iops.

name: Dark Makroute
description: The Dark Makroute is a hat created from a Mutilated Makroute stitched together without an anaesthetic. Strangely enough, the master who visited these mutilations upon him is the only one it obeys... it can't stand strangers.

name: Pippin Blop Ring
description: Once it wraps its Bloppish way round your finger, it's impossible to get rid of this ring.

name: Indigo Blop Ring
description: Once it wraps its Bloppish way round your finger, it's impossible to get rid of this ring.

name: Minor Eluder
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to limit your actions. It doesn't work against lawyers.

name: Minor Water Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Water attacks, but not from Water sports.

name: Minor Fire Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Fire attacks, but not Goblets of Fire.

name: Minor Instigator
description: This Trophy increases Initiative instead of taking it.

name: Minor Scholar
description: This Trophy increases your Intelligence. I wonder why the auctioneers at the Astrub Zaap have never thought to get one?

name: Minor Survivor
description: This trophy increases Vitality. Its effects against impotence have never been proven.

name: Minor Gymnast
description: This Trophy has the power to miraculously balance everything. Except, perhaps, your class spells.

name: Minor Shackler
description: This Trophy slows your loved one down when he or she desperately wants to leave. You laugh in the face of restraining orders!

name: Minor Stalwart
description: When the pressure gets too much, when people start throwing their weight around, and when you realise you’re a total pushover, it's time to equip this Trophy.

name: Minor Neutral Bulwark
description: This Trophy stops you from taking sides in combat and prevents you from potentially hurting yourself by casting a spell.

name: Minor Air Bulwark
description: Equip this Trophy and your worries will vanish into thin air.

name: Twitcher
description: If you would stop using it to check out birds for a second, you would discover that this Trophy is an incredible instrument of precision. You won't miss a thing, not even the Blop stain on the hat of an enemy crouching behind a bush in a hole on the other side of that hill all shrouded in mist.

name: Minor Barbarian
description: This Trophy will show your enemies that you are capable of the best actions known to man, and the most evil, and that you prefer the latter. And they will weep, forsooth.

name: Minor Miracle Man
description: It helps to be cured, but not in the ham sense.

name: Minor Rabid
description: The saliva on your lips allows you to create a Snailmet trail when you bite the dust.

name: Minor Water Devastator
description: You've always strongly believed that blood is thicker than water. Which is why you never pour yourself a refreshing glass of blood.

name: Minor Stunner
description: Headbutting an enemy to stun them seemed to be an interesting tactic. Until you realized they were wearing a helmet, but you weren't.

name: Minor Solid
description: Solid but not unbreakable. This is how your allies will describe you just before breaking your two big toes following a terrible joke.

name: Brambelt
description: As the swimsuit version was too risky, you opted for this belt to force you to keep an eye on your waistline, and thus keep a flat stomach.

name: Woolensocks
description: With your little feet protected from the cold, you're now ready to face the long winter evenings slouched in front of the fireplace.

name: Chronoxygene Tank
description: You'll finally be able to take a breather thanks to the air in this tank.

name: Kanniball Mask
description: This mask is the faithful replica, only a bit bigger, of the ones proudly worn by important Kanniballs.

name: Sticky Belt
description: Once you have equipped this belt it's hard to lose it, that's the least you can say! The scatterbrains and the serial victims of theft among you will be grateful.

name: Turkoring
description: Gobble, gobble.

name: Pippin Amublop
description: When Lorkos set off on his trip to the Labyrinth of the Minotoror, the first thing he did was put on his Amublop. No one ever found out why.

name: Coco Amublop
description: When Lorkos set off on his trip to the Labyrinth of the Minotoror, the first thing he did was put on his Amublop. No one ever found out why.

name: Pippin Bloopts
description: Does it make your mouth feel funny when you say the name of this object? Well, let me tell you, if you find yourself face to face with a highway robber who asks you for your 'Boot.. Bloops… Bloo…', you'll be glad to have just enough time to scurry off while he figures out how to pronounce the word. So stop your complaining.

name: Perfect Little Vulkanian Backpack
description: With this pack on your back, you're ready to explore Vulkania at your leisure. Warning - Vulkanian craftsman by no means guarantee its efficiency once you've left the island… although some claim that a well-stocked PLVB is better than other bags when all you want to do is sit in a corner on a paving slab and break the fast.

name: Minor Friction
description: This Trophy helps you slow down your opponent's movements so you can catch them more quickly and humiliate them accordingly, by giving them a wedgie, for example.

name: Minor Earth Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Earth attacks, unless you happen to be in Middle-Earth.

name: Minor Water Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Water attack damage, but it won’t help you turn water into wine.

name: Maria Kitty's Stilletoed Boots
description: Of modest origins, Maria has only ever been known to wear boots on her feet. To keep up her image of being a diva, she asked one of the greatest cobblers in Frigost to find a dye that would turn them a pretty pink colour. He ended up taking his own life, unable to forgive himself for having created such a monster.

name: Minor Stickler
description: This Trophy enables you to stick undesirables onto the bottom of your boots, or vice versa. Don't forget to tie your laces, now.

name: Minor Brainbox
description: This Trophy will make you so brainy that you'll score a clean 3 on the Bwork Intelligence Scale, which runs from negative infinity to 1.

name: Minor Fire Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you hold your own in the line of fire.

name: Minor Air Wrecker
description: The packaging this Trophy came in says that it works best when you have fresh air against your bare bottom. You can't wait to try it out.

name: Minor Paralyser
description: The good thing about this Trophy is that, if you hit an ally by mistake, there's little chance they'll be able to do anything about it.

name: Minor Earth Bulwark
description: This Trophy protects you from falling earth. Handy if you spend your days hollowing out underground passageways.

name: Minor Dynamo
description: Wind up this Trophy and you'll be going strong all night! You're never too old for the generation game.

name: Minor Curer
description: This Trophy will help you heal your allies by offering wise words: "an api a day keeps the doctor away; seven apis a week you'll no longer feel weak"

name: Minor Stunter
description: That pitiful slip on a banana skin was just a stunt to make your friends laugh. No one believed you, but everyone had a good laugh.

name: Minor Luckster
description: You had a 99% chance of getting a glass half-empty, but you got a glass half-full. How lucky is that!

name: Minor Fortification
description: That playground bully who destroyed your sand castle traumatised you for life. Time for payback.

name: Minor Neutral Devastator
description: There where your Dragoturkey has passed, the grass will never grow again.

name: Minor Delayer
description: Your technique is not to be the quickest, but to just delay everyone else so you're not the slowest. This is a tried and tested technique in all administrations of the World of Twelve.

name: Minor Neutral Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from all the ditherers who can't choose sides during a fight.

name: Cocoa Dofus
description: All your cares and worries seem to melt away as you carry this massive cocoa egg. You do indeed feel the effects of the chocolate: you are both comforted and a bit wider and heavier.

name: Nozokomial Ring
description: This living ring has a terrible curse that makes even the toughest of adventurers seriously ill. They say it was originally designed to heal the person who wore it, but since warriors brought it to the most disreputable locations in the land, its sense of dignity led it to become more and more dangerous and aggressive.

name: Turkoboots
description: Your friends are definitely going to be jealous. Those boots will take you all the way to the ambassador's party for one of those wonderful little golden chocolates.

name: Indigo Amublop
description: When Lorkos set off on his trip to the Labyrinth of the Minotoror, the first thing he did was put on his Amublop. No one ever found out why.

name: Morello Cherry Blop Belt
description: Behind the silly name is a belt. A belt that we don't know much about. Its original design and its magical ability to conceal the worst love-handles known to science ensure this is always a favourite with image-conscious, middle-aged men.

name: Pippin Blop Belt
description: Behind the silly name is a belt. A belt that we don't know much about. Its original design and its magical ability to conceal the worst love-handles known to science ensure this is always a favourite with image-conscious middle-aged men.

name: Coco Blop Belt
description: Behind the silly name is a belt. A belt that we don't know much about. Its original design and its magical ability to conceal the worst love-handles known to science ensure this is always a favourite with image-conscious middle-aged men.

name: Minor Repellant
description: This Trophy enables you to do a bit more damage to an opponent when you push them against a tree, some debris or another enemy with a goatee.

name: Minor Barrier
description: This Trophy protects you from Critical Hits in critical places at critical moments. Once it's equipped, you will suffer a side effect which will really get on your friends' nerves: You won't be able to accept criticism.

name: Minor Air Defender
description: This Trophy will protect you from Air attacks, but not from Air spray.

name: Minor Neutral Defender
description: This Trophy protects you from Neutral attacks, but it won't make your enemies any more Neutral once the hostilities commence.

name: Minor Healer
description: This Trophy increases Heals. It won’t make you look any more lively, though.

name: Minor Player
description: This Trophy increases your Chance. It doesn't seem to have any effect when you use cheesy chat-up lines though.

name: Minor Doctor
description: This Trophy lets you play doctors and nurses with your allies, or with your enemies, if the fight's too boring for words.

name: Minor Tease
description: This Trophy will make Chance your area of expert-tease.

name: Minor Earth Wrecker
description: This Trophy helps you keep your feet on the ground. Warning: can prove painful if used in conjunction with a flying mount.

name: Minor Slimeball
description:
This Trophy oozes a slippery liquid that gives you the upper hand when escaping from Lock-happy opponents.
Just don't be surprised when you don't get any free hugs on Ballotwine's Day.

name: Minor Forerunner
description: Having the first turn gives you the limelight to commit the first fatal error, show everyone what an idiot you are, prove that you're not a priority target, be the last man standing and come home a hero.

name: Lucky Dice
description: If you're always risking your life on a roll of the dice, then you'll love this necklace, which is just like the one worn by the famous Lucky Bow Meow. It'll even let you use the Kama Baraka in Kerub's shop. You lucky devil!

name: Minor Obstructor
description: If your enemies do not pass away, at least they shall not pass.

name: Minor Earth Devastator
description: Monsters will bite you on the bum and you will bite the dust. Poor monsters.

name: Minor Fire Devastator
description: When attacked, you'll fire back with anything: curses, taunts, bad jokes, baptisms and great balls.

name: Minor Evader
description: Use a good Fire attack with this Trophy and you'll be able to dodge and burn.

name: Minor Motivator
description: Sometimes it's just better to be never than late.

name: Minor Earth Carapace
description: This Trophy may come in useful as a dirt dish. If used upside down, logic dictates that it could also be used to dish the dirt.

name: Minor Fire Carapace
description: This Trophy will make an excellent ashtray if you prefer to use the Peace Pipe rather than fight.

name: Minor Air Carapace
description: Taking refuge under this Trophy will protect you from wind, but will not prevent you from generating your own. This can lead to an uncomfortable case of trapped wind.

name: Sharkal Shield
description: This shield protects you from taxes and from having to share your riches.

name: Chronomagic Suit
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Luthuthu Belt
description: This belt takes its name from its creator, a shoemaker who was less renowned and much older than Bowisse, but quite gifted all the same.

name: Turkocape
description:
Sometimes, when true love joins a warrior and a Dragoturkey, weird things can happen.
This cape proves is living proof of that, since there are Dragoturkey wings sewn onto it. The Dragoturkey sacrificed itself for the making of this cape, offered to Lonne Jenone, the famous minstrel, on their wedding day. Apparently, Jon Lemon even wrote a song about it.

name: Morello Cherry Blop Ring
description: Once it wraps its Bloppish way around your finger, it's impossible to get rid of this ring.

name: Morello Cherry Amublop
description: When Lorkos set off on his trip to the Labyrinth of the Minotoror, the first thing he did was put on his Amublop. No one ever found out why.

name: Morello Cherry Bloopts
description: Does it make your mouth feel funny when you say the name of this object? Well, let me tell you, if you find yourself face-to-face with a highway robber who asks you for your 'Boot... Bloops... Bloo...', you'll be glad you have just enough time to scurry off while he figures out how to pronounce the word. So stop your complaining.

name: Indigo Bloopts
description: Does it make your mouth feel funny when you say the name of this object? Well, let me tell you, if you find yourself face to face with a highway robber who asks you for your 'Boot.. Bloops… Bloo…', you'll be glad to have just enough time to scurry off while he figures out how to pronounce the word. So stop your complaining.

name: Logram's Ring
description: Lenald's origami head, inside Logram's ring, allows him to project illusions of himself, which has never been much use in battle, since he has to stay within short range and stand absolutely still to do it. You might manage to impress one or two bystanders, but that's all.

name: Minor Locker
description: This Trophy lets you keep the cowards close to you. So you can crush them more easily.

name: Minor Escapist
description: This Trophy lets you escape when the opportune moment presents itself.

name: Minor Fugitive
description: This Trophy allows you to escape from anyone who's trying to prevent you from reaching your destination. This doesn't work against those who are trying to prevent you from reaching your destiny though.

name: Minor Air Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Air attack damage in those who are full of hot air.

name: Minor Fire Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Fire damage. According to the label, it's guaranteed to get you all fired up.

name: Minor Transporter
description: This Trophy increases the maximum weight you're able to carry. It doesn't make a heavy heart any easier to bear though.

name: Minor Goliath
description: This Trophy will show the world that Strength runs deep in your family.

name: Minor Water Wrecker
description: This Trophy is your first step towards becoming less of a drip.

name: Minor Untouchable
description: This Trophy sends small, regular jolts of electricity running through your muscles, preventing them from seizing up and stopping you from falling asleep at family dinners.

name: Minor Fire Bulwark
description: This Trophy could save your life when your sect is on fire.

name: Minor Water Bulwark
description: Don't throw this Trophy out with the bathwater.

name: Minor Intellectual
description: Team up with some Bworks to become the group's intellectual.

name: Minor Escapee
description: There's no shame in fleeing when there's no chance of winning.

name: Observer
description: Armed with a telescope, perched up high in the branches far from combat, observers often play a decisive role in a battle. Most importantly, they are the first to be able to flee when they detect the battle is turning against their allies.

name: Minor Bloodthirst
description: Your friends salivate when they see you butcher but refuse to eat your delicious garlic soup. Strange.

name: Bramulet
description: Created by a witch of questionable morals, this amulet can tighten on command. Weirdly, the witch was never short of volunteers to wear it.

name: Cocoa Dofus
description: You close your eyes and suddenly the divine egg's chocolate scent fills your nose. You bring the mythical object to your innocent lips, heady with temptation and yearning for a new culinary pleasure. As your taste buds are flooded with bitterness, you learn to your great dismay that not all divine essences taste good.
stats: Each ranged attack suffered while you are in close combat with an enemy grants a chocolate mark.
These marks are consumed at the end of your turn; each one gives 25% of your level in shield for 1 turn.

name: Ouginak Cloak
description: This cloak is made from the body parts of an Ouginak, it still has the smell of the creature's humid nose. Personally, its taste reminds me of a horny set of Gobball's udders... Well, someone told me that... damn.

name: Turkohat
description: If you ever dreamt of looking like a turkey, this is your chance! However, if you want to remain healthy, we advise you not to wear this hat on the streets of Amakna during the Christmas season.

name: Coco Bloopts
description: Does it make your mouth feel funny when you say the name of this object? Well, let me tell you, if you find yourself face to face with a highway robber who asks you for your 'Boot.. Bloops… Bloo…', you'll be glad to have just enough time to scurry off while he figures out how to pronounce the word. So stop your complaining.

name: Indigo Blop Belt
description: Behind the silly name is a belt. A belt that we don't know much about. Its original design and its magical ability to conceal the worst love-handles known to science ensure this is always a favourite with image-conscious middle-aged men.

name: Minor Oppressor
description: This Trophy enables you to oppress your aggressors more easily. It also seems to work on digressers.

name: Minor Adamantin
description: This Trophy lessens your suffering a little when your opponents push you against a tree, a person, an animal or just something really big and hard. It does not protect you from blows, not even those dealt by calloused hands.

name: Minor Neutral Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Neutral attack damage. It was invented by a famous ogre: Pete Aitchnutrool.

name: Minor Acrobat
description: This trophy increases your Agility. You're finally going to be able to climb on your high horse without falling off.

name: Minor Earth Destroyer
description: This Trophy increases Earth attack damage. Only Earthworms are impressed by this.

name: Minor Vagabond
description: This Trophy accepts no responsibility for runaway brains.

name: Minor Bastion
description: This Trophy protects you from really cracking hits but also prevents you from scoring them yourself. You should take the opportunity to claim that you hate wanton violence and stand with your hands on your hips, tutting disapprovingly at everyone you see.

name: Minor Neutral Wrecker
description: This Trophy allows you to keep your face utterly expressionless as you decimate the enemy.

name: Minor Jostler
description: This Trophy turns you into the clumsiest warrior anyone has ever seen. Just turning around to check the height of the sun in the sky sends four of your allies flying into bushes and walls.

name: Minor Powerhouse
description: This Trophy is seasoned with Cania Bay sea salt, delicate herbs and rustic rust, so your enemies can enjoy a taste sensation when they smash their front teeth out on it.

name: Minor Deserter
description: This Trophy will be of no use to you whilst crossing the desert.

name: Minor Air Devastator
description: You tried different air styles but that was before your thatch turned into thin air.

name: Minor Feller
description: Knocking down so many enemies has made you a happy feller.

name: Minor Water Carapace
description: This Trophy protects you from Crocodyl Tears.

name: Minor Vigour
description: You took it literally when she said to 'get up and go'.

name: Peeka Belt
description: Used for parole in bygone days, the Peeka Belt apparently has an additional power compared to other belts. But nobody has figured out what it is. You'd better keep a close eye on the thing.

name: Boowolf Thong
description: Used as a whip, this thong can be a lot more efficient than it looks to motivate your fellow travellers when they've lost the will to live.

name: Pink Tutu
description: This pink tutu will be ideal for showing your little behind off at the New Year's festivities. Made of ancestral cotton and stretchy Sponge Mob mousse, soft and comfortable with a swishing skirt, this piece could be the first in a long line of tutus for a future star dancer.

name: Gadjet's Belt
description: If you wear this belt upside down and press on it hard enough, you may be able to activate its integrated retromagic module. It has never worked, but you can activate it anyway. Then you can then sell it on to someone even more naive than you.

name: Gadjet's Ring
description: Worn by several generations of handymen, this ring will protect your knuckle from hammer blows. Unfortunately, it is never sold in packs of five.

name: Chafer Helmet
description: Even Spartapine the Great Reaper doesn't have such a helmet, the precious stones and metals used to make it ensure your noggin will be kept safe and sound inside..

name: Kwag'U Cape
description: Made of bloody tissue, the Kwag'U Cape feels like stiff cardboard... a bit like a big, cape-shaped scab.

name: O-Ring Ami
description: This ring owes its name to the last words pronounced by its creator: "O' Ring Ami! You're such a friend!" he said in a painful but bewitching rattle. It is interesting to note that this Bamboo ring was actually made before Bamboo evolved. Another mystery which will not be solved for another ten years or so!

name: Logram's Amulet
description: Logram has mastered the art of origami, and made most of his equipment, like this amulet, out of paper. That said, just because you're his incarnate, that doesn't mean you can play with fire like he did. I'd avoid wearing it, if I were you, unless you want to get your neck burned.

name: Amulet of Luck
description: This amulet is almost perfect. It considerably increases the Wisdom of anyone who wears it. It's useful for making yourself appear wise in front of your friends, or passing yourself off as a model pupil.

name: Terrdala Belt
description: Pandawas from Terrdala always watch their figure. If you tighten this belt as much as possible, you should finally get some results with your flabby belly problem.

name: Chafeerce Belt
description: Behind the grotesque name, hides a beautiful creation by Bowisse the Shoemaker. Behind the beautiful creation, hides a grotesque reality... the belt is made of the skin and bones of Bowisse's Chafer victims.

name: Ragalde's Boots
description: Without any doubt, Ragalde was one of the most foolhardy Iop warriors. With these magic boots, he slew a great number of enemies.

name: Alowa Sandals
description: The soles of these sandals are thicker than regular sandals to make sure they'll resist the weight of the heavier Alowas.

name: Kawotz's Amulet
description: Kawotz's Amulet is simply a luxury version of the "Wabbit-tooth Amulet", adorned with fur. Too bad it made it less powerful.

name: Ring o'Stradamus
description: Stradamus was an old drunken Enutrof who could read the future in pints of beer. Legend has it he was buried standing up in a wall of the Brakmar inn upon his own request, "so that no drunkard can ever spill his beer over my grave". This has been told at least once a week by every drunk in every inn in Brakmar.

name: Five Cawat Ring
description: You were right to break that habit of ring-gnawing. At least if you have a lapse, this ring will stop you putting on too much weight.

name: Daudgee
description: The Daudgee is a disturbing helmet made of Ouginak remains and other rubbish. Worn for many years by Gourlo the Terrible, the Daudgee has come to symbolise hopeless desolation.

name: Flash Gorgon's Belt
description: Beyond his love for porcelain vases, there's little we know about Flash Gorgone. One legend says he was always in such a hurry that he could out run a Tofu… He learnt his lesson when he rushed out of bed one morning and tied his belt round his ankles. His porcelain collection still remembers that like it was yesterday.

name: Boostache's Amulet
description: Most adventurers will find this amulet quite difficult to wear, not because of its weight, not because its prerequisites are so demanding, nor because it's so weak, but because of the moustache that adorns it. It's probably because he wears his moustache so well that Boostache is such a well-respected monster.

name: Adelus
description: Not only is this belt elegant, it also massages you as you walk... You'd be surprised what a back rub can do for your murderous instinct.

name: Dark Treering
description: This ring allows the Dark Treechnid to be very stylish when it goes dancing. And as life is kind, there are many parties in the Dark Forest.

name: Black Scararing
description: This beautiful ring can be worn around your big toe. It's perfect to hide your warts and your ingrown nails.

name: Crystalline Belt
description: With this belt around your hips, no one will ever dare pinch you again for fear of having their fingers cut off.

name: The Godfather's Pants 'n' Suspenders
description: The motto of the tailor who made this wonder was "Even in the heart of the action, your pants must always remain up your behind which they will thanks to these high quality flax suspenders". This really isn’t a good motto…

name: Kawotz's Ring
description: The dark Cawwot that adorns Kawotz's ring isn't magic, and it's certainly not evil, it's just the same age as him.

name: Haku's Boots
description: Haku has never been a particularly communicative Zoth, much preferring activities inside to those outside, which is possibly why he's lived to such a ripe old age, far from the grabbing claws of adventurers searching for Kristalite and Zoth Fabric.

name: Harmony
description: This pendant will make you feel more harmonious.

name: Frank Lee Bruce's Black Belt
description: Famous Sunday fighter Frank crossed over into martial arts after he failed miserably at his stone-cutting apprenticeship.

name: Gobkool Headgear
description: Let's be honest, as headwear goes, this cap is about as fashionable as a mullet hairdo. You never know though, look what happened to drainpipe jeans.

name: Welt
description: This belt won't be enough to turn you into a brave little tailor capable of defeating seven giant Moskitos in one fell swoop, nor will it allow you to capture Unikrons.

name: Alowa Amulet
description: This amulet is a mere flower necklace. It's supposed to give off a magic smell and transform an Alowa into an Alowaian…

name: Amulet of the Depths
description: This Amulet of the Depths was found in the submerged shipwreck of the renowned Kralove fisherman, Tom Fawyer, also famous for his lousy jokes at the pirates' bar.

name: Tromatising Mask
description: If what you're looking for is a bit of trauma, you'll find great relief in this magnificent Rokokonut. We remind you that a free straw and many a mouthful of fresh Rokokonut-flavoured goodness are waiting for you inside.

name: Crackler Pendant
description: This powerful pendant contains the life-blood of the Crackler, that is to say all the items he gathered before he was killed by some jealous adventurer.

name: Black Wab Boots
description: Made from Black Wabbit backside skin, you’ll be able to take your revenge on those nasty little creatures with these butt skin boots, as they'll feel like they're kicking their own butt every time you kick something. It’s the simple pleasures that count.

name: Springy Boots
description: These boots are said to improve Kwismas dinners. Independent studies have shown that wearers of this footwear do show a marked increase in their appreciation for sprouts.

name: Uggly Boots
description: Typical footwear for big-hooped, gum-chewing, female Gobbowl fans, these boots are ideal for training in.

name: Crackler Boots
description: Incredibly heavy but equally effective, these rocky boots will give you a good excuse to drag your feet when you have to defend a Perceptor in a fight you know you can't win.

name: The Treemu
description: The Treemu is an elegant amulet. If you're planning on putting it on, we advise you not to wear any other clothes, as it makes silk look like the wool off a Gobball's backside.

name: Hallelujah Cloak
description: Lonard Kohen, the famous minstrel with the voice of a castrated Crackler (which is still incredibly low) was burnt alive in front of the bank of Bonta after causing a moral scandal with his latest, and last, song "Tower of Thong". A full recording was made of his cries of agony, which he had the vision to frame in C#m, modulate to Fb, and resolve in a risqué but manageable G#. Nice.

name: Grouillot's Ring
description: On the tomb erected in Grouillot's honour, it says that to avoid being burnt to death by his lamp like other Gargoyls, he extinguished his. He finally died of starvation, lost in the darkness of the Cemetery of Heroes.

name: Viootifool Belt
description: Rumour has it that this belt was created by Captain Blooe himself. Isn't that incredibly... incredible! You do believe me, don't you?

name: Crackler Cloak
description: This stone cloak is a bit too stiff, but you'll be grateful when you're in danger of being spat on by a Crackler.

name: Guavhat
description: This strange-looking hat looks like a big dehydrated rotting fruit... A bit like you after a night out at the pub.

name: Black Wab Belt
description: This belt is reversible and can be worn according to what you wish to hide or show.

name: Kanniball Andchain's Mask
description: Now that you know Kanniball Andchain wears a hood beneath his headgear, a hood with two holes for eyes, you are hit with the sudden realisation that this cycloptic mask must have rendered the poor sod completely blind.

name: Haku's Amulet
description: Haku isn't considered as a Zoth Master because of his social status, his studies or his ability to fight, but because of the numerous interminable evenings he spends as a game master with his Zoth friends. He likes to keep that to himself, though.

name: Haku's Ring
description: Haku has never been able to keep a girlfriend for very long. Each time an adventurer introduced herself to him, he got the impression she was only after him for his Zoth Master Fly, a situation which suited certain people perfectly.

name: Crackler Amulet
description: This amulet is as heavy as a bulimic Blop. It has not been designed for weak adventurers. However, once you get used to bearing its heavy weight around your neck, you'll sure cut a dash!

name: Green Scarabelt
description: The Scarabelt was worn as an indicator of a warrior's fist-fighting skills. With a Green Scarabelt, your enemy knew you were a beginner. A red one meant that you were a lusty warrior who ate the uncooked internal organs of your enemies just for fun... And the white one indicated that you were really tough. A blue one meant you didn't spend long enough saving up for one of the others.

name: Blue Scarabelt
description: The Scarabelt was worn as an indicator of a warrior's fist-fighting skills. With a Green Scarabelt, your enemy knew you were a beginner. A red one meant that you were a lusty warrior who ate the uncooked internal organs of your enemies just for fun... And the white one indicated that you were really tough. A blue one meant you didn't spend long enough saving up for one of the others.

name: Grillian's Boots
description: Grillian the magician traded a magic ring for this pair of boots. It seems that he lost out on the deal, as they aren't even padded.

name: Red Scarabelt
description: The Scarabelt was worn as an indicator of a warrior's fist-fighting skills. With a Green Scarabelt, your enemy knew you were a beginner. A red one meant that you were a lusty warrior who ate the uncooked internal organs of your enemies just for fun... And the white one indicated that you were really tough. A blue one meant you didn't spend long enough saving up for one of the others.

name: Flooey's Clock
description: Poor Flooey lost his mind after a terrible fight against Many. Fortunately, his amulet didn't suffer. It kept both its mesmerising properties and its laxative powers. Use with moderation.

name: Ring Dikuloos
description: This jewel is not precious but is the perfect size to balance the moorgale in a nice belgroot flavoured with a hint of Glaviooze.

name: Tracon's Boots
description: These heavy square-toed metal boots force Tracon, who knows how to manipulate vibrations, to use all his energy to weaken the waves they give off. If he didn't, you'd be able to feel him coming from kilokametres away. Even worse, they'd stop him from aiming properly during Gobbowl.

name: Gladiapants
description: These Gladiapants, worn on their own, are going to delight powerful and muscular adventurers. Of course, on you, at best they'll look like you're a little bit eccentric and, at worse, a dangerous pervert.

name: Soft Treering
description: This ring is in fact an outgrowth of the Soft Oak, uprooted during a storm. It's now yours, but keep it away from its master as he could decide to take back what's his!

name: White Scarabelt
description: The Scarabelt was worn as an indicator of a warrior's fist-fighting skills. With a Green Scarabelt, your enemy knew you were a beginner. A red one meant that you were a lusty warrior who ate the uncooked internal organs of your enemies just for fun... And the white one indicated that you were really tough. A blue one meant you didn't spend long enough saving up for one of the others.

name: Treeboots
description: You'd get the same effects out of this pair of Boots as you would from an evening at the tavern. You must have a drink, or plenty of drinks, to get the optimum effect. And the next day, your legs will feel as heavy as these boots.

name: Summer Leaf
description: This little brooch is truly lovely. It was made to encourage unlucky people to try their luck at the fun fair, but it's also useful when you go on epic hunting expeditions.

name: Golden Scarabugly Amulet
description: Worn on a hairy torso, this amulet just looks fantastic! Hair tufts are just the perfect match for this amulet.

name: Springy Ring
description: This ring has a different meaning depending on which finger it is worn. For example, on the middle finger, it means you are blossoming.

name: Treecapa
description: With these Treechnid Leaves on, you'll be able to strut about in the forest without being recognised. However, beware of the Treechnids in search of spring buddings.

name: Megabelt
description: This belt has been especially designed to protect the hips of our valuable heroes. Totally useless to you then.

name: Green Scaracape
description: Have you ever dreamt of wearing a cape made of Scaraleaf shells? Well, here's your chance! Once equipped, you should feel as if you were a real Scaraleaf and you might even succeed to slide and skid around. This should be enough to take aback a whole herd of Trools.

name: Blue Scaracape
description: Who's never dreamt of wearing a cloak made of Scareleaf shells? Once equipped, you'll probably believe yourself to be a true Scaraleaf, and maybe you'll manage to move on by way of slipping and skidding. That's enough to take a crowd of Trools aback.

name: Beanie Ring
description: If you find yourself stuck with a tasteless beer or coffee, stick this ring in there for a while.

name: Kubitus's Boots
description: Kubitus was a very versatile Chafer: challenging him from afar meant having to face his great talent in archery, while approaching him within a dozen kametres meant facing a horrible death by suffocation. Just like keeping the same boots for decades may have its advantages.

name: Stroud's Boots
description: These flip-flops are roomy enough for you to be able to pick up kamas with your toes. Their shape is also suited to placing blows in the sacks of your enemies so that you can recover their family jewels more easily.

name: Ronin Chafer Loincloth
description: The Ronin Chafer doesn't need to wear any underwear underneath his loincloth: thanks to his lack of flesh, a glimpse of his coccyx from the front has never shocked a soul. You should probably avoid testing out people's reactions to the same frontal view of your coccyx.

name: Rokwa Headband
description: The headband that you will wear as a Rokwa Pandawushuka is a multi-functional garment. Covering your forehead, it shows oncomers that you are indeed a martial artist; covering your eyes, it allows you to take an afternoon nap without anyone noticing; and covering your mouth, it makes sure you don't talk nonsense.

name: Treechnid Shield
description: When you're hidden behind this shield, some naive adventurers could mistake you for a Treechnid and run off screaming. Most will attack all the more eagerly, thinking they can get some amber out of you.

name: Treechelmet
description: The Treechelmet protects you from hangovers.

name: Crackler Belt
description: Wear it on your waist and you'll gain the respect of your peers. Wear it on your head and you'll be the laughing stock of Astrub.

name: Red Scaracape
description: Who's never dreamt of wearing a cloak made of Scareleaf shells? Once equipped, you'll probably believe yourself to be a true Scaraleaf, and maybe you'll manage to move along by way of slipping and skidding. That's enough to take a crowd of Trools aback.

name: White Scaracape
description: Who's never dreamt of wearing a cloak made of Scareleaf shells? Once equipped, you'll probably believe yourself to be a true Scaraleaf, and maybe you'll manage to move along by way of slipping and skidding. That's enough to take a crowd of Trools aback.

name: Fasstroid Belt
description: With this attractive and delicious belt, the bigger your love handles are, the better!

name: Tracon's Amulet
description: Due to his incredibly sensitive hearing, Tracon removed the main gear from his clock to stop it from making that incessant tick-tock and he now wears it as an amulet. Since then, everyone he meets tells him his clock has stopped, which is not a great improvement on the ticking.

name: Magic Roundabelt
description: They say that if you wear this belt and say the magic words "Time for bed, time for bed" in the most ridiculous voice ever, you'll be transported to a magical world. It'll also make everyone around you point and laugh.

name: Treebelt
description: This belt will increase your self-confidence and give you abs of wood. An anti-Arachnee treatment is nevertheless strongly recommended once a year. It is more or less the same as the hair of a Sadida, but with a lot less anti-parasites.

name: Crobacape
description: Personally I can't think of a better way of impressing the girls at the bus stop than turning yourself into a shadow or even into Lord Crow. This cape will let you do just that. It also makes a great pillow… if you're lucky.

name: Slamdance Bracelet
description: They say this bracelet is shiny, but only when you're in an inn or in the middle of the night.

name: Percimol's Belt
description: You're not really sure if this belt itches or tickles. It doesn't matter though, because unless you wear something underneath it to Captain Chafer's Panty Party, it'll drive you nuts.

name: Boostache's Belt
description: As a child, Boostache loved to play Postman's Knock. He still loves to sneak up on adventurers, stopping abruptly if they turn around, looking as if nothing's going on, then attacking them savagely when he finally reaches them. It might be childish and annoying, but it proves the trick.

name: Gladiaboots
description: These boots will weaken your kicks so you don't hurt your opponent. It's very kind of you, but it won't stop the Gobballs biting your knees off with very little effort.

name: Liche Chain
description: The Liche was a dirty creature known for infiltrating the ranks of valiant warriors in order to steal food. Marmalade and toast was his favourite. But one day, the warriors saw through its little game and the Liche had to run away.

name: Crobak Cloak
description: This cloak, not really nice at first sight, is nevertheless really efficient. Once you get used to the smell of rotting Crobak.

name: Croboots
description: With these boots you'll feel incredibly light and peculiarly ridiculous.

name: Crobak Helmet
description: Thanks to this magnificent helmet, you'll have all the class of the notorious Lord Crow.

name: Vampyre Amulet
description: This amulet is supposed to stop vampyres sucking your blood. The idea is that they're meant to believe you're a vampyre too.

name: Grillian's Amulet
description:
Grillian wore this amulet around his neck when... when...
Oh, what does it matter? He died and now this amulet is yours.

name: Crackler Helmet
description: This helmet, directly hewed in stone, is worth its weight in gold. It will both protect you from the attacks of a Crackrock and allow you to give headbutts worthy of that of Desirock. It's perfect to make your opponents go off their rocker.

name: Grute's Boots
description: Grute's Boots give off such a pungent aroma that you'll be able to knock your opponents out with one quick kick to their head. These boots were forbidden in combat situations by the Sufokia Convention a long time ago, a convention which, it has to be said, has saved many, many lives.

name: Goboff's Ring
description: Goboff the Goblin was a keen gardener. He loved nothing more than whacking trespassers around the head with his rake. He found this ring on the finger of an impudent rambler who'd dared to trample his Babbage leaves.

name: Trav' Ring
description: This ring was made by a famous oriental itinerant, but unfortunately no one could remember his name. He died during an archery contest, putting a Wild Sunflower seed on his head instead of the larger Pumpkin variety.

name: White Scara Helmet
description: Your friends will think that you've joined the elite Scaraleaf hunter clan if you wear this helmet.

name: Eni Kere Miracle Boots
description: Thanks to these homemade boots, Kere was the only Eniripsa ever to win the Great Amakna Triathlon. The Ecaflips thought the second coming was at hand when they saw him skimming along on the Asse Sea... For years afterwards he was harassed by Pandawas begging him to turn their water into wine.

name: Grouillot's Boots
description: Grouillot's stone boots slowed him down terribly in spite of the wings that were attached to him. Nobody has ever really understood why this was the case.

name: Salt 'n' Battery Cape
description: The battery cock whose feathers made this cape fought its killers for several days and nights before finally dying of exhaustion. Let me tell you, killing that crazy chicken nearly finished them off too.

name: Lucky Mulette
description: Mulette was a little female Ecaflip dogged by bad luck... until her grandmother presented her with this amulet.

name: Claw's Jigsaw Amulet
description: A long time ago, an Ecaflip follower called Dodge dropped a valuable treasure map which was carved on stone. He made an amulet of the largest piece, believing he would one day unite the pieces once more. Then he lost the amulet.

name: Red Scara Helmet
description: Your friends will think that you've joined the elite Scaraleaf hunter clan if you wear this helmet.

name: Cape Huccino
description: This cape was made with just one goal in mind: it had to be able to keep its owner awake for a few days running. The results were outstanding! The Cape Huccino is so rigid that it will keep you upright no matter what. Just don't expect to be able to bend over and tie your shoelaces.

name: Boostache's Ring
description: Boostache doesn't care about losing his ring. After all, he doesn't have any fingers! The only thing that matters to him is his moustache. That's quite a treasure you're holding there.

name: Ronin Chafer Kabuto
description: Ronin Chafer bones are black from the hundreds of years spent wandering without a master, guided solely by dark intentions. If you're as black as this Kabuto, however, it's only because you haven't had a wash for ages, you dirty devil.

name: Green Scara Helmet
description: With this helmet on, you'll be able to pretend to be a Scaraleaf hunter.

name: Blue Scara Helmet
description: With this helmet on, your friends will think that you've joined the elite Scaraleaf hunter clan.

name: Ignoah Ring
description: Contrary to common misunderstanding, this ring has nothing to do with the beautiful Karin, whose regular live shows at Sufokia Pirates' Inn raised many a visiting spirit from the dead. The namesake of this jewel is a musician who breeds Tofus in his spare time... so what, you ask. Well, with this ring, it'll sound like there's a dying tofu attached to your finger.

name: Bedazzling Fist
description: This ring is closer to a glove or a mitten than a wedding ring, but who cares, no one will ever shake your hand the same way again.

name: Chisp Fingerless Gloves
description: These fingerless leather gloves are perfect for rainbow coalitions of dancing.

name: Kam Assutra Amulet
description: This amulet gives the wearer special abilities: they will be possessed by a mysterious aura, which flows through their bodies and increases their physical abilities tenfold.

name: Carpet Cape
description: Made of many different fibres, this magnificent cloak is unique - just look at that patchwork of colour and the way the light plays on its surface.

name: Viootifool Boots
description: These boots enabled the famous Jojo to perfect his famous roundhouse kick, which was known as "Hot Red Kick". No one knows where this name comes from since his boots were unmistakably white!

name: Green Scararing
description: When you'll wear this ring, you'll spare a thought for all the Scaraleaves you have wiped out. You then maybe ask yourself if it is worth this slaughter… Yeah, of course it is worth it!

name: Red Scararing
description: When you'll wear this ring, you'll spare a thought for all the Scaraleaves you have wiped out. You then maybe ask yourself if it is worth this slaughter… Yeah, of course it is worth it!

name: Golden Scarabugly Ring
description: Scarabuglies are strange creatures. Born hunchbacked and ugly, they inevitably become the laughing stock of the other Scaraleaves. Maybe that's why you feel so close to this creature.

name: Belugo
description: This belt was made using the leftovers from spools of Flax String. It ties up rubbish bags too.

name: Real Gobbly Glove
description: This battered old glove helps you catch Gobbowl balls, or any other round thing covered in wool, for that matter. What you do with it as result concerns you, and you only…

name: Staypul Ring
description: The metallic pieces on this ring are folded inwards on the inside for maximum comfort. You can use a common stapler and a band of paper to make a similar ring at home for much cheaper, but it's not recommended for non-Sacriers.

name: Cranny Faddocks
description: These boots, made out of leftover soup ingredients, were a gift from Auntie Cranny. Waste not, want not is all very well, but for a couple of days now you've been sure there are maggots crawling around between your toes...

name: Slump Necklace
description: Erala wore this amulet for her entire childhood. No one knows what's inside it, not even her.

name: Tartamulet
description: This amulet will remind you of the happy days, the picnic days, the days before you turned into… this.

name: Slait Ring
description: Adventurers like to collect this kind of rings but no one really knows why.

name: Pair o'Shuplins
description: These shoes are rumoured to have been eaten by a starved gold miner only to be stitched back together when they came out the other end. That must be why they're so shiny.

name: The Chavate
description: This charm is an amulet and a cravat in one, and it'll give you the air of a gentleman even when you're down and out.

name: Lektor's Boots
description: Kanniball Lektor wore these boots for several years before trading them in for a tourist on Moon Island. Look, he was hungry, alright?

name: Fyred Ampe's Ring
description: When it comes into contact with warm, sticky liquids, this ring changes colour, which explains why Fyred Ampe the Dark Miner loved it so much.

name: Fyred Ampe's Belt
description: This belt, reinforced with several different metals, was strong enough to support the weight of Fyred Ampe the Dark Miner's enormous sack. Don't worry, though, it should be just as useful for tiny packets too.

name: Grouillot's Belt
description: Grouillot liked to make his belt speak using his talents as a ventriloquist. No one ever found out how he managed to make the tongue move without using his hands.

name: Kanniball Andchain's Wedding Ring
description: Kanniball Andchain has had many women, each more beautiful that the last. He even went so far as to say that they were delicious. No one knows what has happened to them.

name: Megaboots
description: Roll, the boot owner's lovely sister, specialised in astral taxidermy. Long ago, no one knew the difference between astral taxidermy and regular taxidermy. Nowadays, it's easy to see that astral taxidermy is the involves stuffing astral creatures. If you still can't understand where they went wrong, you obviously don't know just how stupid they were.

name: Black Scarabelt
description: This belt is anything but original… funny, it seems to match your hairdo.

name: Beanie Boots
description: Look what you've done. Just look. Trying to smash coffee cups with your boots… what were you thinking?

name: Slump Rollers
description: These roller skates make it easier to go down stairs but considerably increase the risk of you breaking a few bones. It's up to you to take that risk.

name: Lamechester United Glove
description: With this glove on your hand, you can pretend you're a famous Gobbowl player when you're playing fetch with your Bow Wow.

name: Pynekone Ring
description: Who were you hoping to seduce with a ring like this?

name: Kalkaneus's Amulet
description: In spite of the fact that Kalkaneus only has one arm, one leg and one eye, he's a great hit with the ladies. What you shouldn't tell them is that he didn't actually lose them in combat, he was just born that way.

name: Champo
description: The Champo once belonged to one of the greatest Fungi Masters of Amakna. Valiant and brilliant, Gnion the Boletus was the only one of his race who gained the respect of Human beings.

name: White Scararing
description: When you'll wear this ring, you'll spare a thought for all the Scaraleaves you have wiped out. You then maybe ask yourself if it is worth this slaughter… Yeah, of course it is worth it!

name: Blue Scararing
description: When you'll wear this ring, you'll spare a thought for all the Scaraleaves you have wiped out. You then maybe ask yourself if it is worth this slaughter… Yeah, of course it is worth it!

name: Akwadala Hat
description: From a distance, you'll look like a Pandawushuka from Akwadala Village wearing this hat. Up close, you'll look like an idiot.

name: Slait Boots
description: Slait can now walk on his new wooden floors without scratching them.

name: Amlugo
description: This amulet is meant to protect you from random beheadings, but it increases your chances of dying from a random hanging.

name: Tracon's Belt
description: Tracon's Belt, firmly attached to his stomach by its two straps, acts as a shock absorber. Coupled with his rather cushiony belly, Tracon is completely immune to his own attacks.

name: Bedazzling Boots
description: If you wear these boots when climbing Mount Jifu, you're almost guaranteed to see strange UFO flying across the sky.

name: Koksiks's Boots
description: You should have seen Koksiks go in these boots. A sight to behold he was. Dancing. We danced once, but that was… a long time ago.

name: Goboff's Belt
description: Goboff the Goblin loved to gobble rotten eggs. His digestive tract might have been able to deal with this atrocious habit, but those unlucky enough to get a whiff of his foul breath weren't, and fell like Moskitos.
