Those unlucky enough not to be rendered unconscious immediately would grab onto this belt to stop themselves hitting the floor.

name: Rapiat's Amulet
description: This beautiful amber amulet actually seems to be made of a much less noble material, which explains its foul odour and its low price. But it's the result that counts, right?

name: Modified Dragolyre
description: Thanks to the artisans of Amakna who are multitalented, the Modified Dragolyre is almost perfect.

name: Fire Kwakamulet
description: With all these feathers around your neck, you'll look like Aldo Rado, the great Sacrier adventurer eternally searching for a golden city.

name: Wind Kwakring
description: This ring is so light that it could be blown off by the least gust of wind. But don't expect you'll be taken away with it. At best, you'll be safe, humiliated and on solid ground.

name: Vampyre Mask
description: If nothing else, this mask will protect you from the sun.

name: The Esteban
description: This medallion acts as the key to a mysterious, forgotten city.

name: Lektor's Ring
description: The ring is infused with secret spices, used for flavouring broth when stirred by hand. The spices are so good that once you put the ring on, there's a real risk you'll bite your own fingers off, they'll be that tasty.

name: Kubitus's Belt
description: The bone on the front of Kubitus's Belt is roughly the shape of a coccyx: he thought that by having two pairs of buttocks, he would be more attractive to the fairer sex. In practise, it simply made him look ridiculous.

name: Crocobelt
description: This scaly belt is very trendy and rather powerful but can only be used in certain situations. At the smallest sign of danger its wearer is overcome by an irrepressible desire to snap at everyone around him. Not suitable when in the company of Crocodyls.

name: Fire Kwakring
description: Using this ring, your master may be able to find you if you get lost while delivering a letter.

name: Kokokette Belt
description: This belt almost looks like a loincloth. Very convenient for camouflaging yourself among the Kokokos of Moon Island, or even seducing one of them.

name: Siks Wonn Ein Boots
description: These boots take approximately 12 hours to tie up and slightly longer to get off. That gives you just enough time to get some sleep every day or so, so long as you're single, unemployed, and very good with your hands.

name: Vampyre Belt
description: This belt not only glows in the dark, it also glows in the light, although it's hard to be sure.

name: Real Gobbly Boots
description: These boots have been around for a while, you can certainly smell that. Plant them on your feet and you'll look just like a real Gobbowl player. Plant their crampons in the rump of a few Gobblies, and the fans will come flocking.

name: Lamechester United Boots
description: "Fashionable footwear feeds fascinated fan's frenzy", reads the latest headline, and for once, the papers aren't wrong. When properly polished, these boots help make it look like your opponent pushed you over, when in fact, you slipped. Congratulations! You've just learnt one of the basics of Gobbowl.

name: Goboff's Amulet
description: A popular saying amongst Goblins is "Sometimes you get the bear, sometimes the bear gets you". If you look at Goblins closely, this saying is better summarised as "Sometimes the bear gets you".

name: Kanniball Andchain's Boots
description: Kanniball Andchain only wears these boots when fighting the World of Twelve's most valiant warriors. It'll be a while before you see him wearing them to fight you.

name: Brushdant
description: Tidy your hair up in an instant with this Brushdant, which will enable you to face up to any hair-raising situation. Unfortunately, though, its meagre powers won't ruffle your enemies' hair.

name: Tearjerker
description: Not content to simply terrorise the country folk with his imposing build, Veg Antilleze is the only monster able to instantly make any enemy cry. This hat contains a bit of that power, and it's edible too!

name: Mad Bacon's Scarf
description: Mad Bacon was a little vile demon with the enraging habit of standing right in front of people and not moving. He was magic-proof, which imposed a certain respect at the time. The Mad bacon went underground recently, he stood in front of the wrong guy for the wrong length of time.

name: Ice Kwakamulet
description: With this amulet around your neck, you might fool yourself into thinking people won't smell your breath. No chance!

name: Ice Kwakring
description: Long ago this small ring was much sought after by Enutrofettes who preferred to use it to decorate their toes. An excellent way of hiding their warts.

name: Earth Kwakring
description: Judiciously worn, this ring will make your stubby little fingers look a little longer. Unfortunately for some, it only works on fingers.

name: Chisp Boots
description: Ponch polished his boots every morning before mounting his Dragoturkey and leaving on missions to save widows and orphans. Especially widows. Ponch was quite the charmer.

name: Slugly Amulet
description: This amulet will feed a vorpal slug for two days, or three days if it accompanied by a puree of your head.

name: Grute's Amulet
description: Grute the Bwork wasn't very smart. In fact, he was as thick as two short planks. Fortunately, traditional teaching methods work equally well on Bworks than on children. After a few well-deserved strokes of the cane over the years, Grute became a real little brute.

name: Crocoburio's Spirit
description: This pair of boots apparently belonged to Crocoburio. Only a few people can put them on and they are immediately plunged into a clever, Machiavellian frame of mind. Legend has it that this evil spell is due to the numerous skulls the boots have crushed.

name: Earth Kwakamulet
description: Oto Mustam, the leader of the Brakmar warriors, wore this small amulet long ago... though only at the organised orgies of Brakmar. They say it doubled as a leash!

name: Wind Kwakamulet
description: When the wind blows in its feathers, the Wind Kwak feels as free as an eagle, gliding like a dead leaf carried by a gust of wind. In spite of the clumsy description, it really is quite impressive.

name: Vampyre Ring
description: This ring spent three years in a pool of Borbat guano. It's still magic, though.

name: Koksiks's Belt
description: Koksiks the Chafer Foot Soldier was a very talented fellow. I remember how we used to sit down around the fire after a long day of fighting, and he would take his mandolin and just play beautiful songs, such beautiful songs... just staring into the fire together... Anyway. That's all over now.

name: Pirate Amulet
description: Many sailors have been impressed by this terrifying amulet. All you have to do is put it on and you'll be a feared warrior.

name: Akwadala Cloak
description: This cloak comes from Akwadala. It can be used as a doormat or even as a floorcloth if you've just come out of water.

name: Vampyre Cape
description:
Bram was right after all: you should watch out for grown men who prance around with makeup and long, flowing capes.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Lektor's Amulet
description: When the two small balls attached to this amulet collide, they produce a slight rattling noise, which means a Kanniball is very close by. When you hear this noise, it is usually too late to escape, but there is still time to choose which sauce you want to be devoured with.

name: Nyanskin Boots
description: These boots will give you the excuse you've been looking for to smell your feet.

name: Klime's Boots
description: According to the legend, these boots were secretly replaced by another pair, which though defective, were ultra-powerful; they were made by a clumsy, overworked shoemaker.

name: Palid Emblem
description: This is an extremely useful amulet, but it turns its wearer as white as a Gobball.

name: The Vegete Hative
description: Some incredibly light equipment that finally brings a little delicacy into the cruel world of the Bwork.

name: Wind Kwakelt
description: "The only way to catch an upset old male Wind Kwak is to dress up as an upset female Wind Kwak. Then, the male will try to understand why the female is upset and will try every possible means to satisfy her. Once the male is satisfied with his performance, you should take advantage of his beatitude to fleece him." This is what one can read in part twelve of book three on Wind Kwak hunting. Besides, it is clearly specified that this belt is an essential element to pass yourself off as a female Wind Kwak. You know what you have to do now.

name: Wind Kwak Headdress
description: To keep your hair streaming in the wind even with a headdress, there's nothing like this lovely Wind Kwak Headdress which will certainly enable you to give free rein to your hair in most circumstances. It is enough to take the most blasé of Chafers aback.

name: Akwadala Belt
description: Pandawas from Akwadala always watch their figure. If you tighten this belt as much as possible, you should finally get some results with your flabby belly problem.

name: Solaris Ring
description: This ring was found in a mysterious city where nobody knew of its existence until they began frantically searching for it.

name: Fyred Ampe's Boots
description: The soles of these magic boots allow you to shatter lumps of coal by vibrating at its resonant frequency (look it up). The user guide indicates that they will even vibrate on their own when Slamdance music is played nearby.

name: Kubitus's Amulet
description: This unique amulet, once animated by the same magic as that of Livitinems, insisted on calling Kubitus "Ulna". The latter, exasperated, finally muted it by tearing off its jaw.

name: Stroud's Belt
description: You can tuck your family jewels safely into this belt's two enormous sacks.

name: Ice Kwape
description: Ideal for keeping cool in those hot summers on Moon Island, as well as ideal to cool down the advances of your more eager paramours, this cape will satisfy all the needs of the modern adventurer.

name: Ice Kwak Headdress
description: This Ice Kwak headdress will keep your head full of fresh and brilliant ideas. And before you say anything, it doesn't work on Iops.

name: Ice Kwakelt
description: Ideal for toning your hips, this belt will allow you to keep cool below the belt too.

name: Wind Kwape
description: Light and refined, this creation is also used as a curtain by the most destitute in the region. Mummy Nova herself used to wear this as an evening dress.

name: Siks Wonn Ein Belt
description: The Achilles heel isn't always below the knees, you know. Sometimes it's just below the waist. In that case, this heavy but effective belt will give all those wieners among you peace of mind and sackfulls of confidence.

name: Noke's Necklace
description: This boar-tooth necklace will terrify boars, and by extension, your mother-in-law.

name: Stroy Zemol's Boots
description: Stroy Zemol made these boots himself, from a few blocks of wood and a little bit of fabric. They might not look like other boots, but blimey, they're certainly magical nevertheless.

name: Boostache's Cape
description: This cape, like Boostache, glows in the dark. As a result, it will have you failing every single attempt at breaking in to your ex-girlfriend's house, will stop you sleeping at night, and will annoy every single one of your guildmates. Just what you need to spice up your dull existence.

name: Snarmulet
description: Strangely, whichever jeweller created this hairy amulet, with a rat nose and ears growing out of it, systematically refused to sign it. You can't really blame them.

name: Winged Boots
description: These boots are made from different parts of Crobak Corpses. The wearer has a strange feeling of nimbleness comparable to that given by the traditional flying potion made with grilled boletus.

name: Mushd Cloak
description: It's a strange cloak made of pieces of Mushd which are very much all of one piece. And you can give the one who is laughing a piece of his mind.

name: Fire Kwape
description: This cloak won't make you fly but it will itch like hell. Even if you sew a big "S" on it, it won't work... though some people a few years ago on a cliff were absolutely convinced of it. Too bad.

name: Fire Kwakelt
description: This Belt is perfect to strut about like a Fire Kwak during the season of love. Provided, of course, that it's the only thing you're wearing.

name: Slugo
description: These slippers are more comfortable than your average footwear, but it's hard to say why… perhaps the parasites that infest them massage your feet.

name: Koksiks's Ring
description: This ring belonged to Koksiks himself, and a lovely ring it is too. He let me have it once... but took it back some months later. Ahh. When I think of it now…

name: Rapiat's Boots
description: Rapiat manufactured these boots himself, without it costing him a kama. The same can't be said of two of his fellows, for who it cost their lives.

name: My Little Boots
description: These little boots will make a cute clip-clopping sound when you move. This will often by followed by a heavy "BOOM" when you fall onto the ground because these tough, round boots really aren't good for your balance.

name: Fire Kwak Headdress
description: The Fire Kwak Headdress will make a real charmer out of you... Charm is the second best way of sidelining your enemies in the heat of combat... The other is raw, unpackaged, unapproved-by-the-FDA LUST. Let me tell you, though, with the beasts that wander round these parts, you'll feel like a big of cheese in a Bonta rat trap if you take the latter approach.

name: Earth Kwape
description: Ideal for camouflaging yourself as a lump of earth, this cloak will help you attack ploughmen by surprise and steal their treasures. It is for this reason that collectors of ancient pottery covet it so fiercely.

name: Earth Kwakelt
description: The Earth Kwak is not very social and is especially hunted for its feathers, as everybody knows. If you wear this belt around your hips, you'll have the Earth Kwak hunters thinking you're an over the hill Kwak. Sometimes appearances can be truer than reality.

name: Earth Kwak Headdress
description: This Earth Kwak headdress is so heavy it'll always keep your feet on the ground. If the ground happens to be soft, well, it'll keep your chin on the ground.

name: Akwadala Amulet
description: The only people allowed to wear this amulet were the inhabitants of the village of Akwadala, as it was considered to be one of the most important parts of their traditional costume. Seen close up, you have to ask yourself why.

name: Vampyre Boots
description: They say that Countess Bathory herself used to wear these boots. Knowing her, they should be nice and soft… just hope there aren't too many pimples on them.

name: Toot's Belt
description: Gobbowl matches are brutal, and this belt was designed to protect players from muscular blows. However, you can also use it as a life-belt when you're taking a bath. Who'd have thought?

name: Monty's Belt
description: They say that Gobbowl is a game for real men. This belt's for real men too, with plenty of protective padding to soften low blows. It's also great for training young Srams.

name: Stroy Zemol's Amulet
description: Stroy Zemol had a sister, Faye Pworme. She liked travelling alone and exploring dark, foul-smelling tunnels.

name: Primitive Chafer Boots
description: The tailor that created these boots thought he was making them for the Ronin Chafer. He obviously thought you looked primitive enough already.

name: Vegamu
description: The Vegamu attracts swarms of Moskitos that mistake it for one of their friends. They are always disappointed when they see this character.

name: Ice Kwakoboots
description: As perfect as ice-skates on frozen lakes, these boots are very useful for keeping your feet cool, or storing your flask. Recommendations? Don't put them by the fire to dry, you'll never see them again.

name: Hat Ariutokinabot
description: Thanks to this warrior hat, Iops really cut a fine figure. The only problem is that it hides some of their field of vision and prevents them from hearing their opponents' words. This hat is designed for those who like to strike before they think.
stats: Increases the Divine Sword spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Vitality spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Pressure spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Destructive Sword spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Cleaver spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Pounding spell
Increases the Destructive Ring spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Prosecution can be cast per turn by 1

name: The Godfather's Ring
description: This heavy ring will give more power to your slaps and more passion to your caresses…

name: Slamdance Shoes
description: The headspinners among you will have very little use for these shoes, but if you use your feet from time to time, they're just what you need.

name: Stroy Zemol's Belt
description: This belt is allegedly reversible, only no one's ever dared try it as they don't want to be the first to discover that it isn't actually reversible.

name: Doggona Rope
description: This belt was given to Goultard by his father for his 5th birthday. It is more solid than its appearance suggests, and will keep your trousers snugly around your hips. It can also be used as a washing line, or even a skipping rope.

name: Kalkaneus's Pants
description: No one knows what special power keeps Kalkaneus's pants from falling off his bony little legs. A few people have an idea but no one has ever wanted to check.

name: Monarch Belt
description: If this belt is big, it's only to contain all the extra weight the King of Bonta has put on during his reign. At least you won't feel restricted in it!

name: Dragorace Boots
description: The rockets installed on these boots can have two entirely different purposes: either they allow you to snatch a narrow victory thanks to the acceleration they provide, or they will transform your Dragoturkey into roast meat if you lose the race.

name: Seasandals
description: To make the most of summer, why not show off your feet? They're just asking to get a tan!

name: Crackler Shield
description: This stone shield is, in fact, made from a Crackler's head, smashed by the foot of a Minotoror. A perfect combination of big head and smelly feet.

name: The Celestial Brooch
description: People say the famous blacksmith Boulgur made this brooch. Yes, the guy who created weapons for the gods.

name: Moskito Ambamulet
description: Wearing a necklace with a Moskito encased in amber will show your opponents you're a fearsome hunter of Moskitos! Unless you're still a toddler, that's got to be embarrassing.

name: Vegadgear
description: The MUST-HAVE item, but only in the North-East of Amakna.

name: Bambulet
description: This ridiculous little piece of bamboo has got strange magical powers. It used to be carried by young Pandawas, once they'd been through puberty. You might want to wait a while before you start wearing it round your neck…

name: Hat Tsokey
description: Every time an opponent comes to face this headgear, he turns as silent as the grave. No one dares ask what it is supposed to be. But that's ok, Srams aren't known for their sensitivity.
stats: Increases the Mass Trap spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Furrow spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Chakra Concentration spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Shakedown spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Perquisition spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Fragmentation Trap can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Pitfall spell's maximum range by 1

name: Hat Wisholdoo
description: Thanks to this hat, Eniripsas always know how to deal with emergencies. Indeed, all the first aid tips are discreetly written on the lining. It makes them look as if they just graduated even though no one would normally wear such a ridiculous hat even for a school ceremony!
stats: Increases the Selective Word spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Frightening Word spell's maximum range by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Wounding Word spell
Reduces the Impartial Word spell's AP cost by 1
Slighting Word is no longer linear
Increases the Seductive Word spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Regenerating Word spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Regenerating Mark spell's maximum range by 2

name: Diving Bell End
description: With this diving bell on your head you might look a little bit silly, to say the least. Your new friends will probably feel a little uncomfortable around you and avoid looking you in the eye.
stats: Increases the Pilfer spell's maximum range by 2
Harpooner no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Scaphander spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Backwash can be cast per target by 1
Increases the Scuttle spell's maximum range by 2
Trawler no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Armour-Plating spell's maximum range by 3
Increases the Surge spell's maximum range by 2

name: Nut Helmet
description: Has anyone ever told you you have a brain the size of a peanut? Well, with this helmet you'll finally have enough protection for it to come out of its shell.

name: Fundamental Headdress
description: Emanating a chromatic light with sumptuous colours, this headdress reacts to its wearer's power by modulating the intensity of its glow.
stats: Reduces the Runification spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Storm spell's cooldown period by 1
Makes the Burning Stroke spell's range modifiable
Increases the Ether spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Manifestation spell's AP cost by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Stinger spell
Increases the maximum number of times Tectonic Breach can be cast per turn by 1

name: Ringtree
description: The branch of a Treechnid isn't easy to carve, but with some perseverance you'll get a simple and stylish ring. Simple and stylish like a sleeping Osamodas.

name: Fire Kwakoboots
description: With those Fire Kwak spurs on, every Sram for miles around will be on your back.

name: Satisfied Summoner's Ring
description: This ring is an improved version of the celebrated Ring of Satisfaction. It's ideal if you want to step out of the blood-red spotlight of dangerous battle.

name: Hatter Lily
description: This hat looks like the Sulik and the Paperb' Hat. But since it's very comfy and Xelors never take it off - even when they sleep, it is commonly called Hatter Lily. It gives off a nice pleasant white water lily smell which helps you get to sleep. However, it also provokes snores as unbearable as the Toads' song during the mating season.
stats: Reduces the Haziness spell's AP cost by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Dark Ray spell
Reduces the Rewind spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Slow Down spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Conservation spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Reflect spell's AP cost by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Shadowy Beam spell
Increases the Souvenir spell's maximum range by 1

name: Cool Hood
description: Thanks to this headgear, you'll really look like a horny beast. People will turn round to admire the huge pair on your head. This roomy hood can also keep food fresh like hay for Gobballs or bread for Tofus.
stats: Increases the Fossil spell's maximum range by 2
Natural Defence no longer requires a line of sight
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Dragon's Breath spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Geyser spell
Increases the Sedimentation spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the maximum number of times Dragon Heart can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Second spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Aquaculture spell's maximum range by 1

name: Helmet Hicc
description: This helmet can make wearers make promises they instantly forget. Is it because it exerts pressure on the part of the brain which deals with memory or language? No one truly knows. What matters is to only take into account the less extravagant words.
stats: Reduces the Pandiniuras spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Terror can be cast per target by 1
15 Damage on the spell: Blazing Fist
10 Damage on the spell: Alcoholic Breath
Increases the Stretcher spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Consolation can be cast per turn by 1
Makes the Burning Circle spell's range modifiable
Increases the Numbness spell's maximum range by 1

name: Pynekone Belt
description: This belt is composed of scales arranged spirally in accordance with the Vibronacci suite.

name: Shallot Shawl
description: This cape - 100% organic, like the rest of Veg Antilleze's gear - has a peculiar smell which naturally repels all manner of enemies.

name: Krosmetic Mask
description: It's hard to understand the use of this mask if you haven't used an Eliotrope portal before. Even if you have used one, it's still hard to understand what the mask is for... But at least you can use it to hide your face, and that must be a godsend for someone with a face like yours.
stats: Neutral no longer requires a line of sight
Increases the Insult spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Distribution spell's cooldown period by 1
Makes the Wakfu Ray spell's range modifiable
Increases the maximum number of times Interruption can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Contempt can be cast per turn by 1
Reduces the Diffusion spell's cooldown period by 1
Makes the Lazybeam spell's range modifiable

name: Hunter Belt
description: Decorated with Crocodyl teeth as sharp as a Sword of Iop, this belt will make you look like a seasoned old hunter that you'd rather not mess with.

name: Monarch Torque
description: Many Bontarians think that the Monarch's beard is made of gold, but it's really just his Torque riding up a bit.

name: Treecloak
description: This magnificent cloak is a clever mix of Treechnid essence and nice familial Gobball.

name: Earth Kwakoboots
description: "Nothing's better for the feet than a pair of Earth Kwakoboots" said Rola Ingalsse, the famous ploughwoman. Soon after she somehow shovelled a giant clod of earth into her own eyes and was blind for ever more.

name: Cap Rayer
description: The sharpened points coming out of this cap not only enable you to hurt your enemy but also increase your chances of being struck on the head by lightning during a storm. Indeed, Sacriers are a class who love to hurt others as much as themselves. A nice smell of grilled meat: nothing's better to start your day!
stats: Increases the Stase spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Dissolution spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Punishment spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Attraction spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Mutilation spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Perfusion spell's maximum range by 1
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Absorption spell
Increases the Slaughter spell's maximum range by 1

name: Sthood
description: This hood can be used to fend off the bad weather, but it's also great for cooking. It allows you to regulate the strength of a flame with a tip of the head. Now you know why Enutrofs have such muscular necks.
stats: Reduces the Fortune spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Pandora's Box spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Prime of Life spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Opportuneness can be cast per turn by 1
Increases the Toolbox spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Reducing Key spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Armlock can be cast per turn by 1

name: Lousy Ring
description: This ring will turn you into a Lousy Pig, which should satisfy your closest friends.

name: Kokokoboots
description: "Tap dancing or butt kicking, the choice is yours!" You can finally say goodbye to this old dilemma, thanks to these marvelous boots that protect your feet without skipping a beat…ing.

name: Redroz Belt
description: This belt, which protects its wearer’s intimate parts, was designed specifically for Redroz supporters, since they’re known for starting brawls in Gobbowl stadiums.

name: Helmeteo
description: It's said that once they're decked out in this hat, some old Ouginaks can predict changes in the weather – in the next ten seconds.
stats: Reduces the Prey spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Watchdog spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Ulna spell's maximum range by 3
Increases the maximum number of times Venison can be cast per turn by 1
Jaw no longer requires a line of sight
Stripping no longer requires a line of sight

name: Treering
description: This ring, made of Treechnid Bark, has great powers but carries great responsibility with it. However, in spite of its value, it is said to be cursed.

name: Adventurer Bag
description: It's the ideal bag for holding all your bread and potions when you go away for several months... into the labyrinth for example.

name: Crocoburio's Strength
description: The powers given to this ring by the Dark Breath of Grougalorasalar are now considerably weakened. This relic was intended for Crocoburio, the only one capable of mastering it without being dominated himself.

name: Arachnamu
description: This small Arachnee is the proof that you don't have to stuff an animal to turn it into an amulet. It will tickle your neck and might even spin a web in front of your mouth if you yawn too much or talk too much rubbish.

name: Wind Kwakoboots
description: Basic but efficient, these surprisingly light boots are sometimes used as wind socks. Listen carefully though... People who find themselves downwind of this improvised apparatus often die.

name: Cap Ricott
description: Given its name, you'd think this cap would be a nice orange colour. Well, not at all! Moreover, this fashion accessory is more of a mask than a hat. So why did its creators name it this way? To make curious people talk, of course!
stats: Paralysing Poison no longer requires a line of sight
Soothing Bramble no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Transmuted Sacrificed spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Proximity Poison spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Sacrificial Doll spell's cooldown period by 1
Increases the Repotting spell's maximum range by 2
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Rise of Sap spell

name: Robbie Hoodie Cap
description: Robbie Hood was a famous Cra who lived in the woods. This explains the camouflage green colour of the cap. He wanted to take the law into his own hands and spent all his time stealing money from the rich for a good cause: himself!
stats: Reduces the Distant Shooting spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Frozen Arrow can be cast per target by 1
Increases the maximum number of times Immobilising Arrow can be cast per target by 1
Reduces the Atonement Arrow spell's AP cost by 1
Reduces the Absolute Acuteness spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Paralysing Arrow spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Assailing Arrow spell's maximum range by 1
25% Critical Hit bonus on the Redemption Arrow spell

name: Zinda Hood
description: Fecas increase their luck, as well as that of their allies when they wear this hat. If you've hired a Feca who's wearing the Zinda Hood, you're sure to arrive safely and almost without a scratch. The problem is, it smells so foul that it's only useful for protecting widows and orphans.
stats: Reduces the Barricade spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Natural Attack spell's maximum range by 2
Reduces the Aggressive Glyph spell's AP cost by 1
Blindness no longer requires a line of sight
Natural Attraction is no longer linear
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Fulminating Glyph spell
20% Critical Hit bonus on the Dazzling spell
Reduces the Pavise spell's cooldown period by 1

name: The Godfather's Polished Oxfords
description: These shoes are very shiny even when they’re worn out. They’re perfect for impressing your opponents when they get them right in their faces.

name: Grute's Belt
description: Those who have had to face Grute the Bwork will tell you, "Don't bother aiming for the head, it's empty". This advice also applies to all those who face Iops, Goblins or mothers-in-law.

name: Hoodwink Headgear
description: The skull drawn on Rogues' headscarves allows them to pretend to be dead in order to take dimwitted enemies such as Tofus and Iops by surprise. Be warned, though: undesirable side effects have been reported by people wearing the scarves in cemetaries during the Chafer mating season.
stats: Explobomb no longer requires a line of sight
Reduces the Roguery spell's cooldown period by 1
Reduces the Magnet spell's AP cost by 1
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Deception spell
Increases the Latent Explobomb spell's maximum range by 2
Increases the Stolen Goods spell's maximum range by 1
Reduces the Bunker spell's cooldown period by 1
Makes the Crossing spell's range modifiable

name: Arpone Mask
description: The Arpone Mask, which is based on the Stinkshop Mask, smells less strong but is unfortunately less powerful as well. That's why it's best used alongside other equipment - why not try it with the Misu Tiara?
stats: Reduces the Martelo spell's AP cost by 1
Increases the Coward Mask spell's maximum range by 1
Makes the Bling spell's range modifiable
15% Critical Hit bonus on the Furia spell
Increases the Parafuso spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Cavalcade spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Scudo spell's maximum range by 1
Increases the Poltroon Mask spell's maximum range by 1

name: Monarch Boots
description: Gold like the sun, these shiny boots blind all the King's loyal followers who kneel at his feet.

name: Dragorace Belt
description: In an accident, this belt will protect you from injuries just as much as a set of your briefs worn as a helmet would.

name: Magma Belt
description: This belt is used as part of many diets, due to its ability to burn fat without its wearer lifting so much as a finger.

name: Lymph a Tik Boots
description: Wearing these boots, you'll feel like you're walking on fresh grass. Their particular niche is the bio-conservative Hyuppie demographic.

name: Rapiat's Belt
description: To this belt's great misfortune, Rapiat's only guilty pleasure were the breads of Danioul Garnioul the Baker. He was actually the only one to continue eating them after learning they were kneaded with the feet, saying that was what gave them their unique aftertaste.

name: Chase Boots
description: With these boots, Hogmeiser used to chase off the only human beings he couldn't stand the sight of: children. Fortunately for them, the weight of the footwear prevented him from ever catching a single one.

name: Kalkaneus's Boots
description: Kalkaneus only has one leg, so it follows that he only wears one of his boots. If you wear it, and nothing else, you'll look just like him, without the need to summon him to be sure!

name: Krabelt
description: Finally a good excuse to smell of the sea!

name: Slugly Boots
description: The soles of these boots are covered with a sticky slime and the interior is filled with a slippery slime. At least it's not the other way round.

name: Dark Miner Amulet
description: Your only chance to survive in a mine infested with Dark Miners is to have light. Since you'll never manage to steal one of their precious candles, just wear this amulet... at least it'll bring you some luck.

name: Lardine Belt
description: This little cork-screw shaped tail will bring out the jealousy of the people around you.

name: Thunderbracelet
description: Only adventurers of a certain age will understand why the symbol on this bracelet is of a cat's paw, whereas the rest of these items seem to be linked to rats. Sneaky as they are, they're keeping quiet about it. Or are they senile already?

name: Peace
description: This pendant will make you feel at peace with the World.

name: Prespic Ring
description: This ring, both simple and original, will seduce adventurers who long for the good things in life but could never afford them. The kind who would beat the daylights out of helpless animals and strip them of anything that seemed to be of any value. There's no shortage of them, believe me.

name: Slamdance Belt
description: This belt has an incredibly powerful built-in magnet that keeps it shut without a buckle. Not recommended for wear with lead undergarments.

name: Royal Guard Boots
description: The wings on these boots are the symbol of the city you protect, but also a reminder of the Bonta guard's oath: "Go, run, fly and flee."

name: Gobkool Boots
description: Stuffed with Gobkool wool, these boots are just fantastic. Light and warm for the cold season and cool for the hot one, they will please even the pickiest of adventurers.

name: Match Cape
description: Appreciate a good match? Like to strike it lucky? Then this cape is made for you! Just make sure you don't rub against any rough surfaces, or you may find it goes up in smoke.

name: Tarsy's Boots
description: Tarsy the hermit quite obviously couldn't stand visitors. Any guests who did dare come along quickly left with nothing but a big, red boot mark on their back.

name: Royal Guard Belt
description: As the King's close guard, you must be prepared for any eventuality. Even getting hit in your sensitive bits.

name: Gobkool Ring
description: This ring will enable you to cause even more pain when doling out those well-deserved spankings to your little darlings.

name: Oxo Boots
description: Don't forget to put these boots on when you have your heads in the clouds, they'll keep you high. Even though they're cool, don't wear them to go dancing if you want to keep your feet on the ground.

name: Silicate Amulet
description: Silicate made this amulet on a wintry morning for a famous adventurer named Rimb Vardi, who was hunting down an old Bwork Magus. The bungling magic that followed was the root of many a natural disaster.

name: Oxo Belt
description: This belt is perfect when you need to rest and digest your granny's Oxo Bucco.

name: Brave's Dark Dora
description: Brave the Ghost was the first one to use Dark Wicker in fields other than gastronomy.

name: Lorko Kasko
description: This hat of enchanted bark once belonged to Lorko, a lumberjack. He challenged the renowned Brouce Boulgoure to an Elm uprooting duel in Liroye Merline.

name: Oxo Ring
description: This ring used to belong to the Oxon King. He liked to play with the sunbeams reflecting on the ring and used to say "Watch out for the Oxon Laser!'"

name: Raya Bean's Nights
description: Raya Bean thought he knew how to make friends. He often invited complete strangers to fancy-dress balls and bought them dinner, champagne and magnificent jewels. His conversation, in contrast, was paltry and extremely monotonous...

name: Prespic Cloak
description: This reddish small cloak can be also used as a rug or doormat so that you can redecorate the house on the cheap.

name: Akwadala Wedding Ring
description: This Wedding Ring comes from Akwadala Village. Closer to a lucky charm than a magic relic, you'll still be able to make your friends believe you've found your soul mate.

name: Gobkool Belt
description: Wrapped around your hips, this belt will give you the appearance of a peace-loving adventurer. This enables you to surprise your enemies with a dagger in their back.

name: Pearl Amulet
description: Worn around the neck, this pearl is a beautiful jewel. And a nice way to recycle an earring if you've lost one half of the pair.

name: Eachure Hat
description: With this hat made from Chafer Lancer Leather Briefs, the female Bwork Magi won't be able to resist you. That's not a good thing, mind - many are known to wear long, red beards and none are known for their femininity.

name: Mad Tofu Cloak
description: With this handmade cloak of Tofu Feathers, you will be able to run faster and escape from tackle zones with the grace of a shotgun-blasted pigeon.

name: Soff Ring
description: This small modest-looking ring was created by Degun. He was more famous for shouting his head off without the slightest reason and his violent aversion to the Liche than for his talent as a jeweller.

name: Ramoune the Eternal
description: Ramoune was a childhood friend of the sunny Nova. When Ramoune decided to put his spotless mind at rest for an eternal nap, he put an end to their friendship.

name: Ring of Death
description: This ring is also known as the Black Band, but in spite of its two names, it remains unfinished. Even so, it's powerful enough to destroy a small planet.

name: Tinkly Bell Ring
description: If, while cleaning this ring, you notice a golden dust coming off it, think happy thoughts; perhaps you'll be able to fly, as if by magic…

name: Dora
description: This magical hat, which looks like an upside-down wicker fruit basket, is in fact... a magical upside-down fruit basket hat. It will certainly impress the neighbours, especially if they are Bwork Magus apprentices.

name: Maimpa Cloak
description: Maimpa, an Ecaflip who wasn't afraid of heights... he thought he'd always land on his feet. One day, he landed on a starving Trool and was buried the same day on the very spot where his remains were found... Well, the spot where the biggest pieces were found.

name: Prespwig
description: With this Prespwig on, you'll look like Debbie Crockett, the most celebrated huntress of the modern age, but a tragic victim of premature baldness. That's not to say that this rat-bitten, off-red wig is any better than a balding nut.

name: The Bear
description: The Bear is a hat made from a head of a dead bear. Its fur is still silky and warm. The tailor who made it must have been really skilled to keep the look of terror on the dead bear's face.

name: Frost Belt
description: This belt cools the hips, nearby organs and ardour of all those who dare to wear it. To be given to your most stubborn suitors.

name: Chafer Foot Soldier's Shield
description: This is the Chafer Foot Soldier's last line of defence against getting his bones rattled in a fight.

name: Somoon Fisherman Amulet
description: Fishing a Somoon is quite a miracle but don't worry, with this amulet around your neck, there's no such word as "can't".

name: Akwadala Geta
description: These wooden Geta were made by the best shoemaker in the village of Akwadala. Let your warts take a breath of fresh air and enjoy the landscape.

name: Cape Hillary
description: Hairdressers use the Cape Hillary to tie up their hair. Will you?

name: Arachnee Ambamulet
description: Wearing an amber Arachnee around your neck when attacking one of its sisters can be enough to disconcert it. Poor bug. It's what we call the "irony of fate".

name: Crocoburio's Power
description: Grougalorasalar loved collecting the bone fragments of his most fearsome enemies. His affection for Crocoburio inspired the creation of this ultra-powerful belt.

name: Larvhat
description: You finally have the chance to look like a real larva. You will be able to openly show the World your larval lifestyle.

name: Shako
description: This bone helmet has been in a Kaniger's pocket for many years. Worn and scratched it might be, but its properties are as powerful as ever.

name: Clementine Boots
description: The soles of these boots are made from the tough skin of fruit harvested on an island whose very existence remains unknown to mere mortals.

name: Maj'Hic Cloak
description: This cloak looks ordinary... but isn't. It can make its wearer invisible to the eyes of those who are not looking at him. Really impressive!

name: Beezers
description: The little wings attached to these slippers will give smelly feet some fresh air… But be careful, don't use them to play Gobbowl… Gobballs may not particularly like getting stung on the arse…

name: Deulegarnoulle Amulet
description: This amulet comes from the Nordic regions. It will increase your summoning powers.

name: Prespic Belt
description: The Prespic Belt is the ideal belt for keeping your hips warm. It itches like hell, though… you wanna be hard to wear this one!

name: Phong Huss's Ring
description: Fungi generally have collars, but Phong Huss preferred rings, possibly so that he could boast about having fingers.

name: Tot's Belt
description: If you ever work out how to get this incredible item around your waist, you'll be one of the luckiest heroes in the universe. It used to belong to the strongest and most attractive of the bearded heroes of old.

name: Chogreloting Cheeken Cloak
description: This magnificent cloak was made with the feathers of the very last Cheeken of Amakna. It's a real rarity that collectors dream of hanging on their living room wall.

name: Mad Boowolf Cloak
description: This cloak was made of hairs and other organic elements taken from various Boowolves… You can smell its power from here.

name: Sortingat Hogwat
description: The Sortingat Hogwat comes from a famous School of Magic. This lively creature has met the greatest wizards of our time, like Mrs Magoa AlaGale, Mr Doublegore and the renowned Misk'arry Rotter.

name: Larvaboots
description: You probably never dreamt of putting your feet right inside the guts of a Larva… But here is your chance… Seize it!

name: The Black Crow's Ring
description: There's nothing unusual about a bird being ringed!

name: Frost Boots
description: Heavy and stiff, these boots don't look particularly special, but their icy sole will have you ice-skating without the need for ice. Of course, you'll need to find a surface covered with ice-skate blades, but in these crazy times, that shouldn't be too difficult.

name: Minot'Horn
description: With this Minotoror Horn hat, you'll have no problem passing yourself off as a Minotoror if your confidence in your own powers is failing. This trickery only works on simple-minded creatures such as Iops and Tofus.

name: Badoul's Amulet
description: Dodge brought meaning to his life by smashing, burning, grinding, selling... no, sorry not selling... ehh... throwing away, spitting on... everything he owned. And you should see what he did to his kamas. My Lord, I know they're only a moulded piece of copper, but still, I pity those poor coins.

name: Eastern Wood Belt
description: The sling of this belt is tightly tied to it, so tightly tied that you won't be able to take it off. It will only impress highwayboys you'll meet.

name: The Black Crow's Boots
description: Like the rest of the Black Crow set, this pair of boots has been passed down, foot to foot, through the generations. That explains the strong smell of Clakoss.

name: Ektope's Amulet
description: This ghost's amulet must be extremely powerful, if one believes the legends about ghosts, that is.

name: Ektope's Ring
description: It's a well-known fact that real ghosts don't have fingers. So how were they able to wear this ring?

name: Clementine Amulet
description: If you dip this amulet into your glass, your tasteless water will be transformed into a delicious, citrus-flavoured beverage.

name: Dragolyre
description: Made of Dreggon remains, this splendid amulet is impressive enough to make your bravest enemies run home sobbing.

name: Bud
description: This heart-warming, sun-kissed little thing lends a feeling of invulnerability to the wearer. It's also so light that many wear it for years on end, day in and day out, around the clock.

name: Phong Huss's Boots
description: The feet of fungi are rarely very clean - they are often covered with mycelium. Phong Huss's feet were no exception to this rule and he took care to hide them with his boots. They don't smell particularly good, but they are well suited for growing mushrooms. Which of your stomach or your nose will win?

name: Stellia's Glove
description: Stellia never takes off her gloves, given her tendency to get her hands dirty.

name: Royal Gobball Headgear
description: The Royal Gobball Headgear will never go out of fashion. Besides being elegant, the bearer gains Strength and Intelligence.

name: Plunder's Boots
description: The soles of these boots are so spongy that they absorb sewer sludge and release it each time you place your foot on the ground. As you can imagine, it's quite handy if you ever need to retrace your steps.

name: Ektope's Belt
description: A drunken Captain Haddock'n'roll once stumbled into Ektope leaving a party at the Ripate Inn. "Ectoplasm on skates!" he exclaimed. Poor Captain Haddock'n'roll, the alcohol was playing tricks on him, Ektope has never had any skates.

name: Gulliver
description: This hat is so original that you will soon think you're fantastic, unique and on top of the World. It is said that in bygone days, Rakmar Bilgout used it to charm the queen of the Gobballs. He didn't hesitate to cut her throat open afterwards... Nothing to do with the hat I hope.

name: Cape Rice
description: This cloak increases your range, allowing distant targets to be attacked... or naive adventurers to be dumbfounded into unsuspecting admiration. Haha!

name: Wild Banisation Belt
description: An improved model of the standard version, the Wild Banisation Belt has been specially reinforced with hunting Wild Dragoturkeys in mind.

name: Holy Medal
description: Holy was a female Iop, intent on spreading Evil throughout the land. Renowned for her incredible composure, she would never get angry except when people compared her to someone named Oly.

name: Lahilama Medal
description: Lahilama was a great spiritual guide who kept his temple right in the heart of the mountains. He was so bored that he spent his days sewing little yellow hats for his disciples. They just had nothing to talk about. They all slowly went mad years of awkward conversation.

name: Plunder's Belt
description: Plunder hung his booty from this belt. You can make out a small valve on the inside. This valve allows the belt to be inflated, transforming it into a buoy. An essential item when venturing into the sewers.

name: Power Belt
description: This Power Belt will render you particularly powerful during fights but its weight will considerably decrease your Agility.

name: Plunder's Amulet
description: This amulet was specially designed not to get stuck in Plunder's neck hairs, so you can wear it without fear under your armpit or even keep it in your hand.

name: Solo's Ring
description: Solo was a nice good-for-nothing, and he admitted as much himself. That didn't stop him from being hanged on the village square for stealing a thong belonging to the chief's wife. Solo wasn't a bright guy, no, but he was a nice guy all the same.

name: Watchdog Amulet
description: "Did you see that bo...?" Such were the last words of Patsy VeDross the Iop to her friend Jon Drumpf while visiting the Ouginak Temple. Nobody ever figured out if she was talking about the big bone that she had just noticed, or the watchdog guarding it.

name: Royal Gobball's Ring
description: This ring increases life, just like the smell of Royal Gobball it gives off increases its charm.

name: Gobbowl Ring
description: You can use this ring to puncture the Gobbowl Ball when you want to quietly enjoy a break in play.

name: Watchdog Belt
description: Like all Bow Wows, you now have the right to wag your tail in public without worrying about reprisals from the vice squad.

name: Enutrof's Memento
description: These rings were cooled from the forge with the tears of Enutrof, shed over his lost shovel. Must have been some shovel!

name: Toady
description: This hat comes in red and white and is so classy, you'll be invited to all the best parties in town. If you see the Ambassador, as you soon surely will, don't forget to thank him in the traditional way: "Ambassador, you're really spoiling us with these..."

name: Eastern Wood Boots
description: The spurs on these boots will enable you to cut up your Dragoturkey when you decide it's time to eat it.

name: Bobblering
description: You can wear this ring as a toe ring if you need to snuff out your foot odour.

name: Bigoks Belt
description: This belt, which bears a picture of the reward earned by the Gobbowl World Cup winners, will let you gloat excessively to the other teams’ supporters by giving you an air of superiority and snobbery.

name: Zalblaks Belt
description: These skin-tight shorts will make you look like a strong athlete with an untamed spirit, ready to jump on anything that moves. Just like a real Zalblak!

name: Dazzling Belt
description: This magnificent belt increases AP, as well as Vitality and Wisdom.

name: Xelor's Past
description: Rings forged during Xelor's temporal journeys.

name: Royal Gobball's Belt
description: This magnificent belt increases your Vitality and conveniently carries loads of items. It's so soft that you can even use it to bind your lady-love hand and foot when she refuses to stay home.

name: Patent Lousy Pig Shoes
description: These small shoes have been reinforced, repaired and deodorised. They are often used to trap Mush Mush since the substratum left out by the Lousy Pig seems appetising to them…

name: Pilbocks Hat
description: This brand new, magical, Green Larva Skin hat gives its bearer a jolly appearance... jolly but incredibly stupid. We can't always get what we want and this hat is a perfect example.

name: Cape of Good Hope
description: The magic effects of this cape are often overestimated, which inevitably causes heavy losses in adventurers, such as the notorious minstrel Jon Lemon.

name: Crystalline Ring
description: This ring will make your finger radiant.

name: Greenengol Belt
description: Not many fans go as far as wearing a belt with their favourite teams colours. That's what separates the true fans from the cheerleaders.

name: Greenengol Amulet
description: This discreet amulet is great for timid fans or fans who aren't completely confident in their favourite team: it's easy to hide if your favourite team bombs.

name: Bigoks Boots
description: These boots are the cause of your favourite team’s speediness, and are just as useful for racing to victory as fleeing from a thrashing.

name: Redroz Boots
description: These racing boots are prickly as a rose and will help you cover great distances both horizontally and vertically, thanks to the spikes fastened securely to the front.

name: Marline's Boots
description: Avoid wearing these boots if you're planning on trying out for a Gobbowl Ball team. You might end up flailing around lamentably.

name: Bowisse's Shield
description: This shield is a tribute to Bowisse's Cloak, which itself was a tribute to a famous relic composed of three triangular shapes. Blimey, all this history is putting me to sleep.

name: Kritter
description: This demon skull, constructed from various bones, gives its bearer a graceful and elegant look. Even your lover will be sick with envy.

name: Dispenser of Justice Cloak
description: This cloak can only be worn by the great dispensers of justice... It's not very popular.

name: Phong Huss's Belt
description: Phong Huss wore this belt somewhat sloppily. He tried to wear it as a shoulder strap so he could sheath his sword in it. The belt pinched his nipples on multiple occasions, but other than that, was of no use whatsoever.

name: Pamus Boots
description: ‘It’s a bird... It’s a plane... No, it’s a Pamu!’ is the slogan that every loyal Pamus supporter yells when a member of their team scores.

name: The Bibelaw
description: Law-bibe was an old man who took whatever came to hand to create strange, strange items. One day, he made a locket with scrap off the street. He put it round his neck, and felt a strange sensation. A very strange sensation.

name: Royal Gobboots
description: They shine, they radiate power, they are fit for a king! Three cheers.

name: Cruella Sandals
description: These Sandals belonged to the Macians, an Ouginak tribe. They were so close to the Pandawas that, as the generations passed by, their fur slowly changed colour, becoming white speckled with black. One day, they were all killed by a horrible woman who wanted to make a coat out of them.

name: Improved Helmet
description: In theory, this helmet should keep your wig on your head if you decide to go ride a Scaraleaf. Simply priceless!

name: Improved Wooden Wings
description: These improved wooden wings have been padded and made lighter thanks to feathers and high-quality fabric. Since the frame is still in wood, it will be hard not to crash!

name: Prespic Skin Boots
description: A pair of splendid walking boots tanned in Brakmar.

name: Stellia's Boots
description: Stellia is a big-time shoe collector, but she's not really a big fan of variety. So this is the only type of shoe in her collection. She has over 9,000 pairs of them.

name: Zalblaks Boots
description: Running swifter than the swiftest wild animals, Zalblaks owe part of their fame to these splendid boots, made especially for racing.

name: Pamus Belt
description: This belt falls somewhere between a kilt and a championship belt. It has been worn by countless generations of Pamus supporters. Honour your team and be the next in line!

name: Ecalisor
description: A long time ago, King Allister gave this ring to Isidor, a smart cat, renowned for his incomparable Agility.

name: Shika Amulet
description: This amulet allowed Shika Ingalsse to survive on several occasions when furious Gobballs, bent on making her life a misery, attacked her.

name: Vampire Cloak
description: Marinated in pure blood for many long years, this cloak has acquired a ruby red colour that is very pleasing to the eye. This cloak is much favoured during the Al Howin's Day celebrations.

name: Gobbowl Helmet
description: They say sticks and stones may break your bones, but names will never hurt you. With this helmet on, you'll certainly challenge that misconception…

name: Kabbala
description: A mysterious symbol of a mysterious organisation... by the way, it doesn't exist and you've never heard of it, understand?

name: Royal Gobball's Cape
description: On top of being classy, this cape, worn by the great Royal Gobball, inspires the wearer with incredible strength.

name: Banisation Belt
description: The shoemaker who created this belt using the leftovers of a Dragoturkey certainly didn't think too hard about the name.

name: Gobbowl Boots
description: These boots were specially designed to destroy your opponents' shin pads, and then their shins, and then your own toes.

name: Stellia's Mask
description: With this mask in your hands, you can understand Stellia's reputation a little better: it's reinforced to make head-butts all the more deadly.

name: Banana Cape
description: Is that a Banana Cape in your pocket or are you just pleased to see me?

name: Pin of Mhete
description: With this near-perfect pin, you'll have the Wisdom of an Irish salmon. It's great for group therapy sessions among friends. Don't forget to bring some tissues, though, it can get emotional!

name: Royal Gobball's Amulet
description: This amulet increases Strength and Intelligence.

name: The Cruncher
description: Xof the Fox created this belt after he inexplicably decided to gather up all the teeth he could find on a Wabbit battlefield. It has now become a lifelong passion of his.

name: Fame
description: This powerful amulet will certainly make a name for you.

name: Concentration Boots
description: These boots are so comfortable that they instantly increase your concentration.

name: Comfleecy Belt
description: Jiva recommends this belt for those long, cold waking nights. If stained, hand wash with Rimennelle.

name: Stamina Belt
description: This simple belt increases stamina.

name: Larvabag
description: This plain bag used to be very fashionable a very long time ago. It is the best example of your ancestors' bad taste.

name: Iop's Crushers
description: These boots are perfect for that special coup de grace.

name: Celerity Belt
description: Designed by Tengra Reufrus, this aerodynamic belt will make you as nimble as a Tofu and as windy as the breeze. Or is it the opposite?

name: Bobblamulet
description: This amulet can be used as a bib for both the young and the old.

name: Jouik Krampe
description: This magnificent leather mask once belonged to Jouik Krampe, cousin of Zeurg. They were both fond of tight leather clothes. A bit like Captain Chafer, only not as depraved.

name: Warrior Fecalizer
description: This ring can protect you from weak magic attacks... In practise, from infantile monsters with something to prove.

name: Spicy Belt
description: The magical powers of this magnificent red belt will help you concentrate better and learn quicker. Some Iops even manage to hobble to the end of the alphabet before their ignorant lives are extinguished.

name: Larvamulet
description: With this Larva head round your neck, you look like Stive Irween, the famous modern-day larva tamer.

name: Tofu Cloak
description: This weird cloak has been cut in half. But why would somebody cut it in half? No one knows… though everybody has his own little idea about it.

name: Magus Fecalizer
description: This ring can protect you from weak magic attacks... In practise, from infantile monsters with something to prove.

name: Silimelle's Wedding Ring
description: This magnificent wedding ring was stolen from Silimelle, a female brewer, during a boozy meal at the inn. See what happens when you accept drinks from strangers?

name: Goblimp Hat
description: Wear this hat and your head will be sound as a bell!

name: Mer Ring
description: This ring once belonged to Mer, the laziest piece of stuff in Amakna. He worshipped doughnuts and ribs…

name: Tea Ring
description: This ring has proven its worth, as shown by the little mark made on the inside. It is a unique creation made by a jeweller apprentice for an important test. It is made from a standard iron ring plunged into a magic Tea solution.

name: Goblimp Coat
description: This coat is quite a paradox. You put it on to stop shivering, but the cold metal of the bells which hang off it here and there brush against you unexpectedly as they jingle, which makes you shiver even more.

name: Sponghield
description: This porous but absorbent yellow shield was made from the remains of a creature who used to live in a Pineapi Mask at the bottom of the sea.

name: Goblimp Furry Underpants
description: These underpants will keep your manhood safe and warm. Plus, the strategically-placed bells will let everyone know you've got a thing for the young lady who just walked past.

name: Goblimp Bracelet
description: The Goblimps have turned this baby rattle into a magnificent bracelet. If you shake it hard enough, you might be able to cover the Astrubian tourists' wailing.

name: Faillette Boots
description: Attack is the best defence. With these anti-aggression boots, you will easily send muggers packing. And those guys who come up to you at crossroads to clean your mount's teeth.

name: Crab Amulet
description: This delicate but original whitish amulet is made of Crab.

name: Crystal O'Ball
description: Hung 'Short Memory' Lekahurse owned a magnificent crystal ball - his grandpa gave it to him. He wisely decided to hold on to it for the rest of his life. In fact, he put it on his hat which he never took off again, until one day, a jealous breeze took it away. He followed, and the breeze seemed to mock him, suspending the hat in the air, and whipping it away just as his searching fist approached. Not without a sense of decency, the wind took him home for a brief visit once a season and when it sensed the poor man was close to the end, took him to the edge of a cliff, hung the hat there for a moment and down Lekahurse tumbled, at peace at last.

name: The Gobb
description: The Gobb increases damage and Vitality, but it gives off a nasty odour, too. Don't be surprised if the Gobballs think you're one of the gang.

name: Helmetofu
description: This safety helmet became a very fashionable item that every pretty lady adventurer should have. What's wrong in this World?

name: Understanding
description: This pendant will make you grant you greater understanding of the World around you.

name: Tofu Slippers
description: Light and soft, these slippers are warm in winter and cool in summer. Unfortunately, they can't stand being washed in washing machines.

name: Swashbucloak
description: According to what people say, this legendary cloak makes you almost invisible when combined with the fencers' legendary sword, the Dart Onion, and to the legendary hat of the Six Rams of the Rahk Shepherds.

name: Lumberjack Amulet
description: This amulet, made exclusively of precious wood, is highly prized and loved by lumberjacks who usually exaggerate its abilities to offset the cost of the material.

name: Boar Hooves
description: These are the perfect boots for splashing around in the mud or making big dents in an expensive hardwood floor. It's forbidden to wear them on dance floors, beaches and in saunas.

name: The Oiram
description: The Oiram has many fans throughout the World who just love its classy look. This hat once belonged to a plumber who spent his days cleaning pipes. He was quite stylish himself.

name: Poak Cloak
description: The legendary Poak Cloak was specially embroidered for warriors who live for close combat situations.

name: Tofu Amulet
description: As light as a Tofu feather, this amulet can be worn around your neck or around your forehead if you want to be original.

name: Father Kwismas Hat
description: This hat will hide the scars all over your head. That way, no more toddlers will be injured trying to flee in terror from your Santa stall.

name: Pippin
description: This amulet is said to be a modified version of the Golden Destiny... which is really strange when you think that these two amulets have nothing in common except their ridiculous appearance.

name: Fisherman Amulet
description: This amulet, set with fish scales, is supposed to bring its wearer good luck when he puts out to sea on stormy nights.

name: The Troma
description: The Troma is as shady as an eraserhead made of Bherb hairs, and that's saying something (if you don't know what an eraserhead made of Bherb hairs looks like, refer to the great books of the Hen Pens).

name: Skill Boots
description: Skill Boots increase Agility and Intelligence to the detriment of your Strength and Chance. Contrary to what many people believe, they won't defeat your opponent for you.

name: Anticipation Boots
description: Anticipation Boots increase Strength and Agility to the detriment of your Intelligence and Chance. Contrary to what many people believe, they won't allow you to anticipate your enemy's next moves.

name: Tofu Belt
description: This belt is the ideal tool for strangling Tofus, but hunters also use it to whip any adventurers who stray onto their land in hunting season. Probably best not to mess with the hunters - they have a history of jumping the gun, shooting first and asking questions later.

name: Itou Lascione Cape
description: This superb cloak once belonged to the Great Stratequerre. This renowned and expert strategist lord of war, hungry for the universe conquest, soon gave up his plans after having arrayed himself in the cloak. Really strange!

name: Mos Kitano
description: This is such a light ring that your hands can perform acrobatic feats when it's on. It's also quite useful if you want to humiliate somebody smaller than you by smashing their head with your thumb.

name: Tofu Ring
description: This ridiculously small ring can end up being essential… your enemies might pity you so much they'll finish you off instead of letting you agonize. Let's be positive!

name: Pointed Hat
description: Everyone will want this magnificent hat when you go the masked ball, hey hey!

name: Pumpkwin
description: A distinctive feature of the Pumpkwin is that it prevents the dispersion of magic particles, making it a good magic insulator. That's why some warriors use this vegetable as headgear.

name: Helmet
description: Wearing this hat creates a very special look, halfway between ridiculous and comical.

name: Sponge Helmet
description: Instructions: "Offer this helmet to your husband. Firmly attach it to his head and drag him by his feet around your kitchen. You now have a clean, shining floor. Be careful not to drown him when rinsing the helmet off." This sums up the state of the modern marriage. Bloody feminists.

name: Zest Ring
description: If your water becomes tasteless, just stick this ring on your finger, stick your finger in the glass and vigorously stir it in until it falls off. There you go! A delicious blood orange and lemon mixture… and one finger less. You can't have it all, you know.

name: Gobboots
description: These are the most comfortable boots ever created. The inside seems to be padded with Gobball Wool and you can feel a liquid running through your toes. For all you know, it could be Gobball Saliva... even Blood. Whatever!

name: Bearman's Wedding Ring
description: The Bearman has vowed never to take off this wedding ring in memory of his dead wife... the besotted groom summoned a bear to impress his newly-wed love. She went to give it a hug... the summoned bear, raised by a distant father and an abusive mother, thought she was trying to beat him... you can guess the rest... The most tragic thing about this story is that Bearman hadn't made a single payment on the ring. Man, that has to hurt!

name: Gobkool Amulet
description: This Amulet was worn by adventurers who said they wanted to make tea, not war. Each to their own.

name: Karnaval Boots
description: These boots were designed to make the Too-Faux Karnaval as pleasurable as possible. Just make sure your toenail polish matches the colour of the PVC, or else your feet will be plastered all over the 'fashion fail' pages of the bumper Karnaval edition of Krosmopolitan. Cringe!

name: Invisible Hat
description: A very practical head covering to make sure everyone can see your fantastic follicles or lack thereof. As you may have guessed, this hat is for exhibitionists and adventurers with no inhibitions.

name: Bowisse's Cloak
description: This cloak is an often underestimated one-of-a-kind. It is made of Green Larva Skin, giving it a most pleasant, rugged appearance.

name: Wooden Wings
description: For those who have always dreamt of flying like a Kwak, go back to bed because these wings will turn you into a public menace and an idiot.

name: Gobball Headgear
description: This magnificent headgear increases Strength and Intelligence... if you can stand the smell.

name: Gobball Cape
description: This cape was designed to please - it's hard-wearing and comfortable, it looks classy, and it's a good step up from a Novice Cloak. But it smells dreadful and plays merry hell with your nostrils. Well, what do you expect? You can't have it all.

name: Bearman's Cloak
description: This beautiful cloak has been worn for years by the famous Bearman. It won't turn you into a bear, but you will be able to rival the greatest of fighters.

name: Bearman's Belt
description: This little bear hair-covered belt will hide your love handles perfectly. You should wear it always to avoid disappointing your beloved.

name: Sponge Ring
description: Offered as a wedding ring, this ring sends two subliminal messages to the wearer: "I love you" and "Go do the dishes". Perfect for those who hate wasting their time repeating the same things over and over again.

name: Sponge Belt
description: This belt allowed Vald to take his seasonal bath without putting his life in danger. Indeed, no Iop ever succeeded in learning so much as the doggy paddle.

name: Slob Headgear
description: Besides its has-been look, the Slob Headgear is great for those high-noon duels... keeps some sun out of your eyes.

name: Ecaflip's Luck
description: This ring was made to increase its wearers luck during card games.

name: Staca Noviste's Rucksack
description: Legend whispers of a miner who worked continuously for several months in 4 different mines simultaneously, raising a family in the process and running a successful one-man printing press with his feet. Ah, the Hammer-Sickle newspaper has been hard at work again.

name: Bouze Lite Yeah's Ring
description: This ring once belonged to the renowned Bouze Lite Yeah, the saviour of the modern age. He never stopped going on about some place he used to drink called the Inn 'Finity and Beyond'.

name: Bearman's Headgear
description: This strange headgear used to belong to the notorious Bearman. Sewn from the remains of the head of a decomposing bear, the headgear will itself turn heads thanks to the unmistakable whiff-trace that follows you wherever you go.

name: Bearman's Boots
description: These boots are lined with bear fur: even the coldest-blooded creatures will have toasty warm feet.

name: Bearman's Necklace
description: The Bearman was wearing this necklace around his neck when he faced the hooligans of Bimdhul's lair. Legend has it that the amulet saved him, but on close inspection, you can see why it's just a legend.

name: Farmer Amulet
description: This amulet smells of Wild Sunflower oil and herbs. You can use it as a lure to trap dangerous rummagers... like Gobballs, or your mother-in-law.

name: Farmer Beltudas
description: With its complementary pair of linen Bermuda shorts attached, the Beltudas is simply a must have. This belt is designed for those who need to get their clothes off in a heartbeat and burst into action just as fast. Be careful though. For reasons of hygiene, it is forbidden to wear it in public swimming pools... we don't want a repeat of the Bonta incident... I almost lost my sight that time.

name: Sponge Amulet
description: This amulet is often mistaken for a lucky-bag gift... It's actually something you win at the shooting range.

name: Sponge Boots
description: With these boots, Eniripsas can walk on water... which is quite useless since they can fly anyway, but it always impresses the crowds. Normal folk can always use these boots to exfoliate their feet while they sit around the house.

name: Sponge Cape
description: This cape is perfect for camouflaging yourself in the natural environment. Well, it's more like you'll be adding a pleasant touch to the countryside, but hey, who wants to be invisible anyway?

name: Cheeky Bag
description: With this bag slung at a jaunty angle over your shoulder, you'll be able to muck about while still keeping that charming smile on your face, you cheeky little monkey!

name: Invisible Cape
description: A cape specially designed for those who like to hide their cape? Now I've seen it all... or at least I would, if I could see it...

name: Gobball Shield
description: Although it's all but useless, its stench alone will spread your fame far and wide. This shield accompanies many young adventurers on their first quests – maybe that's why so few make it to thirty.

name: Invisible Shield
description: This shield won't protect you from ridicule.

name: Large Harvester Bag
description:
This bag has been designed to hold many collectible resources.
Only true harvesters can carry it.

name: Gobball Amulet
description: A fine piece of Gobball horn, this. The material is known for bringing peace and wisdom to these tranquil beasts, so a Gobball Amulet should bring peace and wisdom too. Although since you murdered the poor thing to get it, maybe the opposite will happen. Who knows.

name: Gobball Belt
description: Easy to wear, this belt is quite light in relation to its size. The wool looks brand new... according to the legend, about a hundred Gobballs had to be cut to pieces to get this smooth and silky look.

name: Karnaval Belt
description: This flouncy skirt will change colours slightly when you shake your hips. As cool as that might sound, you should probably only do it at home in front of the mirror. As usual, there's a fine line indeed between 'twerk' and 'twerp'.

name: Silver Dofus
description: Created by Ratathrosk, the grey dragon, this egg is an enigma. It may not be as powerful as a Primordial Dofus, but it seems older than time… You'd do well to guard it closely. After all, only the Norrai and the god Xelor know what the future holds.
stats: At the start of the caster's turn, if they have less than 20% of their HP, they are healed by 20% of their HP.
This effect can only be played once per fight.

name: Farmer Sunhat
description: If you need protection from the sun while working in the fields, what you really need is a Slob Headgear. If you need protection from the sun while working in the fields and you're poor, the famous Farmer Sunhat will have to do.

name: Farmer Boots
description: These boots are padded with wheat straw, absorbing perspiration and allowing the portable and low-cost cultivation of toxic mushrooms. Thanks to their soft sole, they've been recommended by all the great Gobbowl players.

name: Father Kwismas Cape
description: This mysterious cape only comes out once a year, but the scammers always use it to get a fast kama from the kiddies.

name: Captain Chafer Amulet
description: Some say the Chafer is sensitive and distinguished, because his amulet carries the skulls of his dead cousins. Others say he's a beastly creature, because it was he who killed them.

name: Boar Ring
description: This ring used to be fixed on the legs of rutting boars so that breeders could easily recognise them. Today, you are the one wearing the ring. You can take from with what you wish.

name: Boar Belt
description: Hairy but elegant, this belt should remind you of your lady-love.

name: Blubba Ring
description: This ring is made for tearful novices. It also symbolises some ancient, unspeakable traditions. It's made for you! Perfect.

name: Dark Cloak
description: This cloak increases Wisdom.

name: Farmer Bag
description: This bag is very fashionable among school kids and is ideal for storing animal and vegetable flours. Once opened, unfolded and torn along the seams, you'll be able to use this bag as a skirt, just shave those legs, for Iop's sake.

name: Ano Rak Ring
description: According to some legends, this ring protects against bad weather. In reality, this has never been proven because it has never rained in Amakna.

name: Gangster Ring
description: This ring is as popular with dentists as it is with gangsters. They both use it to break the teeth of careless people... They both use similar drills too, but let's not dwell on that.

name: The Gougnole
description: The Gougnole is made of a moon stone that was marinated for 5,000 years in a barrel of beer. This has inevitably endowed it with terrific powers.

name: Korko Klako
description: The Korko Klako is a beautifo hato worno by the mo handso Sadido.

name: Blo'up Belt
description: This belt is the weapon of choice for crowd control in Amakna prison and at the annual town fair.

name: Cape Ability
description: This cape has been made with infinite care and attention, it allows the wearer to find the enemy's weak point.

name: Omelette Amulet
description: The Osamodas Onehaieuf Bek craved the respect of his guild members, so he decided to create a revolutionary Amulet. He found inspiration one morning while making some breakfast for his friends… Okaaaay!

name: Redness Cloak
description: This cloak increases life.

name: Power Boots
description: Power Boots increase Strength and Chance to the detriment of your Intelligence and Agility. Contrary to what many people believe, they won't bring you incredible power.

name: Lars Amulet
description: This amulet used to belong to the great robber "Thisme" who was famous for his limitless cruelty and idiotic death. A central figure of Eniripsa folklore, he was crushed and drowned to death in an olive press having just come out of jail after a 30-year sentence for the theft of a giant walnut.
