name: Small Moskito Schoolbag
description: Made out of Moskito skin and wings, this bag used to be a big fad in schools. Today, it is old-fashioned and has been replaced by the Crocodyl Chief Schoolbag. I don't get it – one, a Crocodyl Chief Schoolbag is much more expensive and two, it's HORRIBLE. Kids these days.

name: Field Amulet
description: This small amulet blooms in spring, dries out in summer, fades in autumn, and goes rotten in winter. An ideal opportunity to change your style with the passing seasons.

name: Harvester Bag
description:
This bag has been designed to hold collectible resources.
Only true harvesters can carry it.

name: Moskito Amulet
description: This small amulet is not as effective as the famous Arachnamu. It certainly looks good, though... To be worn on a bare, hairy chest for a great jewel-in-the-roughage look.

name: Sacrier's Wound
description: It is said that this ring emerged out of a Sacrier's grinning, pus-stuffed wound. Niiice.

name: Hozuki Lampulet
description: The name of this amulet is unpronounceable in the language of the country where it is manufactured, for non-natives, anyway. To make it more appealing to the Amaknian market, its designer used the services of a local translator, a certain Lou Gull, to help him come up with a new name. When the designer saw how much Lou Gull charged for his services, he used a cheaper translator instead. Evidently, you get what you pay for.

name: Robber Belt
description: This beautiful belt is essential you if you ever decide to become a highwayman. Don't wear it round town, though, you'll be arrested on sight.

name: Ringer
description: The main function of this pretty ring was to help Osamodas recognise their Tofus during fights.

name: Country Ring
description: With this little ring on your finger, you'll be able to walk through fields in the countryside. What do you mean you can do that already? Wow!

name: Moskabuto
description: This headgear takes its name from the eccentric Enutrof who discovered it while stripping a sick old Moskito for all it had. Extremely useful for inexperienced adventurers, this headgear will help you seduce famished Arachnees.

name: Ellinie Cloak
description: This light cloak comes from the Patitalian Country, a place where people communicate with their limbs. This explains the incredible lightness and complete freedom of movement given by the cloak.

name: Gobtrotter
description: These Goblin skin boots were created by Planbworksek to charge the enemy (if possible from behind) extremely quickly. These boots saved many a Bwork comrade in wartime.

name: Wild Boots
description: If you're looking for something to trample those flowers growing in your fields, these boots are just the ticket. Your feet mightn't smell so bad with them on. It's a shame they don't come as shorts too.

name: Cape Ulais
description: Coming from the Mount Taigue, this cape ended up poisoning its former female owner... Strangely enough, if you wear it, it will increase your resistance.

name: Sin Cape
description: A certain Mulba used this item to carry half her kitchen with her on a long, difficult quest to find the Seven Crystal Hens which fell from the stars. This cloak will make you strong and brave.

name: Mental Ring
description: This ring slightly increases intelligence.

name: Florheadgear
description: If you have always dreamt of being a florist and having rose-scented breath, it's time for you to put this strange headgear on.

name: Nhanor Kibrill Chain
description: The creator of this chain, someone called Ken Aton, was renowned for his strange habits. He spent all his time hunting the Minotoror for his coat which he wanted to make into a merkin.

name: Purple Cloak
description: If you're planning to go to one of those eternally popular BABA theme-nights, this cloak is just what you need.

name: Pocket Belt
description: This belt has small pockets allowing you to stock more items in your inventory.

name: Flowery Belt
description: With this petal-peppered belt around your waist, you can slip out of a nasty situation while your enemies roll around the ground laughing. This will take care of the most war-weary Chafer army, and instantly reverse the situation to your advantage.

name: Mush Mush Ring
description: The Mush Mush has a reputation for being a nasty piece of work. He'll pester and bite you at every opportunity, and he's very moody. I was married to someone like that once... Smelled like mushrooms too.

name: Yellow Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried yellow Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Green Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Purple Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: Kardorim's Helmet
description: Now you can re-enact your favourite operas in the comfort of your own home!

name: Adventurer Hat
description: This hat is not really useful for anything... it does scare the boys away quite nicely though.

name: Kardorim's Bracelet
description: Made from Chafer bone, this magnificent bracelet will protect your wrist from sword blows looking to cut it, all while building your muscles. A very valuable item for beginners like you.

name: Instant Calm Amulet
description: An excellent copy of the work done by Polma Kartnay, the silversmith's apprentice. This reproduction surpasses the original.

name: Pink Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Blue Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Red Piwi Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll look ridiculous but you'll be just adorable. Life is a matter of choices.

name: Golden Destiny
description: The Golden Destiny will considerably increase your Vitality and Agility.

name: Valuable Ring
description: This ring increases Strength and Chance.

name: Klime's Boots
description: These boots gave Klime the shoemaker such agility that he was able to ride Gobballs. He died when he mistook a Jelly for a Gobball, having spent an evening drinking in the tavern.

name: Satisfaction Boots
description: These boots are a dramatic improvement on even the most carefully crafted footwear. Comfortable and light, they promise consistent pedal satisfaction with every wear. At the sight of this pair, even your opponent will give a faintly happy, wistfully envious smile.

name: Musheadgear
description: Before the prohibition, Musheadgear was smoked or drunk as tea. This headgear really has it all.

name: Farmer Moth-Eaten Mittens
description: These moth-eaten mittens are a real treasure. They're said to be covered with diamond dust which gives them extraordinary resistance. They are also abrasive on one side, perfect for putting the finishing touches to that latest DIY project.

name: Kardorim's Cape
description: By wearing this cape, you can make the Incarnam Chafers think you're their captain. Too bad they don't have eyes to see it.

name: Arachnobelt
description: Made from the rotting remains of decaying Arachnees, you'll just love this belt. From time to time, it might come back to life and greedily bite you on the hips. Bloody thing!

name: Pink Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: The Soft Calf
description: José Bovey was a Mastogob shepherd. Mastogobs are a distant cousin of the Gobballs. Some of his Mastogob troop had a softer fleece than the others, and he sold these fleeces for more money. To distinguish between animals, he attached this necklace around their necks.

name: Mush Mush Wedding Ring
description: When a Mush Mush gets married, he gives this wedding ring to his bride. Since the bride has no arms, the ring is put delicately on one of its thorns. If you get hold of this ring, you will forever break the sacred bond between the two creatures. At best, the Mush Mush will take you as his bride to make up for it, and just remember, Mush Mushes spend their whole lives where the sun don't shine.

name: Yellow Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Blue Piwi Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll look ridiculous but you'll be just adorable. Life is a matter of choices.

name: The Red Cape
description: The red cape is the favourite artefact of megalomaniacs. Once on their frail shoulders, they believe they are Superman or an ultra-powerful magician. Until they meet a Minotoror at least.

name: Adventurer Boots
description: These standard boots are popular with young folk of adventurous spirit.

name: Mush Mush Cloak
description: The only thing more impressive than a livid Mush Mush is a livid Mush Mush in a cloak. Indeed, this particular cloak is the embodiment of a certain kind of ultra-powerful clothing... pretty ugly clothing if you ask me.

name: Pandawushu Cloak
description: This cloak is essential if you want to practise the art of Pandawushu.

name: Rocky Ring
description: A ring set with a rare stone. Do I need to explain the name?

name: Red Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried red Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Green Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Purple Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Small Adventurer Bag
description: This bag is ideal for those who never wander far from home but take useless things with them when they do. Like Ash Planks for example.

name: Adventurer Belt
description: A small belt for budding adventurers.

name: Green Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: Purple Piwi Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll look ridiculous but you'll be just adorable. Life is a matter of choices.

name: Pacmaboots
description: These boots are capable of engulfing anything you kick with them. A kick in the danglies with a pair of Pacmaboots is every male adventurer's worst nightmare.

name: Black Quakhoop
description: No one knows exactly where this ring came from; all we know is that it fell off the end of a Quakane during a particularly vigorous fight against the Bworkette.

name: Yellow Quakhoop
description: This ring is given annually as a prize to the first imbecile to dress as a Tofoone, head into the Eltneg Wood and come out alive. Due to a recent change in rules, being in one piece is also required.

name: Domestisash
description: Numerous adventurers are ready to sell their parents, sacrifice their families and eat their mount to see, even for a moment, what lies under this belt...

name: Akornaddikt Balaclava
description: Nobody knows why, but the moment you pull on this balaclava, you are filled with an insatiable hunger for acorns. Chomp!

name: Akornaddikt Amulet
description: This amulet, which was made out of an Akornaddikt tail, is so soft and fluffy that you can't stop stroking yourself with it. That's normal, right?

name: Khan Karkass's Briefs
description: Wearing these briefs won't make you a Gobbowl champion, but they'll sure show off your goods.

name: Pandawushuka Apprentice Headband
description: This headband marks the first step towards becoming a Pandawushuka. Patience and self-control are the qualities needed for the long apprenticeship before you.

name: Pink Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Tetra Amulet
description: Unlike the Tetra Cloak or Hammer, this Amulet always faces the same way no matter how much you turn around. Make sure you don't get a stiff neck!

name: Spacevader Ring
description: This ring used to be the seal of an army general from a faraway country who wanted to invade Amakna. He didn't prove too much of a problem to his enemies due to his tactical errors. Essentially, his troops moved side to side as one big group, only advancing very slowly, instead of just moving forward in a straight line. This made them the easiest targets that Allister's Army had ever fought against.

name: Pongbelt
description: The ball between the Pongbelt's two bands moves around the belt all the time, constantly kneading your love handles. In short, it's quite ridiculous, kind of unpleasant and definitely not glamorous. But they say it helps you lose weight, so you should give it a shot at least.

name: Teemulet
description: This amulet is commonly worn by zoologists in the spring. Its pleasant fragrance wafts into their nostrils and helps them to put up with the horrific stench when they study the mating habits of Lousy Pigs. Yup, zoologists are voyeurs!

name: White Ninjamulet
description: The White Ninja is extremely superficial and superstitious. He paid a fortune for this amulet to protect him from bad spells, but it only protects him from having too many kamas.

name: Black Ninjamulet
description: The Black Ninja's amulet holds dark and terrible powers, remnant of ancient times, which according to the legend are powerful enough to kill even a god. The only problem is that the method of accessing those powers has long since been forgotten, which explains the amulet's cheap price.

name: Makisash
description: More practical than dried rations, and less cumbersome than hunting gear, this belt is still used during certain Pandikaze operations.

name: Noh Boots
description: These boots are indispensable during traditional theatre performances. They're used by the security guards to give a swift kick in the rear to disrespectful patrons while they're being shown the door.

name: Lilotte's Necklace
description: A very fashionable accessory, this necklace set with small gold-plated bones will be all the rage, especially if you go walking in the Sidimote Moors.

name: Barking M'hat
description: It doesn't take much to make you look like an Ouginak. Watch out for fleas.

name: Tetra Ring
description: This magic ring, if you should let it drop, will only slow down its fall by landing on its head.

name: Pongulet
description: The amulet around your neck is a miniature version of the original Pongulet, which was as tall and wide as a Treechnid. After a number of broken necks and a lukewarm response from critics, its creator decided to make a portable version, which was a great success.

name: Cheekirdle
description: Your little cheeks have never known comfort like this. But beware of strangers; one of them might belong to the bizarre panty-raider cult. If that's the case, they won't hesitate to beat you senseless until you disrobe and hand over the goods. So take some advice: watch your behind!

name: Airmikes
description: They say the messenger Airmees could fly using the prototype of these boots. Amakna shoemakers, on guard against potential abuses since the incident involving Klime's overpowered boots, decided to nerf these boots before marketing them.

name: Bandita
description: Giving this ring to someone you desire is a simple, effective, and not overly-expensive means to an end. It doesn't seem to work too well with Enutrofs, but, really, when you get down to it, who cares?

name: Questhead
description: People always put this hat on when they need help with something. They stand in the same place all day long and repeat the same tired guilt trips hundreds of times a day, just like the self-professed charitable souls you always meet in the centre of Amakna. What an exciting life they lead!

name: Akornaddikt Boots
description: Perfect for all your country walks, these boots will help you become friends with the animals!

name: Red Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Yellow Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Ringnomen Tengu
description: Fin Fang: two opposing yet balanced forces. Light and Dark. Good and Evil. Surf and Turf.

name: Adora Briefs
description: If you were only wearing this, you'd look like an idiot. A super cute idiot, sure, but an idiot all the same. Ah, who cares? You don't need to be smart to be attractive.

name: Samurai Belt
description: Sometimes used to discipline insolent young Iops, this solid belt is usually worn pulled quite tightly, to hold in the paunch. This style is particularly popular with King Allister's personal guards.

name: Flying Shield
description: As strange as it might sound, some say this shield of wood and hair enables the lightest adventurers to become airborne for a brief moment... a final attempt to shock their enemies before falling flat on their faces.

name: Fortifying Ring
description: The tradition of passing this ring down from grandfather to grandson gives it incredible power. This one is but a pale imitation of the original, but even so, it is much sought-after by collectors, whether they are Enutrof or not.

name: Arachelmet
description: You'll look like a wild Arachnee if you wear this Arachelmet. What will that achieve? Well, you might scare off some flies.

name: Blue Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried blue Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Spacevader Belt
description: When this belt is equipped, you will feel like a true hero, able to single-handedly tear any army to shreds. Now you just have to find an army willing to let you do it.

name: Pacmamulet
description: Whatever you do, don't give this amulet to a child: they'll want to chew on the ghost beads, and will die instantly. Strangely enough, chewing a special kind of gum will turn these dangerous ghosts into a tasty, and quite harmless, delicacy.

name: Ol' John's Troma
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Ringeisha
description: Despite what you may think, this ring isn't worn on your finger. Certain Osamodas tried to wear it in other ways during certain of their ceremonies - they had some problems.

name: Pink Dragooboots
description: These boots aren't quite as classy as those made of white dragon scales, but they're still pretty popular with adolescents looking to find gear that matches their Adora Set.

name: Khan Karkass's Necklace
description: Inspire terror among your adversaries by wearing this necklace in the form of a skull, the symbol of strength and brutality. If Khan does it, it must mean it works!

name: Purple Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried purple Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Green Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Captain Chafer's Spare Panties
description: Captain Chafer's real panties, which were very tight and very leathery, disappeared along with their owner. Luckily for us, the famous tango dancer left behind various pairs of worn undies that perverse tailors were able to use for inspiration. This pair of Spare Panties has a comfortable, elasticated waistband and an affordable pricetag. It's even reversible, so you can use it twice (or four times)!

name: Vital Belt
description: This belt increases its wearer's Vitality, increasing their chances of surviving a fight.

name: Pink Piwi Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll look ridiculous but you'll be just adorable. Life is a matter of choices.

name: Wisdom Ring
description: This ring increases the wearer's Wisdom.

name: Arachnoring
description: This ridiculously small ring will help you overcome your Arachnophobia once and for all.

name: Rainbow Necklace
description: Collectors prize this necklace, you will certainly get a good price for it.

name: Krokette Amulet
description: This amulet turns pink when you're feeling perky. Rumour has it that it also increases your chances of finding good items tenfold.

name: Adventurer Cloak
description: Classy but not very effective, this cloak will suit young adventurers nonetheless.

name: Red Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Chance Ring
description: This ring increases the wearer's Chance.

name: Agility Ring
description: This ring increases the wearer's Agility.

name: Blue Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Yellow Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: Nimble Belt
description: This belt increases its wearer's Agility.

name: Adventurer Ring
description: A small but pleasing ring for beginners which will amuse young children, or Ecaflips.

name: Red Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: Phan Diadem
description: Thanks to the light coming from this headpiece, no one will be able to surprise you, which is a useful feature for walking around Incarnam in peace.

name: Pink Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried pink Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Blue Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Green Piwi Hat
description: With this hat on, you'll look ridiculous but you'll be just adorable. Life is a matter of choices.

name: Reinforced Handbag
description: This bag has long been popular in Incarnam. Lady adventurers find it as elegant as they do practical; gentleman adventurers use it to hold the detached teeth of their enemies.

name: Bear Amulet
description: This amulet increases the wearer's Strength.

name: Wolf Amulet
description: This amulet increases the wearer's Vitality.

name: Sykee Cape
description: If you haven't got a lively spirit and a virtuous spirit, you can at least look like you do, thanks to these wings made from pure celestial matter.

name: Strong Belt
description: This belt increases its wearer's Strength.

name: Nexus's Boots
description: These boots once belonged to the great knight Nexus - the poor bugger was frozen for eternity.

name: Purple Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Owl Amulet
description: This amulet increases the wearer's Intelligence.

name: Ring of Satisfaction
description: This ring increases AP in exchange for some Strength, Intelligence, Agility and Chance.

name: Yellow Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Bluish Cloak
description: This cloak increases chance.

name: Green Piwi Amulet
description: This amulet seems to have been made with a small, dried green Piwi head. Vanity knows no bounds.

name: Purple Piwi Sandals
description: They're perfect for protecting your little feet and squashing small creatures that crawl through the grass, like Xelors or Eniripsas for example.

name: Animulette
description: The legend says that this amulet contains the soul of a powerful magician who challenged and defeated Ecaflip at celestial belote, the favourite card game of the Twelve. If you wear it around your neck while playing cards, maybe he'll help…

name: Chance Boots
description: These boots increase your luck in finding powerful items such as Gobball Slobber.

name: Red Piwi Belt
description: This small belt will accentuate your hips if you're fighting in front of important people. It's also handy for holding your guts in if a plain boar rips you open in the depths of a forest.

name: Pandawa
description: Ah, the Pandawa, look at the face on him! Just like his good friend Makroute, he spends all his time on his owner's head. This lazy beast never needs to move more than an arm's length - he steals all he needs straight from his owners hands!

name: Kluh's Boots
description: These boots increase your Strength but they affect your Intelligence. They could even turn you into a Iop in case of prolonged and regular use.

name: Adventurer Amulet
description: Not too classy or even powerful, but it's better when you've collected the whole set.

name: Blue Piwi Cape
description: If you're small enough, this cape of Piwi feathers may cover up your behind. Some modest protection that will at least draw attention away from your greasy hair and horrible warts.

name: Yellow Piwi Hat
description: Some people might think you look ridiculous wearing this hat, others will find you adorable. That's life.

name: Sram Amulet
description: Handmade by one of the greatest Sram jewellers, this amulet is made of small skulls carved in bone, helping its wearer escape perilous situations.

name: Crab Belt
description: That strange belt is made entirely of fragments of crab claws and carapaces. Even with its powerful magic, it will smell of fish forever and ever. You'd just better get used to it.

name: Pink Piwi Ring
description: This ring will allow your lover to find you, no matter where you are.

name: Intelligence Sandals
description: These sandals increase the intelligence of the wearer. They are also eternally fashionable. They are finished off with a breathable walnut sole for exquisite grip.

name: Makroute
description: Makroute is a very affectionate dog. He never leaves his master's side. A fine animal.

name: Royal Gantie
description: Don't mind its stuck-up name, this ring can only make your hero stronger. Okay, his chin will shrink too, but hey, who cares!

name: Nimble Boots
description: These boots increase the Agility of the wearer so that he can get into character as a Tofu every time he feels like making a fool of himself.

name: Small Harvester Bag
description:
This bag has been designed to hold a few collectible resources.
Only true harvesters can carry it.

name: Mori Arty's Cloak
description: This authentic bad guy cloak proves you belong to the gang of the diabolic Mori Arty. It is said that his bad luck equalled his astounding intelligence. Only true bad guys can wear it.

name: Dofawa
description: This Dofus is worryingly similar to a wild Dragoturkey egg. For once, appearances might not be misleading.

name: Wild Sunflower Shield
description: You'll have to hold tight to this shield because it will always try to turn towards the sun.

name: Einekeineux
description: These boots bring good fortune. Unfortunately, they decrease your resistance.

name: Handbag
description: This small bag, created by Poss'Ybel, is all the rage in Incarnam. Adventurers find it as practical as it is elegant. The more experienced ones keep the teeth they tear from the mouths of their enemies in it.

name: Gobball Tear
description: If we are to believe one renowned adventurer, this amulet contains a tear from a Gobball, which has the same properties and stench as Gobball Leather tea.

name: Camate
description: This ring influences your fate. You'll be tougher but less lucky. In other words, you improve your chances of living a long time and ruin your chances of living happily.

name: Mulish Cat's Boots
description: Mulish Cat was a renowned Ecaflip, and the most stupid in his class. In combat, the only match for his nonexistent intelligence was his bewildering luck.

name: Gobball Boots
description: These boots are made of Gobball leather. Thanks to the smell they give off, breeders can approach and kill other Gobballs with the slightest of ease.

name: Pandawushu Headband
description: With this Pandawushu Headband around your skull, you'll be able to scare away young Lenalds pretending to be martial arts Masters. Don't forget to bawl a bit of a war cry to be more convincing.

name: Tofu Sandals
description: These sandals are made from the feathers of boiled Tofu and the sole from Tofu Beak, a very resistant material. Protracted wearing can render the wearer as daft as a Tofu.

name: Puny Owl Pendant
description: The jeweller's hand slipped while shaping this amulet, which imparts more intelligence to the wearer but in exchange, imparts a tear-inducing migraine, making it almost impossible to see anything.

name: Komintot Headband
description: The Komintot increases the Wisdom of the wearer.

name: Vitality Headband
description: This headband increases Vitality.

name: Vital Ring
description: This small ring increases Life.

name: Smoother
description: The Smoother resists magic damage.

name: Fecaflip
description: This magnificent pair of boots converts a bit of your Strength into Intelligence.

name: Strong Ring
description: This small ring increases Strength.

name: Nimble Ring
description: Amaknian collectors are desperate to get their fingers into this ring, though it's not worth a penny.

name: Small Magic Ring
description: This small ring increases Intelligence.

name: Little Frog
description: This small amulet increases Agility.

name: Wedding Ring
description: This wedding ring will satisfy the most mercenary of fathers-in-law.

name: Earth Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Air Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Tude Amulet
description: This amulet was made in the Tude manner, hence its name. It is one of the earliest and simplest forms of jewellery, and so it is used to train apprentice jewellers. It is true that the thing is not very powerful, but you can't have it all, can you?

name: Training Shield
description: This shield is given to disciples who don't know how to correctly use a shield yet. Its durability's pretty questionable; it's a good bet that it will fly apart into splinters before long.

name: Issa Mess
description: After several nights of hard work, the most famous jeweller in Astrub, also known for being raised by Bworks, announced to an astounded crowd: "c u l8r @ d gld hs". Even the renowned historian Champo Lhyon didn't manage to decipher the jeweller's message.

name: Livitinem Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate items of headgear. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Trophy Moon Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Trophy Dragon Pig Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Intrepid Amulet
description: No one has a clue what powers this amulet brings, but everyone knows what it takes away: your credibility.

name: Parasymbic Cape
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Alyverol Boots
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate boots. (You must feed these living boots by giving them other boots to eat. You can feed them a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Shushivin Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate items of headgear. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Weighted Wooden Wings
description: These wings won't let you soar: they were merely built to scuttle Kat, Zen and Jammer.

name: Coulive Headgear
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate hats. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Coulive Cloak
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Ano Rexik Ring
description: This strange little ring can increase the Agility of the wearer in exchange for Chance points.

name: Brakmarian Cloak
description: This cloak allows you to remain incognito in a cemetery, or to transform yourself at will into a female Chafer. Both these things are entirely useless to anyone but the most criminally perverse among us.

name: Bride Hat
description: This wonderful 100% southern larva silk hat, washable in fresh water, will make your beloved melt like a Mint Jelly in the sun.

name: S'loque Cape
description: This padded cape absorbs all surrounding noise, plunging the wearer into a lifetime of incredibly awkward silences.

name: Pluswan
description: This small ring has no use beside making you look extremely flashy. Now people might actually want to talk to you.

name: Livitinem Amulet
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate amulets. (You must feed this living amulet by giving it other amulets to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Trophy Soft Oak Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Trophy Kimbo Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Trophy Bworker Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Intrepid Boots
description: Warm on the inside and cold on the outside, these boots will let you kick snowmen's arses without melting their pert little buttocks.

name: Parasymbic Boots
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate boots. (You must feed these living boots by giving them other boots to eat. You can feed them a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Incarnam Shield
description: With this shield, everyone can see that you've left Incarnam and joined the World of Twelve to set off on the long search for the Dofus.

name: Alyverol Cape
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Alyverol Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate items of headgear. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Kamabelt
description: Wear this belt on your first day at a new school and you'll have tons of friends in no time! Of course, nothing's to say they'll stick around when they find out you're flat broke in reality.

name: Shushivin Cape
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Monstralive Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate items of headgear. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Koober's Belt
description: This belt is all the rage among young Amaknians. A follower of Sadida, couturier by trade, is behind this fashion. When he sold it for the first time, he said: "Life is short, play hard!"

name: Small Chance Ring
description: This ring increases the wearer's chance.

name: Chance Belt
description: This basic belt increases luck.

name: Fire Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Water Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Light Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Life Artefact
description: The story of this artefact originates from a very ancient legend but its real power is yet to be revealed.

name: Small Gobbly Wool Bag
description: Don't expect this bag to make a hero of you. It will keep all your personal items in one place. Better than nothing, I suppose.

name: Groom Hat
description: You'll be irresistible with this hat. You'll break hearts and discover the true meaning of Glory!

name: Basic Cloak
description: This cloak is made of Gobball Wool. It's neither classy nor attractive. Don't bother with it, basically.

name: Scratched Imp Shield
description: This shield has seen a few battles too many and in this state is good for nothing. Bouwada, in Pandala village, might be able to replace it for you.

name: Flud
description: The Flud is not really a hat. It's more of a parasite that tends to develop on loud or aggressive people's heads. Its disgusting appearance repels all and sundry, compelling its wearer to scream even louder which is useless since these people have nothing to say anyway.

name: Muffin Belt
description: This belt must be worn tight... so tight that it forces its wearer to stammer, shake and generally jerk around in the inimitable style of Thrustin Timbertake.

name: Livitinem Cape
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Livitinem Ring
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate rings. (You must feed this living ring by giving it other rings to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Trophy Dark Vlad Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Trophy Koolich Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Trophy Sphincter Cell Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Intrepid Belt
description: Having problems hiding your dagger in your underwear? No problem, you can wedge it between your love handles and this belt.

name: Intrepid Cloak
description: You'll be able to fly with this cape around your shoulders. Just close your eyes, clench your fists, open your mouth, stretch out your arms and jump off a cliff shouting "I can fly!". Moments later, you'll wake up with two broken legs.

name: Intrepid Hat
description: This shoddy hat admirably hides your baldness. Unfortunately, it's not big enough to hide your false modesty.

name: Parasymbic Belt
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate belts. (You must feed this living belt by giving it other belts to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Kwismas Treetop
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Lumberjack Shield
description: This shield used to protect lumberjacks from falling trees. Its function quickly changed, and now it is more often used to protect warriors from enemies who tend to land on them without warning!

name: Coulive Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate hats. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Weighted Helmet
description: This helmet was designed for a single purpose: to prevent Goblins from getting to Moon Island. Don't look for another use for it, as you'll only end up disappointed.

name: Pirate Cloak
description: This cloak once belonged to Zokrim, an old pirate. He must have been rather unlucky.

name: Farter
description: The Farter protects you from physical damage.

name: Bontarian Cloak
description: This cloak gives you wings of a sort. The smoke it gives off when you burn it... you'll be high as a kite.

name: Pumpkwin Head
description:
With this magic Pumpkwin on your head, you'll look even more idiotic than usual. But remember the Al Howin curse. Yes, the curse that transforms creatures into misshapen beasts.
It seems that this headgear is the only thing that can protect you from this terrible curse.

name: Pineapi Boots
description: These boots smell of Pineapi juice marinated with wet socks. The great thing is that when you visit your friends, they will never ask you to take your shoes off.

name: Trophy Wa Wabbit Shield
description: Hold it high and proud, because this trophy is all that will be left of your glory when you're gone.

name: Intrepid Ring
description: You've heard of the game "Pick it, lick it, roll it, flick it", right? Well this ring will protect you from the flicked stuff.

name: Intrepid Shield
description: This shield won't protect you from your own stupidity.

name: Alyverol Belt
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate belts. (You must feed this living belt by giving it other belts to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Kamaflops
description: These flip-flops leave kama prints behind you when you walk along the beach. Just don't be surprised when you're trying to watch the sunset from an isolated cove and a horde of voracious treasure hunters show up, thinking they're onto something.

name: Coulive Cape
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate capes. (You must feed this living cape by giving it other capes to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Coulive Shield
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate shields. (You must feed this living shield by giving it other shields to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Courageous Ring
description: You won't be able to rule them all with this ring, but you will at least feel more powerful when you put it on. It's a start.

name: Koliet Aclou
description: This amulet tickles your curiosity… and your neck.

name: Strength Boots
description: These boots increase the Strength of the wearer in exchange for Agility, making them totally unlike a Tofu in all but intelligence.

name: Hogmeiser's Worn Boots
description: These boots belonged to Hogmeiser for many years. They are so worn they are crippling. A skilled shoemaker should be able to repair them.

name: Crashers
description: These getas are so light that they make their owner run and jump all over the place whenever some action starts. Experienced adventurers just hate them... Every Tom Dick and Harry comes and crashes their fights uninvited.

name: Crack Sparrow’s Own Withered Hat
description: You say that a kraken, with the foulest breath you’ve ever seen, follows you wherever you go? Well, deal with it: it’s only a tiny inconvenience that comes with the hat!

name: Parasymbic Hat
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate items of headgear. (You must feed this living hat by giving it other hats to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)

name: Coulive Buckler
description: This polymorphic item establishes a predatory or symbiotic relationship with inanimate shields. (You must feed this living shield by giving it other shields to eat. You can feed it a new meal every twelve hours.)
